'''Fabinho''' is a Portuguese given name, a [[diminutive form]] of the Portuguese name "little [[Fábio]]". Portuguese also has an [[augmentative form]] of the name, Fabão, "big Fábio".
== Brazilian football == * [[Fábio de Souza (footballer born 1975)]] * [[Fábio de Jesus (Fabinho)]] (born 1976), for Santos, Internacional, Fluminense * [[Fábio Trinidade da Silveira]] (born 1977) * [[Fábio Alves Félix]] (born 1980), player for Corinthians, Santos, Cruzeiro, Bahia * [[Fabinho Recife]] (born 1982) * [[Fábio de Matos Pereira]] (born 1982) * [[Fábio Alves|Fábio Alves Macedo]] (born 1985), player for Philadelphian Union in the USA * [[Fábio Ayres]] (born 1991) * [[Fabinho (footballer, born 1993)]], plays for Liverpool * [[:pt:Fábio da Silva Azevedo]], for Flamengo. * [[:pt:Fábio Rodrigues da Silva]], for Internacional, fastest goal in history in FIFA.
{{given name}}<!-- It does not help to add disambig or hndis tags where the page only contains people who share a given name -->

team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps3 = 24 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | club-update = 09:44, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:33, 19 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Virgil van Dijk''' ({{IPA-nl|vɑn ˈdɛik}}; born 8 July 1991) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for English {{English football updater|Liverpool}} club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[captain (association football)|captains]] the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].
After beginning his career with [[FC Groningen|Groningen]], he moved to [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in 2013, where he won the [[Scottish Premiership]] and was named in the [[PFA Scotland Team of the Year]] in both of his seasons, also winning the [[Scottish League Cup]] in the latter. In September 2015, he joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. He joined Liverpool in January 2018 for £75 million, a [[List of most expensive association football transfers|world record transfer fee]] for a defender.<ref name=BBCLiverpool/> Van Dijk was involved in reaching the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] during his first spring at Liverpool.
Van Dijk made his international debut for the Netherlands in 2015 and became captain of his country in 2018.
==Club career== ===Groningen=== Van Dijk was born in [[Breda]] to a Dutch father and Surinamese mother.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.celticfc.net/newsstory?item=4174 |title=News |publisher=Celtic F.C. |accessdate=16 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029210911/http://www.celticfc.net/newsstory?item=4174 |archivedate=29 October 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He began his career with a right-back, but moved to centre-back after growing 18 centimetres during the summer.<ref name="bbc.co.uk">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47283936|title=Virgil van Dijk wants to be 'a legend of Liverpool' - in-depth wide-ranging BBC interview|date=21 February 2019|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
He started his career with [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]] before transferring to [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] in 2010.<ref name="bbc.co.uk"/> As a youth player he initially combined playing with his job as a dishwasher in a restaurant.<ref name="bbc.co.uk"/>
He made his professional debut for Groningen coming on as a 72nd-minute substitute for [[Petter Andersson]] during the 4–2 victory against [[ADO Den Haag]] on 1 May 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2011/05/01/netherlands/eredivisie/hfc-ado-den-haag/stichting-fc-groningen/941703/ |title=ADO Den Haag VS. Groningen 2–4 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform group |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> During the 2011–12 season, Van Dijk made 23 league appearances for the [[Eredivisie]] team, scoring his first professional goal during the 6–0 victory against [[Feyenoord]] on 30 October 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbox.com/blog/virgil-van-dijk-premier-league/ |title=Virgil van Dijk One of the Finest Centre-Backs in the Premier League |website=Soccer Box}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fcupdate.nl/voetbaluitslagen/152437/eredivisie-fc-groningen-feyenoord/ |title=Wedstrijd: FC Groningen – Feyenoord |website=FCUpdate.nl}}</ref> He scored his second professional goal for Groningen on 22 January 2012 against [[Heracles Almelo]] in a 2–1 victory before scoring again the following week during a 4–1 defeat to [[FC Twente]]. Van Dijk scored his first goal of the season on 7 October 2012, in a 2–2 draw with Feyenoord.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/10/07/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-groningen/feyenoord-rotterdam-nv/1290489/ |title=Groningen vs. Feyenoord – 7 October 2012 |website=Soccerway |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref> He also scored in the reverse fixture against Feyenoord, on 23 December, in a 1–2 defeat.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/12/23/netherlands/eredivisie/feyenoord-rotterdam-nv/stichting-fc-groningen/1290578/ |title=Feyenoord vs. Groningen – 23 December 2012 |website=Soccerway |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref>
===Celtic=== ====2013–14 season==== On 21 June 2013, Van Dijk signed with [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] for a fee of around £2.6 million, on a four-year deal including a 10% selling-on fee for Groningen.<ref>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk: Dutch defender joins Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23004736 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 June 2013 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut on 17 August, replacing [[Efe Ambrose]] for the final 13 minutes of a 2–0 [[Scottish Premiership]] win over [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]] at [[Pittodrie Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Keir |last=Murray |title=Aberdeen 0–2 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23644812 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2013 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> A week later, he made his first start, in a 2–2 draw with [[Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.|Inverness Caledonian Thistle]] at [[Celtic Park]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Celtic 2–2 Inverness CT |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23737036 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 9 November, Van Dijk scored his first Celtic goals, heading one in each half of a 4–1 win against [[Ross County F.C.|Ross County]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Martin |last=Conaghan |title=Ross County 1–4 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24783003 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 November 2013 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> After a solo run, he scored within five minutes the only goal of a victory over [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]] on 26 December.<ref>{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Campbell |title=St Johnstone 0–1 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25442036 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
Van Dijk scored again on 26 January 2014, in a 4–0 win versus [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] for Celtic's 11th consecutive league win.<ref>{{cite news |first=Keir |last=Murray |title=Hibernian 0–4 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25798579 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 January 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 25 February, he was sent off after 13 minutes of an eventual 2–1 loss at Aberdeen, for a professional foul on [[Peter Pawlett]]; it was Celtic's first defeat of the season.<ref>{{cite news |first=Andrew |last=Southwick |title=Aberdeen 2–1 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25892139 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> With Celtic having already won the league, Van Dijk netted again on 7 May to put his team 3–1 up away to St Johnstone, in an eventual 3–3 draw.<ref>{{cite news |first=Cheri |last=Burns |title=St Johnstone 3–3 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27216459 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2015}}</ref> He was one of three Celtic players named in the [[PFA Scotland Team of the Year]].<ref name=1314PFA>{{cite news |title=Celtic and Dundee United trios in SPFL Premiership team of year |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27080030 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== [[File:Virgil van Dijk 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Van Dijk playing for [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in 2015]]
On 22 July 2014, Van Dijk and [[Teemu Pukki]] each scored twice in a 4–0 home win over [[Knattspyrnufélag Reykjavíkur|KR]] in a [[UEFA Champions League]] qualifier, putting their team into the next round 5–0 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ben |last=Burrows |title=Celtic 4–0 KR Reykjavik: Hoops ease into next Champions League round in comfortable fashion |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/celtic-4-0-kr-reykjavik-hoops-3897700 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=22 July 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2015}}</ref> His first goal of the [[2014–15 Scottish Premiership|Premiership season]] came on 9 November, finishing from [[Stefan Johansen]]'s last-minute corner for a 2–1 win at Aberdeen.<ref>{{cite news |first=Colin |last=Moffat |title=Aberdeen 1–2 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29868766 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 November 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Three weeks later, Van Dijk scored the first and last goals of Celtic's 4–0 win versus [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Heart of Midlothian]] in the fourth round of the [[Scottish Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Andrew |last=Southwick |title=Heart of Midlothian 0–4 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30166217 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Four days after that, his sixth goal of the season was enough for victory in a home match against [[Glasgow]] neighbours [[Partick Thistle F.C.|Partick Thistle]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Richard |last=Wilson |title=Celtic 1–0 Partick Thistle |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28647040 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 December 2014 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
Van Dijk was again on target on 21 January 2015, opening a 4–0 home win over [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Colin |last=Moffat |title=Celtic 4–0 Motherwell |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30808448 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 January 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 26 February, he was sent off in the 36th minute against [[Inter Milan]] for a foul on [[Mauro Icardi]], as Celtic lost 1–0 on the night, 4–3 on aggregate in the last 32 of the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Craig |last=Swan |title=Inter 1 Celtic 0 (4–3 agg): Late strike finishes off battling ten-man Celtic and ends their Europa League run |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/inter-1-celtic-0-4-3-5239236 |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow |date=26 February 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> He was again sent off on 8 March in the Cup quarter-final away to [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] at [[Tannadice Park]], receiving a red card after eleven minutes for a confrontation with [[Calum Butcher]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Keir |last=Murray |title=Dundee United 1–1 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31680308 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 March 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> His suspension for the following week's [[2015 Scottish League Cup Final|Scottish League Cup Final]] was overturned on appeal, as was that of [[Paul Paton]], who was sent off when mistaken for Butcher.<ref>{{cite news |title=Van Dijk and Paton cleared to play in League Cup final |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31858622 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 March 2015 |accessdate=18 October 2015}}</ref> Van Dijk played the full 90 minutes of the final at [[Hampden Park]], which Celtic won 2–0.<ref name=2015SLC>{{cite news |first=Richard |last=Wilson |title=Dundee United 0–2 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31785677 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 18 March, Celtic's third consecutive match against Dundee United, Van Dijk scored in the last minute to confirm a 4–0 win in a Cup replay.<ref>{{cite news |title=Celtic 4–0 Dundee United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31826157 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 March 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
On 19 April, Celtic contested the Cup semi-final against Inverness at Hampden, and Van Dijk opened the scoring with a free kick. After the dismissal of goalkeeper [[Craig Gordon]], Celtic fell 3–2, ending their chance of a [[Treble (association football)|treble]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Clive |last=Lindsay |title=Inverness Caledonian Thistle 3–2 Celtic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32089585 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Three days later, again from a free kick, he confirmed a 2–1 win away to [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Andrew |last=Southwick |title=Celtic 1–2 Dundee |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31827990 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> His team again won the league, and Van Dijk was included in the league's Team of the Season for the second consecutive campaign.<ref name=1415PFA>{{cite news |first=Gregor |last=Kyle |title=The SPFL dream team: PFA Scotland announce their teams of the year |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/spfl-dream-team-pfa-scotland-5616035 |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow |date=1 May 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
Van Dijk was reportedly "considering his future" in Glasgow after Celtic were knocked out of the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]] in the qualifying rounds to [[Malmö FF|Malmö]] of Sweden.<ref>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk: Celtic defender considers future after defeat |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34060123 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 August 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
===Southampton=== On 1 September 2015, Van Dijk signed a five-year contract with [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for a reported £13 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite web |title=Saints complete deadline-day deal for van Dijk |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2015-09-01/saints-complete-deadline-day-deal-for-van-dijk |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=1 September 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk: Southampton sign Celtic defender for £13m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34115519 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
==== 2015–16 season ==== He made his debut for Southampton on 12 September in a 0–0 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at [[The Hawthorns]].<ref name="sb1516" /> Two weeks later, Van Dijk marked his third Premier League appearance with his first goal for the club, which came in the form of a header in the 11th minute to put Southampton in front, following a set-piece from [[James Ward-Prowse]] in a 3–1 home win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=Southampton 3–1 Swansea City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34299542 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 August 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 7 May 2016, Van Dijk signed a new six-year contract with the Saints.<ref>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk: Dutch defender signs new six-year deal at Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36236667 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2016 |accessdate=8 May 2016}}</ref>
==== 2016–17 season ==== On 22 January 2017, he was named team captain of Southampton, after the departure of [[José Fonte]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-01-22/claude-puel-captains-southampton-virgil-van-dijk-steven-davis |title=Puel confirms Saints' new captains |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=22 January 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On the same day, he suffered an ankle injury against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Charles |title=Southampton's Virgil van Dijk out for at least two months with ankle injury |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11700/10753362/southamptons-virgil-van-dijk-out-for-at-least-two-months-with-ankle-injury |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 February 2017 |accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref> This ruled him out of the [[2017 EFL Cup Final]], which Southampton lost to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Manchester United 3–2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39018813 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
After a successful [[2016–17 Southampton F.C. season|2016–17 season]] at Southampton, Van Dijk was subject to interest from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], who apologised to Southampton for an illegal approach for the player after having reportedly made clear his interest in a move to Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40194862 |title=Virgil van Dijk: Liverpool apologise & end interest in Southampton defender |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 June 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40164572 |title=Virgil van Dijk: Southampton defender keen on Liverpool move |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 June 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40170351 |title=Virgin van Dijk: Southampton to report Liverpool over approach |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 June 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 7 August 2017, Van Dijk handed in a transfer request to Southampton and released a statement along with it, emphasising his wish to join a different club in the transfer window.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40855579 |title=Virgil van Dijk: Southampton defender hands in transfer request |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
==== 2017–18 season ==== Van Dijk remained with Southampton for the start of the [[2017–18 Southampton F.C. season|2017–18 season]] and made his first appearance since being injured in January, coming on as a late substitute in a 1–0 victory at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 26 September.<ref>{{cite news |first=Luke |last=Reddy |title=Crystal Palace 1–0 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41210053 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 September 2017 |accessdate=25 September 2017}}</ref> He made what turned out to be his final appearance for Southampton on 13 December 2017, in a 4–1 home defeat to Leicester.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42247116 |title=Southampton 1–4 Leicester City |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 December 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> It was also his last appearance in any of Southampton's matchday squads, as he was omitted from the squad for the rest of his tenure at the club in light of speculation surrounding his future.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/virgil-van-dijk-transfer-news-manchester-city-liverpool-left-out-of-squad-60m-latest-updates-a8128666.html |title=Virgil van Dijk left out of Southampton squad as Mauricio Pellegrino refuses to draw on Manchester City interest |first=Jack |last=De Menezes |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=26 December 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 27 December 2017, it was announced that Van Dijk would join Liverpool when the winter transfer window opened on 1 January 2018<ref name=pressLiverpool>{{cite web |title=Liverpool agree deal to sign Virgil van Dijk |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/285500-liverpool-agree-deal-to-sign-virgil-van-dijk |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=27 December 2017 |accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref><ref name=southamptonpress>{{cite web |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-12-27/virgil-van-dijk-southampton-liverpool-transfer-agreement-announcement |title=Van Dijk deal agreed |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=27 December 2017 |accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref> for a reported fee of £75 million.<ref name=BBCLiverpool>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk: Liverpool to sign Southampton defender for world record £75m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42496637 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 December 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Former club Celtic would receive 10% of Van Dijk's transfer fee, due to a sell-on clause placed in his Southampton contract.<ref name=BBCLiverpool/><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11787/10906958/virgil-van-dijk-transfer-would-land-celtic-bumper-windfall |title=Virgil van Dijk transfer would land Celtic bumper windfall |first=Peter |last=Gilbert |publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 June 2017 |accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref> Southampton claimed the undisclosed transfer fee would constitute a world record fee in football for a defender.<ref name=southamptonpress/>
==== 2017–18 season ==== He made his debut for Liverpool on 5 January in the third round of the [[FA Cup]] and scored the winning goal with a late header in a 2–1 victory against local rivals [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Liverpool 2–1 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42508636 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 January 2018 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> In doing so, he became the first player since [[Bill White (footballer, born 1877)|Bill White]] in 1901 to score on his debut in the [[Merseyside derby]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/how-virgil-van-dijk-keeps-14120970 |title=How Virgil van Dijk keeps on creating Liverpool history – and the remarkable numbers behind derby triumph |work=Liverpool Echo |last=Doyle |first=Ian |date=6 January 2018 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Van Dijk and [[Dejan Lovren]] built a strong partnership at the heart of Liverpool's defence, with the Dutchman being credited for improving Liverpool's previous defensive issues.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-champions-final-vandijk/van-dijk-has-made-me-a-better-player-says-liverpools-lovren-idUKKCN1IN301 |title=Van Dijk has made me a better player, says Liverpool's Lovren |last=Robinson |first=Neil |agency=Reuters |date=22 May 2018 |accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/apr/09/virgil-van-dijk-brings-calm-and-confidence-to-liverpool |title=Virgil van Dijk brings calm and collective spirit to Liverpool's defence |last=Hunter |first=Andy |date=9 April 2018 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/how-virgil-van-dijk-redefined-12213864 |title=How dominant Virgil van Dijk has redefined Liverpool's defence |last=Maddock |first=David |date=19 March 2018 |work=Daily Mirror |accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref>
Van Dijk was included in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the Season|UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season]], despite playing just half of the season in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], with the ''UEFA Technical Observers'' saying: "Van Dijk arrived at [[Anfield]] and provided composure and stability in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|competition's knockout stages]]." Van Dijk played the full 90 minutes in the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], which Liverpool lost 1–3.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000885/match=2021711/index.html |title=UEFA Champions League – Real Madrid-Liverpool |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=6 July 2018}}</ref> Van Dijk played 22 games in all competitions in his first season with the club, scoring 1 goal.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://us.soccerway.com/players/virgil-van-dijk/188624/ |title=Netherlands – V. van Dijk – Profile |website=soccerway |accessdate=6 July 2018}}</ref>
==== 2018–19 season ==== On 20 August 2018, Van Dijk was voted [[Player of the match|Man of the Match]] by [[BBC Sport]] and [[Sky Sports]] for his performance in a 2–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45165666 |title=Crystal Palace 0–2 Liverpool: James Milner and Sadio Mane score as Reds move to six points |date=20 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/c-palace-vs-liverpool/390771 |title=Crystal Palace 0–2 Liverpool: James Milner and Sadio Mane see off 10-man Eagles |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref> Van Dijk received the [[2018–19 Liverpool F.C. season#Liverpool Standard Chartered Player of the Month award|Liverpool Standard Chartered Player of the Month]] award for his performances in August.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/316051-virgil-van-dijk-standard-chartered-player-of-the-month |title=Virgil van Dijk named Standard Chartered Player of the Month |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 2 December, Van Dijk was awarded an assist for the winning goal in a [[Merseyside derby|derby]] match against city rivals Everton. Liverpool won 1–0 thanks to Divock Origi's 96th minute goal, set up by a Van Dijk volley and a subsequent error from Everton goalkeeper [[Jordan Pickford]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/3716494/liverpools-virgil-van-dijk-gets-assist-vs-everton-despite-ball-hitting-crossbar-twice |title=Van Dijk gets 'assist' despite ball hitting crossbar TWICE |date=3 December 2018 |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=21 December 2018}}</ref> The Dutchman was ultimately awarded the [[Professional Footballers' Association|PFA]] Player of the Month for November 2018.<ref name="LFCPFA">{{cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/327733-virgil-van-dijk-pfa-player-of-the-month |title=Van Dijk wins PFA Player of the Month award |author=Carroll, James |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=3 December 2018 |accessdate=21 December 2018}}</ref> On 21 December, Van Dijk scored his first goal in the Premier League for Liverpool in a 2–0 away win against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref name="Guardian">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/21/wolves-liverpool-premier-league-match-report |title=Liverpool's Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk put Wolves in their place |last=James |first=Stuart |work=The Guardian |date=21 December 2018 |accessdate=22 December 2018}}</ref> The Dutchman continued his impressive form in the 2018–19 season by winning the Premier League Player of the Month prize for December 2018. <ref>{{cite web |last1=Matchett |first1=Karl |title=Liverpool scoop double Manager and Player of the Month awards for December |url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2019/01/liverpool-scoop-double-manager-and-player-of-the-month-awards-for-impressive-december-form/ |website=thisisanfield.com |publisher=Soccer Publishing Limited|accessdate=20 January 2019}}</ref>
On 27 February 2019, Van Dijk scored twice in a 5–0 win against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/liverpool-vs-watford/391033 |title=Liverpool 5-0 Watford |work=SkySports |accessdate=28 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Van Dijk made his full international debut for [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] on 10 October 2015, in a 2–1 victory away from home against [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2016]] qualifier.<ref>{{cite web |title=Successful Saturday for Saints stars |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2015-10-10/successful-saturday-for-saints-stars |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=10 October 2015 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
He was awarded the [[captain (association football)|captain]]cy of his country by manager [[Ronald Koeman]] on 22 March 2018,<ref>{{cite news |title=Van Dijk named new Netherlands captain |first=Daniel |last=Karell |date=22 March 2018 |accessdate=22 March 2018 |work=soccer.nbcsports.com |publisher=NBC Sports |url=http://soccer.nbcsports.com/2018/03/22/van-dijk-named-new-netherlands-captain/}}</ref> and his first match as captain was a 1–0 home friendly defeat by [[England national football team|England]] the next day.<ref>{{cite news |title=Netherlands 0–1 England |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=23 March 2018 |accessdate=24 March 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43380175}}</ref> On 26 March, he scored his first international goal to conclude a 3–0 win over European champions [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at the [[Stade de Genève]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Soccer – Portugal suffer first-half collapse in 3–0 loss to Dutch |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-friendly-por-ned/soccer-portugal-suffer-first-half-collapse-in-3-0-loss-to-dutch-idUKKBN1H22S7 |accessdate=26 March 2018 |agency=Reuters |date=26 March 2018}}</ref> On 13 October, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]] champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in the [[2018–19 UEFA Nations League|UEFA Nations League]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45851123 |title=Netherlands 3–0 Germany: Liverpool's Virgil van Dijk and Georginio Wijnaldum score for hosts |date=13 October 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 October 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Van Dijk is a right-footed [[centre back]], who usually features on the left-hand side of central defence, although he can also play as a right-sided centre back.<ref name=NMcG>{{cite news |title=Virgil van Dijk 'can be a great' as Liverpool agree to pay £75m for defender |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40730793 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 December 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
Neil McGuinness, senior scout at Celtic when Van Dijk was signed, called him "everything you would want if you could create a profile of the ideal central defender", praising him as a "very smooth ball-playing defender" who possesses aerial prowess, skills from dead ball situations, and "strong leadership qualities", while commenting that since his move to England, he is "more tactically aware now [...] his anticipation and timing has improved and he is a lot more of an all-rounder".<ref name=NMcG/> McGuinness believes Van Dijk's "biggest problem" is that he "can switch off when the game is comfortable".<ref name=NMcG/>

'''Georginio Gregion Emile Wijnaldum''' ({{IPA-nl|ɟɔrˈɟiɲoː ʋɛiˈnɑldʏm}}; born 11 November 1990) is a Dutch professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].
A youth product of [[Eredivisie]] side [[Feyenoord]], Wijnaldum became the youngest player ever to represent the club when he made his debut in 2007, and went on to play 134 matches over the course of a five-year spell. Following his departure from Feyenoord, Wijnaldum spent four seasons at [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] where he won the [[KNVB Cup]] in the first season and the Eredivisie in his last. He also earned the [[Dutch Footballer of the Year]] award during his time with PSV. In 2015, Wijnaldum joined Premier League side [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] for £14.5 million, before departing following the club's relegation a year later to join Liverpool in a £23 million deal.
Wijnaldum is also a full Dutch international, having earned more than 50 caps since making his debut in 2011, and was a member of the squad which came third at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].
==Early life== Wijnaldum was born and raised in [[Rotterdam]], [[South Holland]].<ref name="Liverpool transfer target Georginio Wijnaldum: 10 things you need to know!">{{cite news |title=Liverpool transfer target Georginio Wijnaldum: 10 things you need to know! |url=http://www.talksport.co.uk/magazine/features/2011-03-02/liverpool-transfer-target-georginio-wijnaldum-10-things-you-need-know |newspaper=talksport.co.uk, [[Talksport]]|author=Sian Parry |language= |trans-title= |date=2 March 2011 |accessdate= }}</ref> When he was six years old, his parents, who are both of [[Afro-Surinamese]] descent, went through a divorce with the result that his mother moved to [[Amsterdam]].<ref name="Liverpool transfer target Georginio Wijnaldum: 10 things you need to know!"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gh/news/4389/ghana/2013/05/15/3980540/im-not-a-ghanaian-boateng-was-the-name-of-my-step-father|title='I'm not a Ghanaian; Boateng was the name of my step father,' PSV's Georginio Wijnaldum – Goal.com|date=15 May 2013|publisher=}}</ref> However, Wijnaldum decided to stay in Rotterdam and moved in with his grandmother, where he lived for the remainder of his childhood.<ref name="10 things you need to know about Georginio Wijnaldum">{{cite news |title=10 things you need to know about Georginio Wijnaldum |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/opinion/blogs/football-spy/Liverpool-target-Georginio-Wijnaldum-10-things-you-need-to-know-about-Dutch-midfielder-plus-watch-video-of-him-in-action-article385049.html |newspaper=mirrorfootball.co.uk, [[Daily Mirror]] |language= |trans-title= |date=8 April 2010 |accessdate= }}</ref>
In Wijnaldum's younger years, he never showed interest in football. He never played with a ball or watched football on TV. His ambition was to become a gymnast or acrobat. This changed when Wijnaldum's cousin asked him to come to [[Sparta Rotterdam]]'s opening day with him; then he was invited to the Sparta Rotterdam youth academy and his love for football started to grow slowly.<ref name=kameraadjes>{{cite news |title=Georginio Wijnaldum |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/content/asp/kameraadjes/website/feyenoord.asp?speler=10010000030408 |newspaper=Kameraadjes |language=Dutch |trans-title= |date= |accessdate=6 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090908122341/http://www.feyenoord.nl/content/asp/kameraadjes/website/feyenoord.asp?speler=10010000030408 |archivedate=8 September 2009 }}</ref>
Wijnaldum has two younger brothers, one of whom, [[Giliano Wijnaldum]], currently plays for Sparta Rotterdam, as well as a half-brother, [[Rajiv van La Parra]], who currently plays for [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/spotlight-on-georginio-wijnaldum-newcastles-new-dutch-delight/|title=Spotlight on Georginio Wijnaldum: Newcastle's new Dutch delight – Football Oranje|date=12 July 2015|publisher=}}</ref> Wijnaldum was formerly known as Georginio Boateng, but following his mother's divorce, he took her maiden name (Wijnaldum).<ref name="ad">{{cite news |title='Goed ventje' laat zich niet gek maken |url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1046/Eredivisie/article/detail/344867/2008/11/07/Goed-ventje-laat-zich-niet-gek-maken.dhtml |newspaper=AD |language=Dutch |trans-title='Good boy' won't be caught with his head in the clouds |date=7 November 2008 |accessdate=6 October 2009}}</ref>
==Club career==
===Early career=== At age six, Wijnaldum developed himself rapidly at Sparta Rotterdam, winning two championship titles in his first two seasons. Soon [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] and [[Feyenoord]] showed interest in the youngster, but Wijnaldum declined all offers: "I didn't watch football on TV and I didn't know any of the first team players of Sparta or any of the top clubs. I only knew the real famous players of ''Oranje'', so the offers didn't impress me much. I had a good time at Sparta, I wanted to stay." After playing for Sparta Rotterdam for seven seasons and representing the Netherlands at various youth levels, Wijnaldum decided to accept a new Feyenoord offer. He was convinced playing for Feyenoord was better for his development as a football player and believed in Feyenoord's vision.<ref name="kameraadjes"/>
At Feyenoord, Wijnaldum joined a successful generation with the likes of [[Leroy Fer]] and [[Luís Pedro]]. Wijnaldum stood out as an exceptional talent. In January 2007, a few weeks after turning 16, Wijnaldum was invited to the first team's training camp in [[Belek]], Turkey, by Feyenoord manager [[Erwin Koeman]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Talent in Turkije (4): Georginio Wijnaldum |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20070112Wijnaldum.aspx |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Talent in Turkey (4): Georginio Wijnaldum |date=12 January 2007 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081002142801/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20070112Wijnaldum.aspx |archive-date=2 October 2008 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===Feyenoord=== [[File:Georginio Wijnaldum 001.jpg|left|thumb|300x300px|Wijnaldum with [[Feyenoord]] in 2007.]] On 8 April 2007, Wijnaldum made his official debut in Feyenoord's starting line-up in the [[Eredivisie]] home match against [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] (0–4).<ref>{{cite news|title=Mokerslag in de Kuip: 0–4 |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000010179 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120813144350/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000010179 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=13 August 2012 |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Slam dunk in de Kuip: 0–4 |date=8 April 2007 |accessdate=6 October 2009 }}</ref> At the age of 16 and 148 days, Wijnaldum became the youngest player ever to play in Feyenoord's first team and was chosen Feyenoord's man of the match. On 2 December 2007, Wijnaldum scored his first Eredivisie goal for Feyenoord, against [[Heracles Almelo]] in a 6–0 home win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Swingend en glibberend voorbij Heracles: 6–0 |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000030681 |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Swinging and slipping past Heracles: 6–0 |date=2 December 2007 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110927002434/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000030681 |archivedate=27 September 2011 }}</ref>
In the 2008–09 season, Wijnaldum made his official European debut. On 18 September 2008, he was named in the starting line-up in the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] [[2008–09 UEFA Cup first round|home match]] against [[Kalmar FF]] (0–1).<ref>{{cite news|title=Teleurstellende rentree op Europees podium |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000032667 |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Disappointing comeback on European stage |date=18 September 2008 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308064933/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000032667 |archivedate=8 March 2012 }}</ref> On 2 October 2008, he scored his first European goal for Feyenoord in the return match against Kalmar FF, which resulted in a 1–2 win and a place in the [[2008–09 UEFA Cup group stage|competition's group stage]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Feyenoord naar groepsfase UEFA Cup |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000032668 |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Feyenoord to group stage UEFA Cup |date=2 October 2008 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120813144409/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/datapresenter/S2/10010000000002-10010000000016/wedstrijdinfo.aspx?contentcode=matchinfo&dataid=10010000032668 |archivedate=13 August 2012 }}</ref>
On 6 March 2009, Wijnaldum signed a new contract at Feyenoord which would have kept him at [[De Kuip]] until summer 2012.<ref>{{cite news |title=Feyenoord verlengt contract Wijnaldum |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090306_wijnaldum.aspx |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Feyenoord renews contract Wijnaldum |date=6 March 2009 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120813144510/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090306_wijnaldum.aspx |archive-date=13 August 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> On 27 February 2011, he helped his struggling Feyenoord to a 5–1 demolition of Groningen, scoring four goals. He scored two goals from open play in the first half and two more from the penalty spot to add his total for [[2010–11 Eredivisie|the season]] to eight goals.<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/295507?cc=5901 Match: Feyenoord Rotterdam v FC Groningen – Dutch Eredivisie – ESPN FC]. Soccernet.espn.go.com (27 February 2011). Retrieved on 2 August 2013.</ref>
===PSV=== [[File:Dinamo-PSV (7).jpg|thumb|272x272px|Wijnaldum with [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] in 2014.]] On 29 June 2011, the technical director of Feyenoord announced the club had reached a transfer deal for Wijnaldum reported to be worth €5 million with [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]].<ref>[http://www.voetbalzone.nl/doc.asp?uid=141028 'Ik had Wijnaldum liever aan buitenlandse club verkocht']. Voetbalzone.nl. Retrieved on 2 August 2013.</ref> On the opening day of the [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12 Eredivisie season]], Wijnaldum made his debut for PSV in a 3–1 loss against [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Report: AZ Alkmaar vs PSV Eindhoven|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=321917&cc=5739|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=7 August 2011|accessdate=11 March 2012}}</ref> On 21 August 2011, Wijnaldum scored his first goal for PSV in a 3–0 victory against [[ADO Den Haag]]. Since joining the club, Wijnaldum established himself in the starting 11 as he scored goals and developed assists from his attacking role in midfield in Eredivisie, the KNVB Cup and the UEFA Europa League. After the retirement of [[Mark van Bommel]] and the departure of [[Kevin Strootman]] in the summer of 2013, Wijnaldum was named PSV's captain for the [[2013–14 Eredivisie]] season. However, he played just 11 matches that year, scoring four goals, due to a back injury. For the [[2014–15 Eredivisie]] season, Wijnaldum returned to full fitness and captained PSV to their first Eredivisie title since [[2007–08 Eredivisie|2008]].
===Newcastle United=== On 11 July 2015, Wijnaldum joined English [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on a five-year contract, for a reported transfer fee of £14.5 million, making him the most expensive signing of [[Mike Ashley (businessman)|Mike Ashley]]'s ownership.<ref>{{cite news|title=Newcastle United: Georginio Wijnaldum seals five-year deal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33474195|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=11 July 2015}}</ref> Wijnaldum made his debut on 9 August as Newcastle began the season with a 2–2 home draw against [[Southampton F.C|Southampton]], heading in a goal from [[Gabriel Obertan]]'s cross.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Davis|first1=Matt|title=Newcastle 2–2 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750572|accessdate=9 August 2015|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=9 August 2015}}</ref> He would score his second Newcastle goal in a 2–2 draw with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 26 September.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Olsen |first1=Connor |title=Newcastle 2–2 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299598 |accessdate=26 September 2015 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=26 September 2015}}</ref> On 18 October, Wijnaldum scored four goals in a 6–2 home win over [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34498802|title=Newcastle United 6–2 Norwich City|date=18 October 2015|work=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=18 October 2015}}</ref> becoming only the second Newcastle player to score more than three goals in a Premier League match.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34567846|title=Steve McClaren: Boss has had 'enormous' support from Newcastle|date=18 October 2015|work=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=19 October 2015}}</ref> Wijnaldum was considered the player of the match in a game against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] when he forced [[Martin Škrtel]] into an own goal as well as scoring himself in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.us/barclays-premier-league/match/422519/newcastle-united-liverpool/report |title=Newcastle beat Liverpool as Georginio Wijnaldum is the star of the show |work=[[ESPN.com]] |date=6 December 2015 |accessdate=6 December 2015}}</ref> He scored against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in a 3–3 draw on 12 January 2016,<ref>{{cite news|last=Dawkes|first=Phil|title=Newcastle United 3–3 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35229750|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=12 January 2016}}</ref> and again four days later in a 2–1 win against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Sanghera|first=Mandeep|title=Newcastle United 2–1 West Ham United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35270693|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=16 January 2016}}</ref> and later scored twice against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in a 5–1 win on the final day of the season, finishing the season as Newcastle's top goalscorer.<ref>{{cite news|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|title=Newcastle United 5–1 Tottenham Hotspur|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240333|access-date=23 July 2016|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=15 May 2016}}</ref> However, after the season, Newcastle were relegated to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]]. [[File:Georginio Wijnaldum Liverpool vs Hull City 2016-09-24.jpg|left|thumb|227x227px|Wijnaldum playing in a Premier League match against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], 24 September 2016.]]
===Liverpool=== On 22 July 2016, Wijnaldum returned to the Premier League, signing for Liverpool on a five-year contract, for an initial £23 million with a further £2 million in conditional add-ons. He was given the number 5 shirt.<ref>{{cite news|title=Liverpool complete Georginio Wijnaldum capture|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/228707-liverpool-complete-georginio-wijnaldum-capture|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|date=23 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36846756|title=Georginio Wijnaldum: Liverpool sign midfielder from Newcastle for £25m|access-date=22 July 2016}}</ref>
==== 2016–17 season ==== Wijnaldum made his Premier League debut for Liverpool against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 14 August 2016, where he played 80 minutes and provided an assist for [[Adam Lallana]] before being replaced by [[Kevin Stewart (footballer)|Kevin Stewart]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/14/arsenal-liverpool-premier-league-match-report|title=Liverpool and Coutinho stun stuttering Arsenal in seven-goal thriller|date=14 August 2016|work=The Guardian|accessdate=16 August 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 6–1 thrashing of [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 6 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-6-1-watford-full-12135880|title=Liverpool 6–1 Watford full-time report – Joy of six as Reds romp to Premier League summit|website=www.liverpoolecho.co.uk|date=6 November 2016|accessdate=6 November 2016}}</ref> On 31 December, he scored the match's only goal with a powerful header in Liverpool's 1–0 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] to take Liverpool four points clear in second. He was highly praised for his goal.<ref>{{citeweb|title=Liverpool 1–0 Manchester City: Liverpool maintained their pursuit of Premier League leaders Chelsea as they moved to within six points of the pacesetters with victory over Manchester City at Anfield|last=McNulty|first=Phil|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38424665|date=31 December 2016|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 January 2016}}</ref> Wijnaldum sealed Liverpool's 3–1 win over Arsenal on 4 March 2017 with a close-range finish in stoppage time.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39086717|title=Liverpool 3–1 Arsenal|last=McNulty|first=Phil|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 March 2017|accessdate=12 April 2017}}</ref> In the final match of the [[2016–17 Premier League]] season, with Liverpool needing a win over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] to secure a top-four finish and a [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League]] berth, Wijnaldum opened the scoring with a first-half stoppage time goal as Liverpool won 3–0.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/liverpool/364/blog/post/3131140/wijnaldum-coutinho-and-lallana-send-liverpool-to-champions-league|title=Wijnaldum, Coutinho and Lallana send Liverpool to Champions League|last=Usher|first=Dave|publisher=ESPN FC|date=22 May 2017|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref> [[File:Liver-SM 2017 (10).jpg|thumb|252x252px|Wijnaldum playing in a [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] match against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moskva]], 6 December 2017.]]
==== 2017–18 season ==== On 28 October 2017, Wijnaldum scored his first goal of the [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]], scoring the third goal in Liverpool's 3–0 win over newly-promoted [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41703861|title=Liverpool 3-0 Huddersfield Town|date=28 October 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=16 September 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 2 May 2018, Wijnaldum scored his first away goal since May 2015, and his first for an English club, when he netted in a 7–6 aggregate victory over [[AS Roma|Roma]] to help Liverpool progress to the final of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|2017–18 Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/954411/Georginio-Wijnaldum-Liverpool-Roma-goal-Champions-League|title=Georginio Wijnaldum: Liverpool star ends INCREDIBLE unwanted streak with Roma goal|publisher=Express|last=Amako|first=Uche|date=2 May 2018|accessdate=3 May 2018}}</ref> His goal also saw Liverpool break the competition's record for the most goals scored in a single campaign, with the club's tally of 46 surpassing the record of 45 previously held by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-za/news/liverpool-break-champions-league-scoring-record/hyuflrkic5z41kokj9ecpn4dr|title=Liverpool break Champions League scoring record|publisher=Goal|date=2 May 2018|accessdate=3 May 2018}}</ref> Wijnaldum played for Liverpool in the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], playing the full 90 minutes as Liverpool lost 1–3.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44258022|title=Real Madrid 3-1 Liverpool|date=26 May 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 August 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==== 2018–19 season ==== On 15 September 2018, Wijnaldum scored his first ever Premier League away goal,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/wijnaldum-breaks-three-year-away-goal-drought-with-vital/1umhrl3acnde1rs3qij88qw2z|title=Wijnaldum breaks three-year away goal drought with vital Liverpool strike {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=16 September 2018|language=en}}</ref> scoring the opening goal in a 2–1 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45456656|title=Liverpool beat Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 to maintain 100% Premier League start|date=15 September 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=16 September 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> He made his 100th appearance for the club on 29 September in a 1–1 Premier League draw with Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/match/2018-19/first-team/chelsea-v-liverpool-live-matchday-blog|title=Chelsea v Liverpool: Live matchday blog|publisher=Liverpool FC|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=25 October 2018}}</ref> On 9 February 2019, He scored his 9th league goal for the club in a 3-0 victory over [[AFC Bournemouth]]
==International career==
===Youth=== Wijnaldum was one of the key players of the [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands under-17 squad]] on the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] in Belgium. However, the team finished third in their group behind England and Belgium, failing to qualify for the knockout stage. Quickly after the tournament, Wijnaldum was selected for the [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands under-19 squad]]. Despite excellent individual performances, the team underachieved and failed to qualify for the [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] in the Czech Republic and [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] in Ukraine.
On 12 November 2008, the young midfielder got invited to the Netherlands B by manager [[Johan Neeskens]]. Wijnaldum had to deny the invitation due to an injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Wijnaldum en Fer niet naar Nederland B |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20081117_ned_b.aspx |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Wijnaldum and Fer won't go to Netherlands B |date=17 November 2008 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120819221639/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20081117_ned_b.aspx |archive-date=19 August 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Wijnaldum had to deny his first [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands under-21]] invitation on 9 August 2009.<ref>{{cite news |title=Wijnaldum meldt zich af voor Jong Oranje |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090809wijnaldum_jong_oranje.aspx |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Wijnaldum logs off for Jong Oranje |date=9 August 2009 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120819221712/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090809wijnaldum_jong_oranje.aspx |archive-date=19 August 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He received an invitation for the friendly match against [[England national under-21 football team|England]] by manager [[Cor Pot]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Biseswar, Wijnaldum en Fer in voorselectie Jong Oranje |url=http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090729_spelers_jong_oranje.aspx |newspaper=Feyenoord.nl |language=Dutch |trans-title=Biseswar, Wijnaldum and Fer in pre-selection Jong Oranje |date=29 July 2009 |accessdate=6 October 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120819221753/http://www.feyenoord.nl/pages/newsdetail/S2/20090729_spelers_jong_oranje.aspx |archive-date=19 August 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Wijnaldum made his official Netherlands U21 debut on 4 September 2009, in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] qualification match against [[Finland national under-21 football team|Finland]] (2–0).
===Senior=== [[File:De Guzman Wijnaldum NL 2015.jpg|thumb|Wijnaldum (right) training alongside [[Jonathan de Guzmán|Jonathan de Guzman]] (left) with [[Netherlands national football team|the Netherlands]] in 2015.]] On 30 May 2011, Wijnaldum was named in the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands senior squad]] for friendlies against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] and [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]], but did not play in either match.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110703121011/http://www.nieuwslog.nl/2011/05/30/wijnaldum-vervangt-sneijder-bij-het-nederlands-elftal/ Wijnaldum vervangt Sneijder bij het Nederlands elftal]. nieuwslog.nl (30 May 2011)</ref> He made his international debut in the match against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] on 2 September 2011, appearing as a substitute in the 86th minute and promptly scoring the final goal in an 11–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |title=San Marino on the end of record Netherlands win |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002054/postmatch/report/index.html |work=[[UEFA]]|date= 2 September 2011 |accessdate=23 June 2014}}</ref>
Wijnaldum was a member of the Netherlands squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], and scored his second goal for the nation in a 3–0 win against Brazil in the third-place play-off.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28173517|title=Brazil 0–3 Netherlands|date=12 July 2014|accessdate=13 July 2014|work=BBC}}</ref>
On 9 September 2018, he made his 50th appearance for the Netherlands in a 2–1 [[UEFA Nations League]] defeat to [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/incredible-gini-wijnaldum-stat-highlights-15137696|title=The incredible Gini Wijnaldum stat which highlights why he's found a new level at Liverpool this season|publisher=Liverpool Echo|last=O'Neill|first=Caoimhe|date=11 September 2018|accessdate=14 September 2018}}</ref>

1989) is a Croatian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Liverpoo}} club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Croatia national football team|Croatia national team]].
Lovren began his career at [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]] before moving to [[Olympique Lyonnais]] in January 2010. He spent three-and-a-half seasons with the [[Ligue 1]] team and won the 2012 [[Coupe de France]] before he signed for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2013. After one season with Southampton, he joined [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for £20 million and has since made over 150 appearances for the club.
Having previously represented Croatia at various youth levels, he made his senior debut in 2009 and has since gone on to make over 40 appearances for his country. He was selected in Croatia's squads for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia, the latter of which were beaten finalists against [[France national football team|France]].
==Early life== Lovren was born to [[Croats|Croatian]] parents in the city of [[Zenica]], SFR Yugoslavia (now Bosnia and Herzegovina).<ref name="LFC profile">{{cite web|title=Dejan Lovren Player Profile|url=http://www.lfchistory.net/Players/Player/Profile/1275|publisher=LFC History|accessdate=15 May 2016}}</ref> His family fled from Yugoslavia to [[Munich]] to escape the [[Bosnian War]] when Lovren was three years old, and he spent the next seven years in Germany. Speaking about his time as a refugee, Lovren stated that he was "a happy boy, I spoke [[German language|German]] perfectly, I went to school, I played for a little club."{{cn|date=February 2019}}
His family eventually had to leave as they did not possess necessary documentation to reside in Germany and settled in [[Karlovac]], Croatia, 50 kilometres southwest of the capital city of [[Zagreb]].<ref name="gard">{{cite news|last1=Doyle|first1=Paul|title=Dejan Lovren puts traumas behind him to enjoy Southampton high life|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/nov/30/dejan-lovren-southampton-croatia-chelsea|work=The Guardian|date=30 November 2013|accessdate=15 June 2014}}</ref> Lovren initially found settling in Croatia difficult, and struggled in school for a couple of years due to his unfamiliarity with the [[Croatian language]].<ref name="gard" /> His younger brother [[Davor Lovren|Davor]] is also a footballer.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2015/10/26/liverpool-identify-dejan-lovrens-brother-davor-as-possible-transfer-target-report-5463030/|title=Liverpool identify Dejan Lovren's brother Davor as possible transfer target|first=Mark|last=Brus|newspaper=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|date=26 October 2015}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Dinamo Zagreb=== Lovren first played football in Germany with Munich-based [[BSC Sendling]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Dejan Lovren: Vom BSC Sendling ins WM-Halbfinale (From BSC Sendling to the World Cup semi-final) |url=https://www.fupa.net/berichte/bsc-sendling-muenchen-dejan-lovren-vom-bsc-sendling-ins-wm-h-2108278.html |website=www.fupa.net |accessdate=29 August 2018 |language=German |date=10 July 2018}}</ref> After moving to Croatia, he played for local teams NK Ilovac and [[NK Karlovac]] as a youth before joining [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb]] in 2004.
On 10 May 2006, he made his debut for Dinamo in a [[Croatian First Football League]] match against [[NK Varaždin|NK Varteks Varaždin]]. On 17 July 2006, Lovren was loaned to [[NK Inter Zaprešić]] for two seasons where he made 50 league appearances and scored one goal. Following his return from loan Lovren regularly featured in Dinamo's starting XI, appearing in 38 matches throughout the [[NK Dinamo Zagreb season 2008–09|2008–09 season]] and scoring three goals. In the [[NK Dinamo Zagreb season 2009–10|2009–10 season]], he featured in all four of Dinamo's [[UEFA Champions League]] qualifiers against [[Pyunik Yerevan]] and [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]], and managed to score a header against Pyunik.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Dinamo pred praznim Maksimirom prošao dalje| url=http://sport.dnevnik.hr/clanak/champions_league/uzivo-dinamo-pyunik-0-0.html| publisher =Dnevnik| date=21 July 2009|accessdate=8 September 2009| language=Croatian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090825183856/http://sport.dnevnik.hr/clanak/champions_league/uzivo-dinamo-pyunik-0-0.html|archivedate=25 August 2009}}</ref>
===Lyon=== [[File:Dejan Lovren.jpg|thumb|upright|Lovren playing for [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]] in 2010]]
In January 2010, Lovren signed for French [[Ligue 1]] club [[Olympique Lyonnais]] for €8 million plus €1.5 million in incentives on a four-and-a-half-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|title=Reference Document 2008/09 |url=http://www.actusnews.com/documents/ACTUS-0-3288-OL-DDR-0809-GB.pdf |work=Olympique Lyonnais |publisher=www.actusnews.com|accessdate=15 June 2013|page=101 |format=PDF}}</ref> He made his competitive debut on 24 January 2010 in their 2–1 defeat at [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] in the [[Coupe de France]], playing the full match. His Ligue 1 debut came on 31 January in Lyon's 2–1 win at home against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]], once again playing the full 90 minutes. During the second half of the season, he made 10 appearances, mostly as a substitute. He was not allowed to participate in Lyon's matches in the UEFA Champions League that season as he had already played in the competition for Dinamo Zagreb.
Lovren's playing time increased during the [[2010–11 Olympique Lyonnais season|2010–11 season]] following the departure of two other defenders, [[Jean-Alain Boumsong]] and [[Mathieu Bodmer]], in the summer of 2010. During the season, he gradually established himself as a first team regular starter, playing as a centre-back alongside [[Cristiano Marques Gomes|Cris]] as well as being used as a right or left full-back, demonstrating himself as a versatile defender.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/support-inside-barcelona-lyon-defender-lovren-increasing-3422641|title=Support inside Barcelona for Lyon defender Lovren increasing|year=2012|work=tribalfootball.com|accessdate=15 November 2016}}</ref> In November 2010 Lovren was listed in the ''[[Don Balón]]'' list of the 100 best young players in the world.<ref>{{cite web|title=Don Balon's list of the 100 best young players in the world|url=http://www.thespoiler.co.uk/2010/11/02/don-balons-list-of-the-100-best-young-players-in-the-world/|publisher=Don Balón|date=2 November 2010|accessdate=9 April 2013}}</ref>
On 23 January 2012, Lovren extended his contract with Lyon for two more seasons, signing with the French club until 2016. He started for Lyon in the [[2012 Coupe de France Final]], a 1–0 win over [[US Quevilly|Quevilly]], but was substituted after 18 minutes for [[Bakary Koné]].

FC|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-land-lovren-868792.aspx |accessdate=14 June 2013|date= 14 June 2013}}</ref> which was estimated at £8.5 million.<ref>{{cite news |last=Simpson|first=Gordon|title=Saints make £8m swoop for defender |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/saints/news/10487269.Saints_make___8m_swoop/|date=14 June 2013|newspaper=Southampton Echo|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> He made his debut on 17 August 2013, in a 1–0 win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web |title=West Brom 0 – 1 Southampton| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644676| publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 August 2013|accessdate=19 August 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Southampton against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Anfield]] on 21 September 2013, a goal which proved to be the winner.<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool 0 – 1 Southampton| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24089810|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 September 2013 |accessdate=21 September 2013}}</ref> On 19 October, he assisted [[Adam Lallana]] for the equalising goal against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in a 1–1 draw at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Manchester United 1 – 1 Southampton| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24503988| publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 October 2013 |accessdate=19 June 2014}}</ref> He added a second league goal in a 2–2 away draw against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 18 January 2014,<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunderland 2 – 2 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25693406|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=18 January 2014|accessdate=20 January 2014}}</ref> but was stretchered off late At the conclusion of his first season in the [[Premier League]], Lovren was named in [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg Sports]]' Power 50 list, which provides statistical rankings of performances from players in Europe's top five leagues.<ref>{{cite web|title=Saints trio in Bloomberg Power 50|publisher=Southampton FC|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/22052014-fonte-lovren-lambert-bloomberg-power-50-1569451.aspx|date=22 May 2014|accessdate=24 May 2014}}</ref> He was the fifth-highest ranked player from the Premier League in 31st position.<ref>{{cite web|title=Power 50 List|publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg Sports]]|url=https://www.bsports.com/power50-list#.U4Dh6CqtNMU|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525214140/https://www.bsports.com/power50-list#.U4Dh6CqtNMU|dead-url=yes|archive-date=25 May 2014|accessdate=24 May 2014}}</ref> After much speculation regarding Lovren's future following the departures of [[Adam Lallana]], [[Luke Shaw]] and [[Rickie Lambert]] from Southampton, the ''[[Liverpool Echo]]'' reported on 25 July 2014 that Southampton had agreed a fee with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for the sale of Lovren, who was set to undergo a medical at the Merseyside club after reportedly handing in a transfer request at Southampton.<ref>{{cite news|title = Liverpool FC agree £20m deal for Lovren|work=Liverpool Echo| url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/liverpool-fc-agree-20m-deal-7509715|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=26 July 2014}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== [[File:Dejan Lovren cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|200px|Lovren playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2014]]
On 27 July 2014, Lovren became the third Southampton player that transfer window to join Liverpool, after [[Rickie Lambert]] and [[Adam Lallana]]. He signed a four-year deal for a reported fee of £20 million, becoming the most expensive defender in Liverpool's history until [[Virgil van Dijk]] joined the club in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|title = Liverpool sign Dejan Lovren from Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport| url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28492306| date=27 July 2014|accessdate=27 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title = Dejan Lovren seals Liverpool transfer|publisher=Liverpool Football Club| url= http://liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/167331-dejan-lovren-seals-liverpool-transfer|date=27 July 2014|accessdate=27 July 2014}}</ref>
On 10 August 2014 he made his debut in a friendly for Liverpool against [[Borussia Dortmund]] at [[Anfield]], scoring the second goal in a 4–0 victory,<ref>{{cite web|title = Liverpool 4–0 Borussia Dortmund|publisher=BBC Sport| url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28732036|date=10 August 2014|accessdate=10 August 2014}}</ref> and made his competitive debut on 17 August in the club's opening game of the Premier League season, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–1 win over former club Southampton at [[Anfield]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool 2–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730043|accessdate=17 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2014}}</ref> He scored his first official goal for Liverpool on 28 October, when he headed in the game-winner from a free-kick in a fourth round [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] 2–1 victory over [[Swansea City F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool 2–1 Swansea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29699743|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 October 2014|date=28 October 2014}}</ref> However, following his poor performance in a [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] defeat to [[FC Basel|Basel]], Lovren was dropped from the first team.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Lewis|first1=Darren|title=Dejan Lovren's Liverpool future in doubt as teammates lose faith in defender after dismal start| url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/dejan-lovrens-liverpool-future-doubt-4800297|publisher=[[Daily Mirror]]|accessdate=5 November 2015|date=12 December 2015}}</ref> As the last penalty taker, Lovren put his attempt over the crossbar as Liverpool lost in a [[penalty shootout]] to [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] on 26 February 2015 as they were eliminated from the last 32 of the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Whalley|first1=Mike|title=Besiktas 1–0 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31627521|accessdate=27 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=26 February 2015}}</ref> The ''[[The Daily Telegraph|Telegraph]]'' website included Lovren in a feature about the 2014–15 Premier League's 20 worst signings which remarked on the number of his errors that resulted in opposition goals.<ref>{{cite news |title=20 worst Premier League signings of the 2014–15 season| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11616110/20-worst-Premier-League-signings-of-the-201415-season.html?frame=3257609|website=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=4 November 2015|date=4 June 2015}}</ref>
Lovren regained his place in the lineup for the first three games of the [[2015–16 Liverpool F.C. season|2015–16 season]] and performed well securing three clean sheets and seven points. However, following a pair of defeats to [[West Ham United]] and rivals [[Manchester United]] in which the defence conceded six goals, Lovren again lost his place to [[Mamadou Sakho]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Rodgers Insists Sakho Remains in His Long-Term Plans |url=http://liverpooloffside.sbnation.com/liverpool-fc-news-coverage/2015/9/17/9344453/brendan-rodgers-mamadou-sakho-start-bordeaux-new-contract-lovren|publisher=[[SB Nation]]|accessdate=4 November
