}} '''Roberto Firmino Barbosa de Oliveira''' (born 2 October 1991) is a Brazilian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|Liverpoo}} club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]] as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], [[Forward (association football)|forward]] or [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]].
After starting his career with [[Figueirense Futebol Clube|Figueirense]] in 2009, he spent four-and-a-half seasons at [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]]. His 16 goals in 33 games for the [[2013–14 Bundesliga]] season earned him the award for the league's Breakthrough Player. In July 2015, he signed for Premier League club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. His creativity, goalscoring and work rate have earned him plaudits at Liverpool, with manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] referring to Firmino as the "engine" that propels the club’s counter-attacking system.<ref name="engine"/>
Firmino made his international debut for [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in November 2014 and represented the nation at the [[2015 Copa América]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Maceió]], [[Alagoas]], Firmino joined [[Figueirense FC|Figueirense]]'s youth setup in 2008, aged 17, after starting out at [[Clube de Regatas Brasil|CRB]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/selecao-brasileira/noticia/2015/06/de-volante-no-crb-alvo-de-ingleses-firmino-emociona-amigo-de-maceio.html|title=De volante no CRB a alvo de ingleses, Firmino emociona amigo de Maceió|trans-title=From a defensive midfielder at CRB to English clubs' target, Firmino thrills a friend from Maceió|publisher=Globo Esporte|language=Portuguese|date=22 June 2015|accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref> He was discovered by a dentist, Marcellus Portella.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/liverpool-new-boy-roberto-firmino-5959353|title=Firmino was destined for top|publisher=Daily Mirror|date=28 June 2015|accessdate=29 June 2015}}</ref> With the latter, he was mainly used as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/al/noticia/2015/06/primeiro-tecnico-de-firmino-no-crb-rasga-elogios-e-revela-era-1-volante.html|title=Primeiro técnico de Firmino no CRB rasga elogios e revela: "Era volante"|trans-title=Firmino's first manager at CRB praises him and reveals: "He was a defensive midfielder"|publisher=Globo Esporte|language=Portuguese|date=11 June 2015|accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref>
Firmino made his professional debut on 24 October 2009, coming on as a half-time [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for Toninho in a 1–2 home loss against [[Associação Atlética Ponte Preta|Ponte Preta]], for the [[Campeonato Brasileiro Série B|Série B]] championship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zh.clicrbs.com.br/rs/esportes/noticia/2009/10/figueirense-perde-para-a-ponte-preta-e-ve-g-4-se-distanciar-2695928.html|title=Figueirense perde para a Ponte Preta e vê G-4 se distanciar|trans-title=Figueirense loses to Ponte Preta and sees ''G-4'' more distant|publisher=ZH Esportes|language=Portuguese|date=24 October 2009|accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref> In January 2010 he was promoted to the main squad.
Firmino scored his first professional goal on 8 May 2010, netting the winner in an away success against [[Associação Desportiva São Caetano|São Caetano]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espn.uol.com.br/noticia/119888_figueirense-estreia-com-vitoria-em-cima-do-sao-caetano|title=Figueirense estreia com vitória em cima do São Caetano|trans-title=Figueirense debuts with victory over São Caetano|publisher=[[ESPN Brasil]]|language=Portuguese|date=8 May 2010|accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref> He contributed with eight goals in 36 appearances during [[2010 Campeonato Brasileiro Série B|the season]], as ''Figueira'' returned to [[Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|Série A]] after a two-year absence.
===Hoffenheim=== [[File:Roberto Firmino 2014 03 08.jpg|thumb|upright|Firmino playing for [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] in 2014]] Firmino signed with [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]] in December 2010, with the contract running until June 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/15/germany/2010/12/14/2260375/official-hoffenheim-sign-roberto-firmino-from-figueirense|title=Official: Hoffenheim Sign Roberto Firmino From Figueirense|date=14 December 2010|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> He formally arrived at Hoffenheim on 1 January 2011.<ref>{{fussballdaten|id=firminoroberto|name=Roberto Firmino}}</ref> Then Hoffenheim manager Ernst Tanner commented that they were "pleased to hire a Brazilian talent".<ref>{{cite web|title=Hoffenheim contrata Roberto Firmino, do Figueirense|trans-title=Hoffenheim sign Figueirense's Roberto Firmino|url=http://esportes.estadao.com.br/noticias/futebol,hoffenheim-contrata-roberto-firmino-do-figueirense,653190|publisher=Esportes Estadao|accessdate=31 March 2015}}</ref> He made his debut a month later in a [[Bundesliga]] defeat against [[FSV Mainz 05|Mainz]], where he came on as a 75th-minute substitute for [[Sebastian Rudy]].<ref name = "SW"/> He scored his first goal for the club on 16 April, the only goal of a league victory against [[Eintracht Frankfurt]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Eintracht stürzt weiter ab|url=http://www.fr-online.de/eintracht-frankfurt/0-1-gegen-hoffenheim-eintracht-stuerzt-weiter-ab-,1473446,8350838.html|publisher=FR-Online|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
He was dropped from the first-team squad along with [[Chinedu Obasi]] at the end of November 2011 for showing up late for training, missing the league match against [[Bayer Leverkusen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15965449.stm|title=Chinedu Obasi dropped from Hoffenheim squad|date=30 November 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He scored two more goals that season, against Wolfsburg and [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]].<ref name="SW"/> In the 2012–13 season, Firmino made 36 appearances and scored seven goals.<ref name="SW"/>
In July 2013, Russian club [[Lokomotiv Moscow]] made a €12 million bid for Firmino.<ref>{{cite news|title=1899 Hoffenheim: Geht Roberto Firmino nach Russland?|url=http://www.t-online.de/sport/id_64339112/tsg-1899-hoffenheim-geht-roberto-firmino-nach-russland-.html|accessdate=8 January 2018|publisher=T-Online|date=5 July 2013|language=German}}</ref> Hoffenheim captain [[Andreas Beck (footballer)|Andreas Beck]] hailed Firmino's development as "outstanding" in August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Roberto Firmino: "Ich bin wie befreit"|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/590936/artikel_roberto-firmino_ich-bin-wie-befreit.html#omsearchresult|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> On 27 March 2014, Firmino extended his contract with the club, signing a three-year extension.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Roberto Firmino verlängert Vertrag bis 2017 |url=http://www.achtzehn99.de/roberto-firmino-verlaengert-vertrag-bis-2017/ |work=TSG 1899 Hoffenheim |date=27 March 2014 |language=German}}</ref> He finished the [[2013–14 Bundesliga]] season tied as the fourth highest scorer with 16 goals,<ref>{{cite web|title=Top scorers 2013/2014|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/stats/player-stats/?liga=51&season=2013&art=goalgetter&matchday=season}}</ref> and was named the league's Breakthrough Player.<ref name=break/>
===Liverpool=== On 23 June 2015, while he was competing for Brazil at the [[2015 Copa América|Copa América]], Hoffenheim and Firmino agreed terms for him to transfer to [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for up to £29 million on conclusion of the tournament, subject to a work permit.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Ben|title=Roberto Firmino: Liverpool agree £29m deal for Brazil striker|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33250535|accessdate=23 June 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 June 2015}}</ref> Liverpool confirmed the signing the following day, subject to a medical.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/187533-liverpool-complete-firmino-signing |title=Liverpool complete Firmino signing |publisher=Liverpool FC |first=James |last=Carroll |date=24 June 2015 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> The deal was finalised on 4 July.<ref name="echo">{{cite news|last1=Jones|first1=Neil|title=Roberto Firmino will bring joy to Liverpool FC fans, says Ryan Babel|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/roberto-firmino-bring-joy-liverpool-9586520|accessdate=4 July 2015|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|date=4 July 2015}}</ref>
==== 2015–16 season ==== Firmino made his Liverpool debut in a pre-season friendly away to [[Swindon Town]] on 2 August,<ref name="BBC">{{cite news|last1=Jones|first1=Neil|title=Christian Benteke: Liverpool striker scores in Swindon friendly|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33754238|accessdate=5 August 2015|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=2 August 2015}}</ref> and his league debut a week later, replacing [[Jordon Ibe]] for the final 12 minutes of a 1–0 win at [[Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hafez|first1=Shamoon|title=Stoke 0-1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750574|accessdate=9 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2015}}</ref> On 21 November, Firmino scored his first goal for Liverpool in a 4–1 victory over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/man-city-vs-liverpool/341310|title=Manchester City 1-4 Liverpool: Jurgen Klopp masterminds stunning win|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=11 March 2016}}</ref> In January 2016, Firmino was described by Paul Little of the ''[[Irish Examiner]]'' as steadily improving during his first season in England,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Little|first1=Paul|title=Klopp must counter cultural legacy to free Benteke potential|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/sport/soccer/klopp-must-counter-cultural-legacy-to-free-benteke-potential-377709.html|accessdate=24 January 2016|work=Irish Examiner|date=22 January 2016}}</ref> although an inability to combine with centre forward [[Christian Benteke]] drew criticism.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jurgen Klopp says Christian Benteke has Liverpool future|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10137092/christian-benteke-does-have-a-future-at-liverpool-jurgen-klopp-insists|accessdate=24 January 2016|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 January 2016}}</ref>
However, in 2016, Firmino's form improved as manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] played him alone up front in a [[False 9]] role.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rej|first1=Arindam|title=Norwich 4 Liverpool 5: five things we learnt|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/12117321/Norwich-4-Liverpool-5-five-things-we-learnt.html|accessdate=24 January 2016|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=23 January 2016}}</ref> He scored braces against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Norwich City]] that month; the latter performance, in which he also assisted in a 5–4 win, earned comparisons to [[Raheem Sterling]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ankers|first1=George|title=Is Roberto Firmino finally paying off Liverpool's £29m investment?|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/13452/opta/2016/01/23/19614942/is-roberto-firmino-finally-paying-off-liverpools-29m|accessdate=24 January 2016|publisher=Goal.com|date=23 January 2016}}</ref> With his form improved, Firmino was voted to be [[2015–16 Liverpool F.C. season#Liverpool Standard Chartered Player of the Month award|Liverpool's Player of the Month in January]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Firmino picks up first Player of the Month award|url=http://liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/197404-firmino-picks-up-first-player-of-the-month-award|date=4 February 2016}}</ref> Firmino ended the season as Liverpool's league top scorer with ten goals.<ref>{{cite news|title=All Games Goalscorers 2015-2016|url=http://lfcstats.co.uk/20152016goalscorers.html|accessdate= 4 October 2016|publisher=LFCstats|date=15 May 2016}}</ref>[[File:Roberto Firmino 2017.jpg|thumb|Firmino playing for Liverpool during a Premier League match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 31 January 2017.|alt=|left|333x333px]]

[[2016–17 EFL Cup#Second round|second round of the EFL Cup]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37091102|title=Burton Albion 0-5 Liverpool|date=23 August 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> Firmino scored his first league goals of the season in a 4–1 win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], scoring a brace, on 10 September.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263954|title=Liverpool 4-1 Leicester City|date=10 September 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 29 2-4 Liverpool|date=29 October 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37814248|title=Liverpool 6-1 Watford|date=6 news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38375153|title=Liverpool 4-1 Stoke City|date=27 December 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 January 2017, Firmino goal in a 2–1 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], and also scored the winning goal in the game against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], which Liverpool won 1–0, on 16 news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39543147|title=West Bromwich Albion 0-1 Liverpool|date=16 April 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> Firmino finished the ==== 2017–18 season ====
[[File:Spartak Moscow- Liverpool Firmino.jpg|thumb|Firmino with Liverpool during a [[UEFA Champions League]] match against Spartak Moscow in 2017.|alt=]] Before the start of the [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]], Firmino switched his shirt number to 9, with new signing [[Mohamed Salah]] taking his number 11.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/266618-mohamed-salah-s-lfc-squad-number-confirmed|title=Mohamed Salah's LFC squad number confirmed|work=Liverpool FC|access-date=7 July 2018}}</ref> Firmino scored his first goal of the new season on 12 August, scoring a penalty in a 3–3 draw with [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{Cite with Liverpool winning 6–3 on aggregate to qualify for the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40997832|title=Liverpool 4-2 1899 Hoffenheim (agg 6-3)|date=23 August 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 27 August, he scored the opening goal in a 4–0 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40990427|title=Liverpool 4-0 Arsenal|date=27 August 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 13 September, Firmino scored and missed a penalty in a 2–2 draw with [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in the first match of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage#Liverpool v Sevilla|Champions League]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41216375|title=Liverpool 2-2 Sevilla|date=13 September 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 17 October, Firmino scored twice in a 7–0 [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage#Maribor v Liverpool|Champions League]] away win over [[NK Maribor|Maribor]], helping Liverpool to the joint-largest away win of the competition; and the largest away win by an English club.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41624791|title=NK Maribor 0-7 Liverpool|date=17 October 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/oct/17/maribor-v-liverpool-champions-league-live|title=Maribor 0-7 Liverpool: Champions League – as it happened|last=Burnton|first=Simon|date=17 October 2017|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>
On 28 October, Firmino scored in a 3–0 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41703861|title=Liverpool 3-0 Huddersfield Town|date=28 October 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 21 November, he scored twice in a 3–3 draw with [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage#Sevilla v Liverpool|Champions League]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42055917|title=Sevilla 3-3 Liverpool|date=21 November 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 2 December, Firmino scored twice in a 5–1 away win over [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. On 6 December, he scored in a 7–0 win over [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage#Liverpool v Spartak Moscow|Champions League]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42242178|title=Liverpool 7-0 Spartak Moscow|date=6 December 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 17 December, he scored in a 4–0 away win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]]; a result which saw Liverpool become the first team in [[Premier League]] history to win four consecutive away games by a margin of at least three goals.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-za/news/liverpool-make-history-with-away-game-goal-tally/12jskoyjq9br01o8rlni44sp02|title=Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp's side make history with record away day goal tally after 4-0 win at Bournemouth {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://anfieldindex.com/31991/key-stats-bournemouth-0-4-liverpool.html|title=Key Stats From Bournemouth 0-4 Liverpool|work=AnfieldIndex.com|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/bournemouth-0-liverpool-4-philippe-coutinho-mohamed-salah-and-roberto-firmino-all-on-target-in-south-a3721626.html|title=Bournemouth 0 Liverpool 4: Reds run riot on the south coast|work=Evening Standard|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 22 December, Firmino scored the equalizing goal in a 3–3 away draw with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/dec/22/arsenal-v-liverpool-premier-league-live|title=Arsenal 3-3 Liverpool: Premier League – as it happened|last=Smyth|first=Rob|date=22 December 2017|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42362392|title=Arsenal 3-3 Liverpool|date=22 December 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 26 December, Firmino scored twice in a 5–0 win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/11185422/liverpool-5-0-swansea-roberto-firmino-nets-twice-in-routine-win|title=Liverpool 5-0 Swansea: Roberto Firmino nets twice in routine win|work=Sky Sports|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref>
On 5 January 2018, during a [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] match against rivals [[Everton F.C.|Everton]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42508636|title=Liverpool 2-1 Everton|date=2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=12 August 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> Firmino was the subject of controversy following a clash with Everton defender [[Mason Holgate]]. Holgate pushed Firmino into the advertising boards, which was followed by the pair exchanging words, with Firmino seemingly insulting the player. Following the match, Holgate accused Firmino of racially abusing him, which he denied. A day later, the [[The Football Association|Football Association]] opened an investigation on the matter.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/06/roberto-firmino-liverpool-everton-mason-holgate|title=FA to investigate racism allegations after Firmino and Holgate flare-up|last=Hunter|first=Andy|date=6 January 2018|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=12 August 2018}}</ref> Nearly two months later, after they had took statements from 12 different players, several referees and consulted two [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] [[Lip reading|lip-readers]], the Football Association cleared Firmino of any offence as a result of "insufficient evidence".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/21/roberto-firmino-cleared-racism-allegations|title=Roberto Firmino cleared by FA over Mason Holgate racism allegations|last=Hunter|first=Andy|date=21 February 2018|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=12 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-news-roberto-firmino-mason-holgate-racist-abuse-incident-breaks-silence-a8223056.html|title=Roberto Firmino breaks silence on Mason Holgate clash after being cleared of racist abuse|work=The Independent|access-date=12 August 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/announcements/291627-statement-from-roberto-firmino|title=Statement from Roberto Firmino|work=Liverpool FC|access-date=12 August 2018}}</ref>

news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42594403|title=Liverpool 4-3 Manchester City|date=2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 27 January, Firmino scored and Champions League round of sixteen]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/feb/14/porto-v-liverpool-champions-league-live|title=Porto 0-5 Liverpool: Champions League – as it happened|last=Murray|first=Scott|date=14 February 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> On 24 February, he scored in a 4–1 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43094245|title=Liverpool 4-1 West Ham United|date=24 February 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 17 March, he scored in 5–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43353969|title=Liverpool 5-0 Watford|date=17 March 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 10 April, he scored in a 2–1 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Manchester City v Liverpool|second leg of the quarter-finals of the Champions League]]; which saw Liverpool advance to the semi-finals with a 5–1 aggregate win.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43632218|title=Manchester City 1-2 Liverpool|date=10 April 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> Four days later, on 14 April, he scored in a 3–0 win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/apr/14/liverpool-v-bournemouth-premier-league-live|title=Liverpool 3-0 Bournemouth: Premier League – as it happened|last=Smyth|first=Rob|date=14 April 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> On 24 April, he scored twice in Liverpool's 5–2 win over [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Liverpool v Roma|first leg of the Champions League semi-finals]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/liverpool-vs-roma/389016|title=Liverpool 5-2 Roma: Mo Salah scores twice in Champions League semi-final first leg|work=Sky Sports|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> On 29 April, Firmino signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<ref name="Liverpool FC">{{Cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/300082-roberto-firmino-contract-liverpool-lfc|title=Roberto Firmino agrees terms on new long-term LFC deal|work=Liverpool FC|access-date=7 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/roberto-firmino-signs-new-liverpool-14592339|title=Roberto Firmino kicks off Liverpool's huge week in the best way|last=Pearce|first=James|date=29 April 2018|work=liverpoolecho|access-date=7 July 2018}}</ref> Firmino started and played the whole 90 minutes in the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]], with Liverpool losing 3–1.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44258022|title=Real Madrid 3-1 Liverpool|date=26 May 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/may/26/real-madrid-v-liverpool-champions-league-final-2018-live|title=Real Madrid beat Liverpool 3-1 to win Champions League final 2018 – as it happened|last=Smyth|first=Rob|date=26 May 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>
During the season, Firmino, [[Mohamed Salah]], [[Philippe Coutinho]] and [[Sadio Mané]] made up a prolific attacking quarter, dubbed the "Fab Four", in reference to the rock band [[The Beatles]], also from the same city as the club.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/liverpool-team-news-fab-four-start-at-arsenal-with-oxlade/1y1n3buklwec314rcfpr0vztpg|title=Liverpool team news: Fab Four start at Arsenal with Oxlade-Chamberlain on the bench {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> Following the mid-season exit of [[Philippe Coutinho|Coutinho]], the three remaining players were dubbed as the "Fab Three", with the trio having a total of 91 goals between them at the end of the season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/fab-three-liverpool-better-equipped-cope-coutinho-exit-after-suarez-experience|title=The Fab Three? Liverpool better equipped to cope with Coutinho exit after Suarez experience|date=7 January 2018|work=FourFourTwo|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/fab-three-make-liverpool-dangerous-outsiders-to-win-champions-league-1.704180|title='Fab Three' make Liverpool dangerous outsiders to win Champions League|work=The National|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/international-football/2018/02/24/5a914729268e3e9a1e8b4684.html|title=Liverpool's fab three: Only PSG's MCN have more goals than Salah, Mane and Firmino - MARCA in English|work=MARCA in English|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> Firmino was Liverpool's joint top goalscorer in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], together with [[Mohamed Salah|Salah]], with 11 goals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.com/s/7818/europe/uefa-champions-league/2017-2018/player-stats|title=UEFA Champions League {{!}} Player statistics of 2017/2018 season {{!}} Europe {{!}} World Football|website=www.worldfootball.com|language=en|access-date=7 July 2018}}</ref> Firmino was also included in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the Season|2017–18 UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2560100.html|title=UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season|last=UEFA.com|work=UEFA.com|access-date=7 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> The [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]] was Firmino's most prolific in his [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] career; as he scored 27 goals in all competitions.<ref name="Liverpool FC"/>
==== 2018–19 season ==== After going goalless in all three matches played in August, Firmino scored his first goal of the season in a 2–1 Premier League win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 1 September.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/sep/01/leicester-city-v-liverpool-premier-league-live|title=Leicester City 1-2 Liverpool: Premier League – as it happened|last=Murray|first=Scott|date=1 September 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=7 September 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> On 15 September he scored in Liverpool’s 2–1 league win over [[Tottenham Hotspur|Spurs]] at Wembley, a game that saw him leave the field 15 minutes before the end with an eye injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool beat Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 to maintain 100% Premier League start |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456656 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |agency=BBC}}</ref> Three days later he came off the bench to score the stoppage time winner in Liverpool’s 3–2 Champions League win against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at Anfield.<ref>{{cite news |title=Firmino strike sees Liverpool win five-goal thriller at Anfield |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45551722 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |agency=BBC}}</ref> On 29 December, Firmino scored his first Liverpool [[hat-trick]] in a 5–1 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], scoring two goals in three minutes and a second half penalty, becoming the highest scoring Brazilian player in [[Premier League]] history.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46656883|title=Liverpool 5-1 Arsenal: Roberto Firmino hits hat-trick as Jurgen Klopp's side thrash Arsenal|date=29 December 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=30 December 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 19 January 2019, he scored Liverpool's 1000th goal at [[Anfield]] in the Premier League era when he netted in a 4–3 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11612182/the-stats-behind-mohamed-salahs-50-premier-league-goals|title=The stats behind Mohamed Salah's 50 Premier League goals|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 January 2019|accessdate=21 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:20180610 FIFA Friendly Match Austria vs. Brazil Hierländer Firmino 850 0108.jpg|thumb|Firmino playing against [[Austria national football team|Austria]] in 2018]] Firmino said that it was his "dream" to play in the national team though he had no "contact with national team manager [[Dunga]]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Firmino: "Ich will noch viel mehr"|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/608759/artikel_firmino_ich-will-noch-viel-mehr.html#omsearchresult|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> On 23 October 2014, Firmino received his first call up to [[Brazil national football team]] for the friendly matches against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] and [[Austria national football team|Austria]]. He commented, "I'm very happy about the nomination and would especially like to thank the team".<ref>{{cite web|title=Dunga beruft Roberto Firmino in die Seleçao|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/intligen/startseite/613976/artikel_dunga-beruft-roberto-firmino-in-die-selec3a7ao.html#omsearchresult|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> He debuted in a 4–0 win over Turkey on 12 November, replacing fellow debutant [[Luiz Adriano]] for the last 17 minutes.<ref>{{cite web|title=Roberto Firmino feiert Debüt bei Neymar-Show|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/intligen/startseite/615347/artikel_roberto-firmino-feiert-debuet-bei-neymar-show.html#omsearchresult|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref> Firmino scored his first goal six days later in the latter match, a 2–1 away win.<ref name="goal">{{cite web|title=Roberto Firmino strikes late winner|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30107820|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
In May 2015, Firmino was included in Brazil's 23-man squad for the [[2015 Copa América]] to be held in Chile.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/copa-america/story/2445502/2015-copa-america-squad-lists|title=2015 Copa America squad lists|date=28 May 2015|work=ESPN}}</ref> On 21 June, he scored in a 2–1 defeat of [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] to qualify the ''Seleção'' for the [[2015 Copa América knockout stage|knockout stage]] as [[2015 Copa América Group C|Group C]] winners.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/brazil-v-venezuela-2-1-win-sees-dunga-side-progress-in-copa-america-despite-neymar-absence/story-e6frf423-1227409196902|title=Brazil v Venezuela: 2-1 win sees Dunga side progress in Copa America despite Neymar absence|date=22 June 2015|work=Fox Sports}}</ref>
In May 2018 he was named in Tite's final [[Brazil national football team|23 man squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44116590|title=World Cup: Neymar named in Brazil's 23-man squad|date=14 May 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/player/147234/roberto-firmino|title=Roberto Firmino Player Profile - ESPN FC|website=www.espnfc.us}}</ref> On 2 July, Firmino scored Brazil's second goal in a 2–0 win over Mexico in the round of sixteen having come on as a late substitute.<ref>{{cite news |title=Brazil beat Mexico to reach last 8 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44597762 |agency=BBC |date=2 July 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[File:Russia-Brazil 2018 (11) (cropped).jpg|alt=|thumb|330x330px|Firmino is known for his creativity, link-up play, goalscoring and workrate.]] At Hoffenheim, Firmino primarily played as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]],<ref>{{NFT player|pid=57643|accessdate=28 July 2015}}</ref> but was also utilised as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]], [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]], with Firmino using his speed, close control and vision wherever he is deployed.<ref>{{cite web|title=Roberto Firmino|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/team/first-team/player/roberto-firmino|website=liverpoolfc.com|publisher=Liverpool Football Club|accessdate=19 March 2016}}</ref> After initially starting as a left winger at Liverpool under [[Brendan Rodgers]], new manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] utilised Firmino more centrally, initially as a [[False 9]].<ref>{{cite web|title=How Firmino’s excellent false nine display almost led Liverpool to victory|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/michael-cox-how-firminos-excellent-false-nine-display-almost-led-liverpool-victory|website=FourFourTwo.com|publisher=FourFourTwo|accessdate=12 February 2018}}</ref> However, after impressing under Klopp's pressing system, Firmino established himself as Liverpool's first choice [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|centre-forward]] by the [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Why there's nothing false with Roberto Firmino being Liverpool's new number nine|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-firmino-champions-league-coutinho-13472096|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=12 February 2018}}</ref> Ian Doyle of the ''Liverpool Echo'' referred to him as "a true Liverpool number nine", whose "numbers are up there with [[Harry Kane]] and [[Sergio Agüero]]."<ref>{{cite news |title=Roberto Firmino is now a true Liverpool number nine – and his numbers are up there with Harry Kane, Sergio Aguero and Alvaro Morata |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/roberto-firmino-now-true-liverpool-13988099 |accessdate=13 August 2018 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo}}</ref>
[[Ryan Babel]], a teammate of Firmino's at Hoffenheim, described him as "A tricky player. He can dribble, shoot, he has a great shot, he can play a lot of through balls and his assists are very good", while also praising a heading ability which would not be common amongst other players of Firmino's stature. Babel also stated that Firmino had a humble mentality and no problems with attitude.<ref name=echo/> In addition to his technical skills, creativity, link-up play, and goalscoring, Firmino has also been praised by his managers, teammates, and pundits for his positional sense, intelligent movement, and ability to make attacking runs off the ball, which often draws opposing players out of position and creates space for his teammates.<ref name="Firmino-key-Liverpool">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/10/roberto-firmino-key-liverpools-heavy-metal-style-play/|title=Why Roberto Firmino is so key to Liverpool's heavy metal style of play|work=The Telegraph|first=J. J.|last=Bull|date=10 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="man who discovered Firmino">{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/liverpool-hoffenheim-roberto-firmino-champions-league-latest-a7907556.html |title=Hoffenheim and the man who discovered Roberto Firmino must now try to stop him and Liverpool |work=The Independent |last1=Critchley |first1=Mark |date=23 August 2017 |accessdate=16 October 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612965 |title=Firmino and Kane deadly in different ways |publisher=www.premierleague.com |author1=Adrian Clarke |date=3 February 2018 |accessdate=16 October 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/blog/tactics-and-analysis/67/post/3641539/cardiff-direct-no-nonsense-style-can-test-manchester-city |title=Man United overcome Liverpool's high pressing as Roberto Firmino links play |work=ESPN FC |last1=Haugstad |first1=Thore |date=18 January 2016 |accessdate=16 October 2018 }}</ref>
Due to his energy and defensive work-rate off the ball,<ref name="Firmino-key-Liverpool"/><ref name="man who discovered Firmino"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com.au/football/english-premier-league/23/blog/post/3040802/premier-league-key-players-include-eden-hazard-roberto-firmino-and-christian-eriksen |title=Eden Hazard, Roberto Firmino and Christian Eriksen: The PL's key players |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Michael Cox |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=16 October 2018 }}</ref> Klopp has referred to Firmino as the "engine" that propels the team's relentless counter-attacking system; "If he loses the ball, he fights for it back. If he loses it again, he fights for it. He looks like the engine of the team."<ref name="engine">{{cite web|title=Klopp: What can I say about Firmino? He's like the engine of the team|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/281762-klopp-what-can-i-say-about-firmino-he-s-like-the-engine-of-the-team|website=liverpoolfc.com|publisher=Liverpool Football Club|accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref> The suitability of Firmino's playing style to Klopp's pressing system has meant that Firmino was referred to as "Liverpool's most important player" on several occasions during the [[2016–17 Liverpool F.C. season|2016–17]] and [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18]] seasons.<ref name="Firmino-key-Liverpool"/>
Firmino is also well-known for his popular "no-look" goals.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.planetfootball.com/in-depth/roberto-firminos-no-look-finishes-exactly-arrogance-football-needs/|title=Roberto Firmino’s no-look finishes are exactly the arrogance football needs|date=19 March 2018|work=Planet Football|access-date=7 September 2018|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/roberto-firmino-liverpool-hoffenheim-brazil-made-in-bundesliga-480003.jsp|title=Roberto Firmino: Liverpool's no-look Brazilian magician, made in the Bundesliga |website=bundesliga.com - the official Bundesliga website|language=en|access-date=7 September 2018}}</ref> One of his best known [[goal celebration]]s, 'the Matador', features in the [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game ''[[FIFA 19]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=UPDATED FIFA 19 new celebrations and tutorial, ft Cristiano Ronaldo, Paul Pogba and Neymar |url=https://talksport.com/football/418292/fifa-19-new-celebrations-cristiano-ronaldo-paul-pogba-neymar |accessdate=11 October 2018 |agency=Talksport}}</ref>
==Personal life== Firmino married Larissa Pereira in his hometown in June 2017. They have two daughters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pôr do sol, flores e jogadores do Liverpool: Roberto Firmino se casa em Maceió|url=https://globoesporte.globo.com/al/noticia/por-do-sol-flores-e-jogadores-do-liverpool-roberto-firmino-se-casa-em-maceio.ghtml|accessdate=8 January 2018|publisher=Globo|date=20 June 2017|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Firmino has been given the affectionate nickname "Bobby" by Liverpool fans and players - a [[Hypocorism|shortening]] of his first name "Roberto".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/246924-firmino-i-love-my-bobby-nickname|title=Firmino: I love my 'Bobby' nickname!|accessdate=12 February 2018|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|authors=Shaw, Chris;|date=16 December 2016}}</ref>
In December 2016, Firmino was arrested for drink driving. He was fined £20,000 and had his driving licence revoked for a year when sentenced at [[Liverpool Magistrates' Court]] in February 2017.<ref name=banned>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/liverpool-striker-roberto-firmino-court-12538063|title=Liverpool striker Roberto Firmino fined and banned over drink driving charge: updates|accessdate=2 February 2017|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|authors=Thomas, Joe; Kay, Dan|date=1 February 2017}}</ref>

no by-line.--> |date= 2015 |website= Premier League |publisher= Barclays Premier League|accessdate= 12 January 2015}}</ref> | currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Génération Foot]] | years1 = 2011–2012 |clubs1 = [[FC Metz|Metz]] |caps1 = 22 |goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2012–2014 |clubs2 = [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] |caps2 = 63 |goals2 = 31 | years3 = 2014–2016 |clubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |caps3 = 67 |goals3 = 21 | years4 = 2016– |clubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |caps4 = 82 |goals4 = 37 | nationalyears1 = 2012 |nationalteam1 = [[Senegal national under-23 football team|Senegal U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2012– |nationalteam2 = [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] | nationalcaps2 = 58 |nationalgoals2 = 15 | pcupdate = 27 February 2019 | ntupdate = 14:54, 16 October 2018 }} '''Sadio Mané''' (born 10 April 1992) is a Senegalese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for {{English football updater|Liverpoo}} club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Senegal national football team|Senegal national team]].
Having begun his career with [[FC Metz|Metz]] in France, he transferred to [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] in 2012. After winning the [[Austrian Football Bundesliga#Österreichische Fußball-Bundesliga|Austrian Bundesliga]] and [[Austrian Cup]] in [[2013–14 FC Red Bull Salzburg season|2014]], he was signed by [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. In [[2014–15 Southampton F.C. season|2015]], Mané set a new [[Premier League]] [[Premier League records and statistics|record]] for the fastest [[hat-trick]] when he scored three times in 176 seconds during a 6–1 win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref name=trick>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/may/16/southampton-aston-villa-premier-league-match-report|title=Southampton’s Sadio Mané hits record hat-trick to rout Aston Villa|date=16 May 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref> He transferred to Liverpool in 2016 for a fee of £34 million, making him the most expensive African player in history at that time.<ref name=BBC36642523/><ref>{{cite news|title=Eight things about the Premier League Africans|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-37255038|agency=BBC News|date=4 September 2016}}</ref> Since joining Liverpool, Mané among other achievements scored in the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]].
Mané has earned over 50 [[Cap (association football)|caps]] for Senegal since his debut in 2012, and represented the national team at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]], [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]], [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Sédhiou]], Sénégal, Mané started his career at the Académie Génération Foot, Senegalese football academy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sadio MANE de passage à l’Académie Génération Foot|url=http://www.asgenerationfoot.com/site/?p=3424|publisher=Academie Generation Foot|language=French}}{{dead link|date=May 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Mané made his professional debut for [[FC Metz|Metz]] on 14 January 2012, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Kévin Diaz (footballer born 1988)|Kévin Diaz]] in the 75th minute of a 0–1 home defeat against [[SC Bastia|Bastia]] in [[Ligue 2]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Metz 0–1 Bastia|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/01/14/france/ligue-2/fc-de-metz/sporting-club-de-bastia/1115285/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> He made 19 appearances in [[2011–12 Ligue 2|his first league season]], 12 as a starter, and scored a solitary goal in a 2–5 loss to [[EA Guingamp|Guingamp]] at the [[Stade Saint-Symphorien]] on 4 May.<ref>{{cite web|title=Metz 2–5 Guingamp| url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/05/04/france/ligue-2/fc-de-metz/en-avant-de-guingamp/1115453/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> Metz were [[relegation|relegated]] to the [[Championnat National]] at the end of the season.
===Red Bull Salzburg=== [[File:RBS gegen Metz59.JPG|thumb|Mané (right) playing for [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] in 2013]]
On 31 August 2012, Mané moved to [[Austrian Football Bundesliga|Austrian Bundesliga]] side [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] for the third biggest transfer fee that [[FC Metz]] had ever received.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sadio Mané transféré au Red Bull Salzburg|trans-title=Sadio Mané transferred to Red Bull Salzburg|url=http://www.fcmetz.com/article/Transfert/2012-08-31-17-25-55_sadio-mane-transfere-au-red-bull-salzburg.html|website=www.fcmetz.com|publisher=[[FC Metz]]|accessdate=2 September 2014|language=French|date=31 August 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141103230754/http://www.fcmetz.com/article/Transfert/2012-08-31-17-25-55_sadio-mane-transfere-au-red-bull-salzburg.html|archivedate=3 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Die Bullen im Kaufrausch|trans-title=The Bulls on a spending spree|url=http://www.news.at/a/red-bull-salzburg-die-bullen-kaufrausch-340805|website=www.news.at|publisher=news.at|accessdate=2 September 2014|language=German|date=31 August 2014}}</ref> The fee was believed to be €4 million.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://diepresse.com/home/sport/fussball/national/3840165/Salzburg_Wer-Geld-hat-kann-gross-einkaufen | title =Salzburg: Wer Geld hat, kann groß einkaufen | language = German | trans-title = Salzburg: Who got money, can go on a shopping spree | publisher = [[Die Presse]] | accessdate = 2 September 2014 | date = 17 July 2014}}</ref>
He scored his first [[hat-trick]] for the club on 31 October, in a 3–1 away win at [[SC Kalsdorf|Kalsdorf]] in the third round of the [[Austrian Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Kalsdorf 1–3 Salzburg|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/match/kalsdorf-vs-salzburg/1397693/lineups|website=Goal.com|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
On 27 October 2013, he netted his first hat-trick in the Austrian Bundesliga, during a 3–0 win away to [[SV Grödig|Grödig]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Grödig 0–3 Salzburg|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/gr%C3%B6dig-vs-salzburg/1487388/preview|website=Goal.com|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> He scored another treble on 7 May 2014 as Salzburg won 7–0 at [[SV Horn|Horn]] in the cup semi-finals;<ref>{{cite news|title=Red Bulls in cup final after goal fest!|url=http://www.redbulls.com/en/fc-red-bull-salzburg/news/saison_2013_14/red-bulls-in-cup-final-after-goal-fest.html|accessdate=23 February 2015|publisher=[[Red Bull]]|date=7 May 2014}}</ref> the season ended with the team winning a domestic [[Double (association football)|double]]. At the end of August 2014 Mané forced a transfer out of the club, by not coming to the training and to the most important game for Salzburg at that time to qualify for the Champions League.<ref>[http://www.weltfussball.at/news/_n1232661_/skandal-um-sadio-mane-vor-malmoe-spiel/ Skandal um Sadio Mané vor Malmö-Spiel], weltfussball.at, 26 August 2014</ref>
===Southampton=== ====2014–15 season==== On 1 September 2014, Mané transferred to [[Premier League]] side [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for £11.8 million, signing a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite web| title=Southampton sign £10m forward Sadio Mane & Toby Alderweireld |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29025087|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]| accessdate=3 September 2014|date=2 September 2014}}</ref> He made his debut 22 days later in a 2–1 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] victory over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], winning the penalty for Southampton's first goal.<ref>{{cite web |title=Arsenal 1–2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29216769 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 September 2014 |accessdate=23 September 2014}}</ref> He made his first league appearance for the club in another 2–1 victory over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 27 September, starting and assisting [[Ryan Bertrand]] for the first goal of the game.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289926|title=Southampton 2–1 Queens Park Rangers|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 September 2014|accessdate=27 September 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in an 8–0 victory over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 18 October,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Reddy |first1=Luke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29580147 |title=Southampton 8–0 Sunderland |work=BBC Sport |date=18 October 2014 |accessdate=18 October 2014}}</ref> although this was subsequently credited as an own goal by [[Patrick van Aanholt]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Southampton 8 – 0 Sunderland |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/matchday/matches/2014-2015/epl.match-stats.html/southampton-vs-sunderland|publisher=Premier League |accessdate=24 October 2014|date=18 October 2014}}</ref> He did, however, score his first goal in his next game, a 1–0 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] a week later.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Canavan|first1=Steve|title=Southampton 1–0 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29670448|publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 October 2014|date=25 October 2014}}</ref>
In December and January he scored in three successive matches, against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30544147 |title=Crystal Palace 1–3 Southampton |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=26 December 2014 |accessdate=2 January 2015}}</ref> [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30566736 |title=Southampton 1–1 Chelsea |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=28 December 2014 |accessdate=2 January 2015}}</ref> and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30600817 |title=Southampton 2–0 Arsenal |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=1 January 2015 |accessdate=2 January 2015 }}</ref> Mané scored two late winning goals in 1–0 league victories at [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 7 February 2015 and at home to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 3 March respectively.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31071178 | title=QPR 0–1 Southampton | publisher=BBC Sport | date=7 February 2015 | accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31598153 | title=Southampton 1–0 Crystal Palace | publisher=[[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] Sport | date=3 March 2015 | accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref> However, Mané had been dropped from Southampton's starting line-up for their 0–2 home defeat to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 22 February as a punishment for being late to the stadium.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton: Sadio Mane dropped for being late – Koeman|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31579123|accessdate=22 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 February 2015}}</ref>
On 16 May, during Southampton's final home match of the season, Mané scored three times in 2 minutes 56 seconds in a 6–1 win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] to set a new [[Premier League records and statistics|Premier League record]] for the fastest [[hat-trick]]. The record had been held since 1994 by [[Robbie Fowler]], who scored three against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 4 minutes and 33 seconds.<ref name=trick/> Mané finished the season with 10 goals from 32 appearances in all competitions.
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Audi- quattro-Cup 23.JPG|thumb|Mané (right) playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2015]]
Mané began the [[2015–16 Southampton F.C. season|2015–16 season]] by registering two assists in the [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round first leg match with [[Vitesse Arnhem]] at home and scoring in the return leg, as Southampton eased through to the next round 5–0 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667103 | title=Southampton 3–0 Vitesse Arnhem | publisher=[[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] Sport | date=30 July 2015 | accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33738509 | title=Vitesse Arnhem 0–2 Southampton | publisher=[[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] Sport | date=6 August 2015 | accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref> On 2 December, he took 39 seconds to open the scoring against Liverpool in the quarter-finals of the League Cup, but the Saints eventually lost 6–1 at home.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton 1–6 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34918281|accessdate=2 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 December 2015}}</ref>
On 2 January 2016, he was again dropped from the starting line-up by manager [[Ronald Koeman]] for a match at [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] when he turned up late for a pre-match meeting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sadio Mane: Southampton midfielder dropped for being late|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35214588|accessdate=3 January 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=2 January 2016}}</ref> He received a straight red card on 12 March at the end of a 2–1 win at [[Stoke City]] for a collision into [[Erik Pieters]],<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sharpe|first1=Rich|title=Stoke City 1 Southampton 2: Ronald Koeman says his side will appeal against Sadio Mane’s red card|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Stoke-City-1-Southampton-2-Ronald-Koeman-says/story-28913551-detail/story.html|accessdate=13 March 2016|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=13 March 2016}}</ref> although this was quickly overturned on appeal.<ref>{{cite web|title=Southampton win appeal against Sadio Mane red card|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35803664|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=15 March 2016|date=15 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sadio Mane's claim against red card upheld by Commission|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/governance/2016/mar/sadio-mane-southampton-red-card-appeal-upheld|publisher=The FA|accessdate=15 March 2016|date=15 March 2016}}</ref>
Having failed to score in the league for over four months, Mané scored twice in a 3–2 victory over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 20 March 2016,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Henson|first1=Mike|title=Southampton 3 Liverpool 2|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35796778|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 May 2016|date=20 March 2016}}</ref> followed by five goals in the next five matches, including a hat-trick in a 4–2 victory against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 1 May.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rich|first1=James|title=Southampton’s Sadio Mané in hat-trick romp against Manchester City|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/01/southampton-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=2 May 2016|work=The Guardian|date=1 May 2016}}</ref> He finished the season as Southampton's top scorer, with 15 goals in all competitions.
===Liverpool=== [[File:Liver-SM 2017 (11 cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Mané playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2017]]
On 28 June 2016, Mané joined [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for a transfer fee of £34 million on a five-year contract. The transfer fee made him the most expensive African player in history at the time.<ref name=BBC36642523>{{cite web|title=Sadio Mane: Liverpool complete £34m signing of Southampton forward|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36642523|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=28 June 2016|date=28 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10326309/sadio-mane-has-medical-as-liverpool-agree-transfer-fee-of-16334m-with-southampton|title=Sadio Mane has medical as Liverpool agree transfer fee of £34m with Southampton|last=|first=|date=28 June 2016|website=[[Sky Sports]]|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> On 14 August, he made his [[Premier League]] debut for the Reds, scoring the 4th goal in a 4–3 away win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ladyman|first1=Ian|title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool: Philippe Coutinho's magical brace and Sadio Mane stunner heap misery on Arsene Wenger's men in north London thriller |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3740114/Arsenal-3-4-Liverpool-Philippe-Coutinho-s-magical-brace-Sadio-Mane-stunner-heaps-misery-Arsene-Wenger-s-men-north-London-thriller.html|accessdate=14 August 2016|work=Daily Mail|date=14 August 2016}}</ref> Having missed Liverpool's defeat at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on match day two through a slight shoulder injury, Mane returned to the starting line-up against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup|League Cup]] where he had two assists in a 5–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Liverpool hit five to see of Burton in EFL Cup |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/232883-liverpool-hit-five-to-see-off-burton-in-efl-cup|accessdate=23 August 2016|work=LiverpoolFC.com|date=23 August 2016}}</ref>
On 19 December, Mané scored the only goal of the 227th [[Merseyside derby]] in added time against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]].<ref>{{citeweb|url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/dec/19/everton-liverpool-premier-league-match-report|title=Sadio Mané’s injury-time winner earns Liverpool dramatic derby victory|date=19 December 2016|work=Guardian|accessdate=21 December 2016}}</ref> On 11 February 2017, Mané scored two goals within two minutes against [[Tottenham Hotspur]] at Anfield, for Liverpool's first league win in 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/feb/11/liverpool-tottenham-hotspur-premier-league-match-report|title=Liverpool’s Sadio Mané fires quickfire double to stun Tottenham|first=Paul |last=Wilson|work=The Guardian|date=11 February 2017|accessdate=12 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/02/11/liverpool-vs-tottenham-premier-league-live-score/|title=Liverpool 2 Tottenham 0: Sadio Mane scores twice as Reds record first league win of 2017|first=Sam |last=Wallace|first2=JJ |last2=Bull|work=Daily Ttelegraph|date=12 February 2017|accessdate=12 February 2017}}</ref> On 20 April 2017, Mané was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] after scoring 13 league goals in his first season with Liverpool.<ref name=PFA1617>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39648483 |title=PFA teams of the year: Chelsea and Tottenham dominate Premier League XI |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> Despite missing the latter part of the campaign through injury, Mané was awarded the Liverpool [[Liverpool F.C.#Player of the Season|Player of the Season]] award on 9 May 2017.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Shaw|first1=Chris|title=Sadio Mane takes top prizes at LFC Players' Awards|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/262799-sadio-mane-takes-top-prizes-at-lfc-players-awards|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|accessdate=10 May 2017|date=9 May 2017}}</ref>
In the first match of the new season, on 12 August 2017, away to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], Mané scored Liverpool's first goal of the season in a 3–3 draw. He was named [[Premier League Player of the Month]] after scoring a goal in each of the Reds' three matches in August.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Frankland|first1=Josh|title=Liverpool's Sadio Mane wins August's Premier League Player of the Month award|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11025598/liverpools-sadio-mane-wins-augusts-premier-league-player-of-the-month-award|accessdate=8 September 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=8 September 2017}}</ref> On 9 September 2017, he was given a straight red card in the first half of a 5–0 loss to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for a high boot against goalkeeper [[Ederson Moraes|Ederson]],<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ogden|first1=Mark|title=Man City ease past Liverpool after Mane sees red for Ederson challenge|url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-match/60/post/3199105/man-city-ease-past-liverpool-after-sadio-mane-sees-red-for-ederson-challenge|accessdate=9 September 2017|publisher=ESPN|date=9 September 2017}}</ref> resulting in a three-match ban.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sadio Mane: Liverpool lose appeal against length of ban for red card|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41232863|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 September 2017|date=12 September 2017}}</ref> Mané, [[Mohamed Salah]], [[Roberto Firmino]] and [[Philippe Coutinho]] made up a prolific attacking quartet dubbed the "Fab Four" and "Fab Three" after the mid-season exit of the latter.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Burton|first1=Chris|title=Klopp sees Mane mojo back as part of Liverpool's 'Fab Three'|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/klopp-sees-mane-mojo-back-as-part-of-liverpools-fab-three/1mzi60n72yhyr1f4yt92n0oku1|accessdate=22 April 2018|publisher=Goal.com|date=20 February 2018}}</ref>
On 14 February 2018, Mané scored his first [[List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] for Liverpool in a 5–0 away win against [[F.C.Porto|Porto]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|round of 16]] first leg of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League]].<ref>{{citeweb|url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/14/sadio-mane-liverpool-jurgen-klopp-porto-champions-league|title=Sadio Mané is Liverpool’s comeback king with hat-trick, says Jürgen Klopp|date=14 February 2018|work=Guardian|accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> In doing so, he became only the second player to score an away hat-trick for the club in Europe.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/332404-liverpool-2018-review|title=Records, special nights and new stars - the story of Liverpool's 2018|publisher=Liverpool Football Club|last=Flemming|first=Scott|date=1 January 2019|accessdate=1 January 2019}}</ref> Later, with a goal in the 3–0 win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] on 14 April, he overtook [[Demba Ba]]'s record of 43 to become the highest scoring Senegalese in Premier League history.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mane makes Premier League history with latest Liverpool goal|url=http://www.goal.com/en-om/news/mane-makes-premier-league-history-with-latest-liverpool-goal/l41g5m3n7cwy1xk09e1ljeh2y|accessdate=22 April 2018|publisher=Goal.com|date=14 April 2018}}</ref>
On 26 May, during the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]], Mané scored Liverpool's equalizing goal in a 3–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite journal |author=Avi Creditor |title=LIVE: Benzema Blocks Karius Throw for Bizarre Opener, Mane Answers in UCL Final |url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/05/26/real-madrid-liverpool-champions-league-final-goals-video-salah-mane-ronaldo-isco |date=26 May 2018 |access-date=26 May 2018 |magazine=[[Sports Illustrated]] |publisher=[[Time Inc.]]}}</ref> In doing so, he became the first Senegalese player to score in the final of the competition. His goal was also his 10th for the campaign which saw Liverpool become the first team in history to have three players score 10+ goals in a single Champions League season, with Mané achieving the milestone alongside fellow [[Forward (association football)|forwards]] [[Mohamed Salah]] and [[Roberto Firmino]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/mane-makes-champions-league-history-for-liverpools-fab-three/1igcjwc8w03114w064vd49r2x|title=Mane makes Champions League history for Liverpool's 'Fab Three'|publisher=Goal|last=Burton|first=Chris|date=26 May 2018|accessdate=27 May 2018}}</ref>
On 22 November 2018, Mané signed new long-term deal with The Reds.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sadio Mane: Senegal forward agrees new long-term Liverpool deal |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46310219 |work=BBC Sport |date=22 November 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Mané was part of the [[Senegal national under-23 football team|Senegal team]] at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympic tournament]], and started every match as they advanced through [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group A|Group A]] as runners-up to [[Great Britain national football team|Great Britain]] before losing 4–2 after extra time in the quarter-finals to eventual champions [[Mexico national under-23 football team|Mexico]].
Mané was ruled out of the [[Senegal national football team|Senegalese squad]] for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] after suffering a calf injury in Southampton's 2–0 win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 1 January 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sadio Mane: Senegal midfielder to miss Africa Cup of Nations|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30676190|accessdate=5 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2014}}</ref> He later returned to the squad, and started in their final two group matches against [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]] and [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in a [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations Group C|group stage exit]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title=South Africa 1–1 Senegal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30843618|accessdate=23 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Hughes|first1=Ian|title=Senegal 0–2 Algeria|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30891881|accessdate=23 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 January 2015}}</ref>
Mané represented Senegal at the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]] in Gabon and scored a goal in each of the nation's opening two games, 2–0 wins against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]] and [[Zimbabwe national football team|Zimbabwe]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisanfield.com/2017/01/senegal-africa-cup-nations-quarter-finals-sadio-mane-scores/|title=Senegal through to Africa Cup of Nations quarter-finals as Sadio Mane scores again|website=This is Anfield|last=Lusby|first=Jack|date=20 January 2017|accessdate=29 January 2017}}</ref> After a goalless draw in the quarter-final clash against [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]], he missed in the penalty shootout as Senegal were eliminated.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jan/28/cameroon-senegal-sadio-mane-burkina-faso-tunisia-africa-cup-of-nations|title=Cameroon through to semi-finals after Senegal’s Sadio Mané misses penalty|website=Guardian|date=28 January 2017}}</ref>
In May 2018, he was named in Senegal's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced?|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|website=Goal|accessdate=18 May 2018}}</ref> He scored the opening goal in a 2–2 draw against [[Japan national football team|Japan]] in the group stage.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439190|title=World Cup 2018: Japan come back twice against Senegal to draw 2-2|date=24 June 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=25 June 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Personal life== Mané is a practising [[Muslim]] and often makes [[Dua|du'a]] before the start of each match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sadio Mane: The little man with a big heart who has fuelled Liverpool's title challenge |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sadio-mane-little-man-big-12348124 |first=James|last=Pearce |work=Liverpool Echo |date=20 December 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2018}}</ref> He pursued a career in football despite his father forbidding him from playing the sport as a child.<ref>{{cite web|title=VIDEO: Sadio Mané révèle que son père lui interdisait de jouer au foot|trans-title=Sadio Mané reveals that his father forbade him from playing football |url=http://rmcsport.bfmtv.com/football/video-sadio-mane-revele-que-son-pere-lui-interdisait-de-jouer-au-foot-1318447.html|publisher= RMC Sport News|accessdate=30 April 2018|date=3 December 2017|language=French}}</ref> He currently resides in [[Allerton, Liverpool|Allerton]] and has been burgled twice, once in November 2017 and again in February 2019.<ref>{{cite web |title=Burglars target homes of Liverpool's Mane and Lovren |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-41848346 |accessdate=20 February 2019 |publisher=BBC News |date=2 November 2017}}</ref><ref> {{cite web |title=Sadio Mane: Liverpool forward's house burgled during Champions League match |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/47309681 |accessdate=20 February 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 February 2019}}</ref>
