He is considered Europe's top five leagues' fifth most expensive player from a transfer value perspective by the [[International Centre for Sports Studies|CIES]].{{efn|As of 7 January 2019<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-observatory.com/IMG/sites/b5wp/2018/245/en/ |title=Brand new list of top transfer values for big-5 league players |publisher=International Centre for Sports Studies (CIES) |first1=Raffaele |last1=Poli |first2=Roger |last2=Besson |first3=Loïc |last3=Ravenel |date=7 January 2019 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref>}}
Salah started his senior career with Cairo club [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] in the [[Egyptian Premier League]] in 2010, departing shortly thereafter to join [[FC Basel|Basel]] for an undisclosed fee. In Switzerland, he starred as he won the league title in his debut season, winning the [[Swiss Super League|SAFP Golden Player Award]] in the process. Salah's performances then attracted [[Premier League]] side [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and he joined the club for a £11 million fee in 2014. However, he was used sparingly in his debut season and was allowed to leave on loan to [[Serie A]] clubs [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] and [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], with the latter eventually signing him permanently for €15 million.
Following consistent match-winning performances in Rome to lead them to [[2016–17 A.S. Roma season|second-placed finish and a record points-tally]] in 2017, Salah relocated back to the Premier League to sign for Liverpool for a then club-record fee of £36.9 million. During his second spell in England, Salah adapted his game from a natural winger to a complete [[Forward (association football)|forward]] and quickly became the focal point of the team. He would go on to break the club's scoring record for a debut season, receiving the [[Premier League Golden Boot]] after registering a record 32 goals in 36 league games. He also became the first player to win three [[Premier League Player of the Month]] awards in the same season. His record-breaking performances saw him receive a number of other accolades at the end of the season, including the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]], the [[FWA Footballer of the Year|Football Writers' Player of the Year]] and the [[PFA Fans' Player of the Year]] awards. Salah also came third in the award for [[The Best FIFA Men's Player#Winners|the 2018 Best FIFA Men's Player]].
At international level, Salah represented Egypt at youth level, winning a bronze medal in the [[Africa U-20 Cup of Nations]], and participated in the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and the [[2012 Summer Olympics]]. He was awarded the [[CAF Awards|CAF Most Promising African Talent]] of the Year in 2012.<ref name="cafonline 21-12-2012">{{cite web |url=http://www.cafonline.com/football/news/16154-toure-wins-his-second-african-player-of-the-year-award.html |title=Toure wins his second African Player of the Year Award |website=Confederation of African Football online.com |date=21 December 2012 |accessdate=21 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=29 October 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029194936/http://www.cafonline.com/football/news/16154-toure-wins-his-second-african-player-of-the-year-award.html}}</ref> Making his debut with the senior national team in 2011, he helped Egypt reach the final of the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]], and he became the top scorer during [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CAF)|CAF qualification]] to help the team qualify for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]. For his performances, Salah was named [[CAF African Footballer of the Year]] twice and the [[BBC African Footballer of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/04/liverpool-mohamed-salah-african-footballer-year |title=Liverpool's Mohamed Salah wins African footballer of the year |newspaper=The Guardian |date=4 January 2018 |accessdate=4 January 2018 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/41802268 |title=Salah named African Footballer of the Year 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 December 2017 |author=Paul Fletcher |accessdate=4 January 2018}}</ref> He was also selected in the [[CAF Team of the Year]] and [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations#Awards|Africa Cup of Nations Team of the Tournament]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.soccerladuma.co.za/news/articles/international/categories/african-football/caf-announces-2017-african-team-of-the-year/286372 |title=CAF Announces 2017 African Team of the Year |website=soccerladuma.co.za |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/galleries/nations-cup-2017-team-of-the-tournament/1/1izlgkcrkx7gk1vkucyhqs6822 |title=Nations Cup 2017: Team of the Tournament |website=Goal.com |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== ===El Mokawloon=== Salah played his youth football with [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]]. He made his senior team debut in the [[Egyptian Premier League]] coming on as a substitute on 3 May 2010 in a 1–1 away draw against [[El Mansoura SC|El Mansoura]]. During the [[2010–11 Egyptian Premier League|2010–11 season]] Salah continued earning minutes on the pitch, eventually becoming a regular in the team.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/mohamed-salah-how-a-boy-from-egypt-is-now-the-king-of-liverpool |title=Mohamed Salah: How a boy from Egypt is now the King of Liverpool |date=23 April 2018 |author=Saketh Ayyagari |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for them on 25 December 2010 in a 1–1 away draw against [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.whoscored.com/Matches/413347/Live/Egypt-Premier-League-2010-2011-Al-Ahly-Al-Mokawloon-Al-Arab |title=Al Ahly 1–1 Al Mokawloon Al Arab – Premier League 2010/2011 Live |website=WhoScored.com |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> He remained a regular for El Mokawloon, appearing in every game of the [[2011-12 Egyptian Premier League|2011–12 season]]. Following the [[Port Said Stadium riot]] on 1 February 2012, the Egyptian Premier League was suspended, and on 10 March 2012, the [[Egyptian Football Association]] announced their decision to cancel the remainder of the season.<ref name=BBC2>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17324997 |title=Egypt's Premier League cancelled |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 March 2012 |accessdate=11 March 2012}}</ref>
===Basel=== [[Swiss Super League]] club [[FC Basel|Basel]] had been monitoring Salah for some time, so following the Egyptian Premier League suspension, the club organised a friendly match with the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egypt U-23 team]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2015/08/11-things-you-need-to-know-about-mohamed-salah |title=11 Things You Need to Know About Mohamed Salah |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=6 August 2015 |author=Paul Rogers |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> The match took place on 16 March at the [[Stadion Rankhof]] in [[Basel]], and despite only playing the second half, Salah scored twice, helping the Egyptians to a 4–3 win.<ref name="Caspar Marti">{{cite web |url=https://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2012/03/16/Munteres-Testspiel-gegen-Agyptens-Olympia-Auswahl |title=Cheerful test match against Egypt's Olympics selection ends 3:4 (Translation) |language=de |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |date=16 March 2012 |author=Caspar Marti |accessdate=16 March 2012}}</ref> Basel subsequently invited Salah to remain in the city for a week's training. On 10 April 2012, it was announced that Salah had signed for Basel on a four-year contract starting from 15 June 2012.<ref name="Georges Küng">{{cite news |url=https://www.bzbasel.ch/basel/basel-stadt/fc-basel-verpflichtet-den-aegyptischen-jungstar-mohamed-salah-124081175 |title=FC Basel commit to young Egyptian star Mohamed Salah (Translation) |language=de |newspaper=Basellandschaftliche Zeitung |date=10 April 2012 |author=Georges Küng |accessdate=17 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/53/38929/Sports/Talents-Abroad/Egypt-rising-star-Salah-officially-joins-FC-Basel.aspx |title=Egypt rising star Salah officially joins FC Basel |newspaper=Al-Ahram |year=2012 |author=Ahmed Abd El Rasoul |accessdate=10 April 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kingfut.com/2018/02/13/former-basel-president-salah/ |title=Former Basel President recalls watching Salah live for first time |publisher=KingFut |date=13 February 2018 |author=Abdelrahman Amr |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
====2012–13: Development and breakthrough==== [[File:Zenit-bazel 2013 (2).jpg|thumb|upright|Salah playing for Basel away at [[Zenit St Petersburg]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]] in March 2013]]
Salah scored on his unofficial debut on 23 June 2012 against [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]] during a friendly match, a 4–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.live-result.com/football/matches/match239282_Steaua+Bucharest-Basel-online/ |title=Steaua Bucharest 4–2 Basel – result and match statistics |date=23 June 2012 |website=live-result.com |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> He made his official Basel debut in a [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] preliminary stage match against the Norwegian club [[Molde FK|Molde]] on 8 August, coming on as a substitute in the 74th minute.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/basel-v-molde/60o3kpx88onlvn1o0k6ji9vbp |title=Basel 1 – 1 Molde Team line-ups |website=Goal.com |date=8 August 2012 |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> He made his league debut on 12 August against [[FC Thun|Thun]], playing the full match.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kingfut.com/2012/08/12/mohamed-salah-involved-in-all-3-of-basels-goals-on-league-debut/ |title=Mohamed Salah involved in all three Basel goals on league debut |publisher=KingFut |date=12 August 2012 |author=KingFut Team |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> He scored his first league goal a week later, the second goal in the 2–0 home win against [[FC Lausanne-Sport|Lausanne]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/basel-vs-lausanne-sports/264597 |title=Swiss Super League {{!}} Basel 2–0 Lausanne Sports|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 August 2012|accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref> Salah scored his first [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] goal in the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Quarter-finals|quarter-finals]] on 11 April 2013, as Basel advanced to the semi-finals by beating [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] 4–1 on [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]] after a 4–4 aggregate draw.<ref name="uefa 2013-04-112">{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000359/match=2010088/index.html |title=Basel break Spurs' hearts from the spot |publisher=UEFA |date=11 April 2013 |accessdate=11 April 2013}}</ref> In the semi-final on 2 May, Salah scored against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], although they were beaten 2–5 on aggregate.<ref name="eufa 2013-05-032">{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1945605.html#basel+take+heart |title=Basel take heart after Chelsea defeat |publisher=UEFA |date=3 May 2013 |author=Trevor Haylett |accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref> Despite late disappointment in Europe, Basel comfortably won the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|Swiss Super League season 2012–13]] Championship title<ref name="eufa 2013-06-102">{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=sui/news/newsid=1959420.html |title=Season review: Switzerland |publisher=UEFA |year=2013 |author=Michael Schifferle |accessdate=10 June 2013}}</ref> and finished runners-up in the [[2012–13 Swiss Cup|Swiss Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.football.ch/SFV/Schweizer-Cups/schweizer-cup/Statistik-und-Resultate.aspx/oid-1/s-2013/ |title=Statistik und Resultate {{!}} Final – Schweizer Cup {{!}} 2013|language=de|publisher=Schweizerischer Fussballverband|accessdate=20 May 2013}}</ref>
====2013–14: Final season and league championship==== To the start of the [[2013–14 Swiss Super League]] season Salah was member of the Basel team that won the 2013 [[Uhrencup]].<ref name="fcb 2013-07-082">{{cite web |url=https://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2013/07/08/Der-FCB-gewinnt-den-Uhrencup-2013-mit-einem-Sieg-g |title=FCB wins the 2013 Uhrencup with a victory against Red Star Belgrade (Translation) |language=de |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |date=8 July 2013 |author=Caspar Marti |accessdate=8 July 2013}}</ref> Salah scored on his first league appearance against [[FC Aarau|Aarau]] on 13 July 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/basel-v-aarau/3gu4g4t82whn2qb1sc43p3ogk |title=Basel v Aarau Match preview |website=Goal.com |date=13 January 2013 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> He scored his first [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal a month later against [[Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.|Maccabi Tel Aviv]] on 6 August 2013 in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|third qualifying round]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000477/match=2011724/index.html |title=Maccabi revival comes too late to halt Basel |publisher=UEFA |date=6 August 2013 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> Before the first leg on 30 July 2013, Salah did not take part in the [[UEFA]]-mandated pre-match handshakes with Maccabi players. Basel called the incident a "coincidence" and said it was not intended as a snub. Salah was on pressure from several Egyptian voices demanding from him not to travel to Israel and then criticizing his visit. On the return leg in Tel Aviv, he took part in the handshake line, but offered [[fist bump]]s rather than an open hand to Maccabi players.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/mohamed-salah-and-the-maccabi-tel-aviv-handshake-furore-surrounding-chelseas-latest-signing-9081607.html |title=Mohamed Salah and the Maccabi Tel Aviv handshake furore surrounding Chelsea's latest signing |newspaper=The Independent |date=24 January 2014 |author=Sam Wallace}}</ref> He scored twice against the [[Bulgarian A Football Group|Bulgarian league]] champions [[PFC Ludogorets Razgrad]] on 21 August 2013 in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|play-off round]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000478/match=2011740/index.html |title=Basel take charge against Ludogorets |publisher=UEFA |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> On 18 September 2013, Salah scored the equalizer against [[Chelsea F.C|Chelsea]] in the 2–1 away win during the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group E|group stage]]. During the return tie on 26 November at the [[St. Jakob-Park]], Salah scored the winning goal as Basel beat Chelsea for the second time with a 1–0 home win.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011760/index.html |title=Basel FC BS Chelsea Group stage Match Report |publisher=UEFA |date=18 September 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2014}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== ====2013–14: Entry into first-team squad==== On 23 January 2014, [[Chelsea F.C|Chelsea]] announced that a deal had been agreed with Basel to bring Salah to London for a fee reported to be in the region of £11 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25868272 |title=Mohamed Salah: Chelsea sign Basel midfielder for £11m |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 January 2014 |accessdate=18 September 2018}}</ref> Three days later the transfer was completed, making him the first Egyptian to sign for the [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge club]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2014/01/26/salah-move-completed |title=Salah Move Completed |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=18 January 2014 |accessdate=26 January 2014}}</ref>
On 8 February, Salah made his debut for Chelsea in the [[Premier League]], coming on as a substitute in the 3–0 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/chelsea-vs-newcastle/287527 |title=Premier League {{!}} Chelsea 3–0 Newcastle|publisher=Sky Sports|date=8 February 2014|accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> On 22 March, Salah scored his first goal for Chelsea against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in the London Derby, coming on as a substitute for [[Oscar (footballer born 1991)|Oscar]], in a match which ended with a 6–0 win for the Blues.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26590673 |title=Chelsea 6–0 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 March 2014 |author=Aimee Lewis |accessdate=22 March 2014}}</ref> On 5 April, Salah opened the scoring and later won a penalty and an assist in Chelsea's 3–0 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2014/04/06/match-report--chelsea-3-stoke-city-0 |title=Match Report: Chelsea 3 Stoke City 0 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=6 April 2014 |accessdate=17 September 2018}}</ref>
====2014–15: Domestic success==== [[File:Mohamed Salah with Chelsea - Jan 2015.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Salah playing for Chelsea away at [[Tottenham Hotspur]] on 1 January 2015]]
Before the [[2014–15 Chelsea F.C. season|2014–15 season]], Salah's future with Chelsea looked to be in a balance after reports suggested he could be forced to return to Egypt to carry out military service after his registration for an education scheme was rescinded by the Egyptian Minister of Higher Education.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://metro.co.uk/2014/07/19/chelsea-midfielder-mohamed-salah-could-be-forced-into-military-service-by-egyptian-government-4803656/ |title=Chelsea midfielder Mohamed Salah 'could be forced into military service by Egyptian government' |newspaper=Metro |date=19 July 2014 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> He was spared of military service after the meeting with the then Egyptian prime minister Ibrahim Mahlab, the Minister of Higher Education and the Egyptian national manager [[Shawky Gharib]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/mohamed-salah-will-not-have-to-serve-military-service-after-the-egyptian-prime-minister-steps-in-to-solve-chelsea-midfielders-travel-issue--reports-9618033.html |title=Mohamed Salah: Chelsea midfielder will NOT have to serve military service after Egyptian Prime Minister steps |newspaper=The Independent |date=21 July 2014 |author=Jack de Menezes |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> Salah changed squad numbers from 15 to 17 for the start of the season, with his new number having been vacated by [[Eden Hazard]] changing to number 10.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2014/08/15/squad-number-changes |title=Squad Number Changes |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=15 August 2014 |accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref>
Salah was rarely used during the season. On 28 October 2014, in a 2–1 win at [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] in the fourth round of the League Cup, he took a shot that went so far off target that it went for a throw-in.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/making-mohamed-salah-no-stage-did-i-believe-i-didnt-belong-level-absolutely-not |title=The making of Mohamed Salah: "At no stage did I believe I didn’t belong at this level. Absolutely not" |website=FourFourTwo |date=1 May 2018 |author=Andrew Murray |accessdate=3 May 2018}}</ref> After the game, he and fellow winger [[André Schürrle]] were criticized publicly by manager [[José Mourinho]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://global.espn.com/football/league-name/story/2115735/headline |title=Jose Mourinho hits out at Schurrle and Salah after Chelsea beat Shrewsbury |publisher=ESPN |date=29 October 2014 |accessdate=3 May 2018}}</ref> Although Salah only made three league appearances before his loan move to [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]], Mourinho stated that he would receive a replica winner's medal from the club for his contributions that season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/story/2450893/jose-mourinho-every-chelsea-player-to-get-prem-medal |title=Every Chelsea player to get a Premier League medal says Jose Mourinho |date=15 May 2015 |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=24 April 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Fiorentina==== On transfer deadline, 2 February 2015, Chelsea confirmed that Salah would play for the Italian club Fiorentina on an 18-month loan until the end of the [[2015–16 Serie A|2015–16]] season, as part of a transfer deal which saw [[Juan Cuadrado]] moving in the opposite direction, Salah chose the number 74 shirt in honor of the victims of the [[Port Said Stadium riot]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/mohamed-salah-chelsea-midfielder-completes-loan-switch-to-fiorentina-paving-way-for-juan-cuadrado-transfer-10018846.html |title=Salah to Fiorentina on loan |newspaper=The Independent |date=2 February 2015 |author=Sam Wallace |accessdate=2 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2015/02/02/salah-completed-fiorentina-loan |title=Salah completed Fiorentina loan |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=2 February 2015 |accessdate=2 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/serie-a/fiorentina/2015/02/06/news/fiorentina_salah_sceglie_il_numero_74_per_le_vittime_di_port_said_-106692310/ |title=Fiorentina, Salah chooses number 74: "For the victims of Port Said" (Translation) |language=it |newspaper=la Repubblica |date=6 February 2015 |accessdate=4 August 2017}}</ref> Six days after signing, he made his Fiorentina debut coming off the bench in the 65th minute as a replacement for [[Joaquín (footballer)|Joaquín]] in a 3–2 [[Serie A]] victory against [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] at the [[Stadio Artemio Franchi]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/italian-serie-a/match/403619/fiorentina-atalanta/report |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Fiorentina 3–2 Atalanta|publisher=ESPN |date=8 February 2015 |accessdate=8 February 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Mohamed Salah 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Salah playing for [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] against [[Dynamo Kiev]] in 2015]]
Salah made his first start for Fiorentina on 14 February against [[U.S. Sassuolo Calcio|Sassuolo]], scoring his first goal for the club in the 30th minute. He then provided an assist to [[Khouma Babacar]] just two minutes after scoring; the match ended in a 3–1 win for Fiorentina.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2953939/Chelsea-s-Mohamed-Salah-shines-Fiorentina-leading-3−1-win-Sassuolo-help-Champions-League-chase.html |title=Chelsea's Mohamed Salah shines for Fiorentina by leading them to a 3–1 win over Sassuolo to help Champions League chase |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=14 February 2015 |author=Daniella Matar |accessdate=14 February 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=December 2018}}</ref> Twelve days after that, Salah scored his first European goal for Fiorentina, as his side advanced to the Round of 16 of the [[Europa League]], beating Tottenham 3–1 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/football-fiorentina-v-tottenham-preview-mauricio-pochettino-plans-184504503--sow.html |title=Gómez and Salah scores as Fiorentina eliminate Spurs |publisher=Eurosport |accessdate=26 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=2216141.html |title=UEFA Europa League round of 16 draw |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=27 February 2015}}</ref> Salah scored the winning goal for Fiorentina against [[Inter Milan]] on 1 March, his third goal in Serie A.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2974806/Inter-Milan-0-1-Fiorentina-Chelsea-loanee-Mohamed-Salah-nets-second-half-winner-visitors-rich-vein-form-continues.html |title=Inter Milan 0–1 Fiorentina: Chelsea loanee Mohamed Salah nets second-half winner for visitors as their rich vein of form continues |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=1 March 2015 |accessdate=2 March 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=December 2018}}</ref> Four days after that, Salah scored both of Fiorentina's goals in their 2–1 win away to [[Juventus]] in the [[Coppa Italia]] semi-final first leg.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/juventus-v-fiorentina/alv99im8bqbpsf8pit5f1rxt5 |title=Juventus 1–2 Fiorentina: Salah double gives Viola vital victory |website=Goal.com |date=5 March 2015 |accessdate=5 March 2015}}</ref> At the end of the season, Fiorentina reportedly activated an option to make the loan move permanent, but Salah refused the move. Even though the loan agreement was for 18 months, Salah refused to return to Fiorentina and instead joined fellow Serie A club [[A.S. Roma|Roma]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2640885-chelsea-transfer-news-mohamed-salah-compensation-reportedly-eyed-by-fiorentina |title=Mohamed Salah Compensation Reportedly Eyed by Fiorentina |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=18 May 2016 |author=Gianni Verschueren}}</ref><ref name=SalahViola2>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34619616 |title=Fiorentina 1–2 Roma |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 October 2015}}</ref>
====Loan to Roma==== On 6 August 2015, Salah joined [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] on a season-long loan for €5 million;<ref name=2015Roma2>{{cite press release |url=https://res.cloudinary.com/as-roma-turbine-sandbox/image/upload/v1447686142/asroma-uat/rnn6lwxgerygsbrm1jrj.pdf |title=Transfer Market {{!}} Mohamed Salah Ghaly (Translation)|language=it|publisher=A.S. Roma|date=6 August 2015|format=PDF|accessdate=11 June 2016}}</ref> with the option to make the deal permanent,<ref name=2015Roma2/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/06/chelsea-mohamed-salah-loan-roma |title=Chelsea winger Mohamed Salah joins Roma on a season-long loan |newspaper=The Guardian |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> for a reported €15 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://gianlucadimarzio.com/it/roma-ufficiale-larrivo-dal-chelsea-di-salah-i-dettagli-delloperazione |title=Roma, the official arrival of Salah from Chelsea: details of the transfer (Translation) |language=it |publisher=Sky Italia |date=6 August 2015 |author=Gianluca Di Marzio |accessdate=18 November 2017}}</ref> He wore the number 11 shirt.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2015/08/mohamed-salah-to-wear-number-11-at-roma |title=Mohamed Salah to wear number 11 at Roma |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=6 August 2015 |author=Paul Rogers |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> He made his debut on 22 August, as the new season began with a 1–1 draw at [[Hellas Verona F.C.|Hellas Verona]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3207242/Hellas-Verona-1-1-Roma-Rudi-Garcia-s-fail-win-opener-Edin-Dzeko-Gervinho-Wojciech-Szczesny-feature-visitors.html |title=Hellas Verona 1–1 Roma: Rudi Garcia's side fail to win opener as Edin Dzeko, Gervinho and Wojciech Szczesny feature for visitors |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=22 August 2015 |accessdate=30 August 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=December 2018}}</ref> On 11 September, [[ACF Fiorentina]] filed a complaint to FIFA with the claim that Chelsea alleging breach of contract when they allowed Salah to join Roma on loan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/story/2605678/fiorentina-complain-to-fifa-over-salah-loan-from-chelsea |title=Fiorentina complain to FIFA over Salah's Roma loan from Chelsea |publisher=ESPN |date=11 September 2015}}</ref> On 20 September, Salah scored his first goal of the season against [[U.S. Sassuolo Calcio|Sassuolo]] to help Roma salvage a point as the match ended in a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/roma-vs-sassuolo/350287 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Roma 2–2 Sassuolo|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 September 2015}}</ref> He went on to score in his following two matches, a 2–1 loss against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] and a 5–1 win against [[Carpi FC 1909|Carpi]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/sampdoria-vs-roma/350298 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Sampdoria 2–1 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/roma-vs-carpi/350306 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Roma 5–1 Carpi|publisher=Sky Sports|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 25 October, Salah returned to the [[Stadio Artemio Franchi]], scoring the opener against his former Serie A side Fiorentina to help earn a fourth straight league win for Roma. In his return, Salah was also sent off after picking up a second yellow in the closing minutes of the game, only seconds after picking up his first yellow.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/fiorentina-vs-roma/350333 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Fiorentina 1–2 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|date=25 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34619616 |title=Fiorentina 1–2 Roma |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 October 2015 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 4 November, he scored the opening goal of a [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage#Roma v Bayer Leverkusen|3–2]] [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] win over [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000634/match=2015722/index.html |title=Roma 3–2 Leverkusen |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref>
On 2 February 2016, Salah scored in a 2–0 away win over [[U.S. Sassuolo Calcio|Sassuolo]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/sassuolo-vs-roma/350478 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Sassuolo 0–2 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 February 2016|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> Ten days later, on 12 February, he scored in a 3–1 win over Carpi.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/carpi-vs-roma/350490 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Carpi 1–3 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|date=12 February 2016|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 21 February, he scored two goals in quick succession, in a 5–0 home win over Palermo.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35623573 |title=Roma 5–0 Palermo |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 February 2016 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 4 March, Salah scored twice in a 4–1 win over former club Fiorentina, overtaking them in the top three.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35693381 |title=Roma 4–1 Fiorentina |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 March 2016 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> A week later, on 11 March, he scored in a 1–1 draw with [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/en/serie-a/match-report/2015-16/UNICO/UNI/32/ROMBOL |title=Fixtures and Results {{!}} Season 2015–16 {{!}} 32^ Match Day|website=Lega Serie A online|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 2 May, he scored in a 3–2 away win over Genoa.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/genoa-vs-roma/350602 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} Genoa 2–3 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 May 2016|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 14 May, he scored in a 3–1 away win over [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] on the last day of the league season, scoring the opening goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/ac-milan-vs-roma/350625 |title=Italian Serie A {{!}} AC Milan 1–3 Roma|publisher=Sky Sports|date=14 May 2016|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> At the end of the season, Salah was named Player of the Season, finishing as the club's top goalscorer with 15 goals in all competitions (14 in Serie A) and six assists.<ref name=RomaPOS1516>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2016/6/as-roma-awards-2015-16-player-of-the-season |title=AS Roma Awards 2015–16: Player of the Season |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=28 June 2016}}</ref>

Sampdoria|Sampdoria]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/en/serie-a/match-report/2016-17/UNICO/UNI/3/ROMSAM |title=Fixtures and Results {{!}} Season 2016–17 {{!}} 3^ Match Day|website=Lega Serie A online|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> Ten days later, on 21 September, he scored in a 4–0 win over [[F.C.
