===Liverpool=== ====2017–18: Record-breaking season and individual success==== [[File:Mohamed Salah 2017.jpg|thumb|upright|Salah playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2017. His performances in the [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]] saw him receive numerous accolades, including [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] and the [[FWA Footballer of the Year|Football Writers' Player of the Year]].]]
On 22 June 2017, Salah agreed a transfer to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. He signed a long-term contract with the Reds for an initial €42m fee that could rise to €50m.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2017/6/roma-and-liverpool-agree-salah-transfer |title=Roma and Liverpool agree Salah transfer |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=6 September 2017}}</ref> The fee was a club record, eclipsing the £35m spent on [[Andy Carroll]] in 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/22/liverpool-transfer-deal-mohamed-salah-roma |title=Liverpool complete record £36.9m signing of Mohamed Salah from Roma |newspaper=The Guardian |date=22 June 2017 |author=Mark Dobson}}</ref> He was assigned the number 11 shirt previously worn by [[Roberto Firmino]] who instead switched to number 9. He joined the club on 1 July upon the opening of the summer transfer window, becoming Liverpool's first Egyptian player.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/266595-liverpool-fc-complete-signing-of-mohamed-salah |title=Liverpool FC complete signing of Mohamed Salah |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=22 June 2017 |author=David Lynch |accessdate=22 June 2017}}</ref> He scored on his debut against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in a 3–3 draw on 12 August.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835424 |title=Watford 3–3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 August 2017 |author=Neil Johnston |accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref> On 24 August, Salah scored his second goal for Liverpool, in a [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|2017–18 UEFA Champions League play-off round]] 4–2 win (6–3 agg) against [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]], his first goal at [[Anfield]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/aug/23/liverpool-v-hoffenheim-champions-league-play-off-second-leg-live |title=Liverpool 4–2 Hoffenheim |newspaper=The Guardian |date=31 March 2018}}</ref> Three days later, Salah scored and assisted a goal in a 4–0 victory over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40990427 |title=Liverpool 4–0 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2017 |author=Phil McNulty |accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref> For his performances in August, Salah was awarded Player of the Month by Liverpool supporters.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/274223-mohamed-salah-claims-player-of-the-month-award-for-august |title=Mohamed Salah claims Player of the Month award for August |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=5 September 2017}}</ref> On 17 October, Salah netted twice in a 7–0 Champions League win over [[NK Maribor|Maribor]], helping Liverpool to the joint-largest ever away win in the competition, and the largest away win by an English club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/liverpool-record-champions-league-firsts-with-seven-goal-mauling-/1lddar82iw4ma19djblaj0b0fg |title=Liverpool record Champions League firsts with seven goal Mauling |website=Goal.com |date=17 October 2017 |author=Chris Burton |accessdate=18 October 2017}}</ref>
On 26 November, Salah scored the opener and refused to celebrate in a 1–1 home draw with his former team Chelsea out of respect for the club as well as victims of the [[2017 Sinai mosque attack|North Sinai Mosque attack]] two days earlier.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/didnt-celebrate-fans-cant-believe-11587564 |title=Why didn't he celebrate?! Fans can't believe Mo Salah's reaction to scoring against former club Chelsea |newspaper=Daily Mirror |date=25 November 2017 |accessdate=26 November 2017}}</ref> Salah hit the top of the Premier League goal scoring charts by scoring twice after coming on as a substitute away at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 29 November in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42075941 |title=Stoke City 0 Liverpool 3 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 November 2017 |author=Mike Henson |accessdate=30 November 2017}}</ref> The following month, Salah netted in a 4–0 win over [[AFC Bournemouth]]; a result which saw Liverpool become the first team in Premier League history to win four consecutive away league matches by a margin of at least three goals.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/liverpool-make-history-with-away-game-goal-tally/12jskoyjq9br01o8rlni44sp02 |title=Liverpool Make History with Record Away Goal Tally |website=Goal.com |date=17 December 2017 |author=Stephen Crawford |accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref> In the process, he also became the joint-second fastest player to reach 20 goals for Liverpool on his 26th appearance, only behind [[George Allan (footballer, born 1875)|George Allan]] who reached the milestone in 19 appearances in 1895.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/dec/17/mohamed-salah-bournemouth-liverpool-suarez-rush |title=Mohamed Salah shreds Bournemouth to leave Suárez and Rush in his wake |newspaper=The Guardian |date=17 December 2017 |author=Ben Fisher |accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref>
On 17 March 2018, Salah scored four goals in a 5–0 win over Watford, which was his first hat-trick for Liverpool. In this game, he also broke a record of scoring 36 times in his debut season for Liverpool, and also became the leading goalscorer in Europe's top five leagues – overtaking Barcelona's [[Lionel Messi]] and Tottenham striker [[Harry Kane]]. Following Salah's record-breaking goal exploits former Liverpool captain [[Steven Gerrard]] stated "we are witnessing the start of greatness".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43444922 |title=Mohamed Salah 'on his way' to Lionel Messi comparisons – Liverpool boss Klopp |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 March 2018}}</ref>
On 22 April 2018, Salah was awarded the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] award,<ref name="1718PPOTY">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43860354 |title=Mohamed Salah: Liverpool forward voted PFA Player of the Year 2017–18 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 April 2018 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref> having earlier been named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the Premier League.<ref name=1718PFA2>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43810017 |title=Manchester City players dominate PFA team of the year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 April 2018 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref> Two days later, he scored a brace in a 5–2 Champions League semi-final first leg win over former club, Roma. In doing so, he simultaneously became the first player from Africa and the first Liverpool player to score 10 goals in a single campaign in the tournament. His double also took him to 43 goals for the season across all competitions, surpassing [[Roger Hunt]]'s tally of 42, and making him Liverpool's second-highest goalscorer in a single season, behind [[Ian Rush]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43888254 |title=Mohamed Salah: The night the 'phenomenal' Liverpool man downed Roma |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 April 2018 |accessdate=25 April 2018}}</ref> He had previously also broken the club's record for the Premier League era, surpassing [[Robbie Fowler]]'s total of 36 goals set in the [[1995–96 Liverpool F.C. season|1995–96]] campaign, and [[Fernando Torres]]' record of 33 for the most goals by a Liverpool player in a debut season.<ref name="Nick Wright">{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11311387/mohamed-salah-breaking-records-with-liverpool-scoring-exploits |title=Mohamed Salah breaking records with Liverpool scoring exploits |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 March 2018 |author=Nick Wright |accessdate=5 April 2018}}</ref> After his two goals and assists in the first leg against Roma, Salah featured in the second leg as Liverpool beat [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] 6–7 on aggregate to qualify for the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final|final]] for the first time in eleven years.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/may/02/roma-v-liverpool-champions-league-semi-final-second-leg-live |title=Roma 4–2 Liverpool (agg: 6–7): Champions League semi-final – as it happened |newspaper=The Guardian |date=2 May 2018 |author=Jacob Steinberg |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> He would then become the Premier League's all-time goalscorer for a 38 game season, registering his 32nd league goal in a 4–0 win against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] en route to being awarded the [[Premier League Golden Boot]].<ref name=Goal.com2>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/mohamed-salah-wins-premier-league-golden-boot/1belmy91ix9yp1fcly7c57sm1z |title=Mohamed Salah wins Premier League Golden Boot |website=Goal.com |date=13 May 2018 |author=Shina Oludare |accessdate=13 May 2018}}</ref>
In the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], Salah injured his left shoulder in the 30th minute.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/05/26/liverpool-star-mohamed-salah-tears-suffering-injury-champions-league-final-7580742/ |title=Liverpool star Mohamed Salah in tears after suffering injury in Champions League final |newspaper=Metro |date=26 May 2018 |author=James Goldman |accessdate=29 May 2018}}</ref> After initially carrying on, he left the field in tears after going to ground in a challenge with Madrid defender [[Sergio Ramos]];<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/05/26/mohamed-salah-tears-champions-league-final-ends-early-injury |title=Mohamed Salah in tears as Champions League final ends in early injury heartbreak after Sergio Ramos challenge |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=27 May 2018}}</ref> the match ended in a 3–1 defeat. The Egyptian FA stated that this would have no effect on his playing at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] in Russia and that Salah would still be named in the team's final squad on 4 June.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/story/3510907/egypt-optimistic-mohamed-salah-can-play-in-world-cup-after-shoulder-injury |title=Egypt 'optimistic' Mohamed Salah can play in World Cup after shoulder injury |publisher=ESPN |date=26 May 2018 |author=Glenn Price}}</ref> The day after the match, Ramos wrote a message and sent him good wishes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/05/26/mohamed-salah-tears-champions-league-final-ends-early-injury/ |title=Sergio Ramos sends good well wishes to Mohamed Salah after injured Liverpool forward's Champions League final ends in tears |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=27 May 2018 |author=Callum Davis |accessdate=30 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19==== [[File:Mo Salah 2018 (cropped).jpg|200px|thumb|Salah during a warm-up ahead of a pre-season match on 7 August 2018.]]
On 2 July 2018, Salah signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/305671-mohamed-salah-contract-liverpool-fc |title=Mohamed Salah signs new long-term Liverpool deal |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=2 July 2018 |author=James Carroll |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref> Manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] said the news was important as a statement of intent in terms of Liverpool's status in the football world in having Salah commit himself further to the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/305670-jurgen-klopp-mohamed-salah-contract-liverpool-fc |title=Jürgen Klopp: Salah's commitment is a sign for Liverpool |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=2 July 2018 |author=James Carroll |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref> On 12 August, Salah scored his first goal of the season and Liverpool's first overall goal of the season, in a 4–0 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45073328 |title=Liverpool 4–0 West Ham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 August 2018 |author=Steve Sutcliffe |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/aug/12/liverpool-v-west-ham-united-premier-league-live |title=Liverpool 4–0 West Ham United: Premier League – as it happened |newspaper=The Guardian |date=12 August 2018 |author=Simon Burnton |accessdate=13 August 2018 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref> On 20 August, in a 2–0 away win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], Salah played a part in both of Liverpool's goals; winning a penalty for the first after being kicked in the shins twice, and providing an assist for [[Sadio Mané]] for the second.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45165666 |title=Crystal Palace 0–2 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 August 2018 |author=Emlyn Begley |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/did-liverpool-star-mohamed-salah-dive-to-win-penalty-against-crystal-palace-a3916691.html |title=Did Mohamed Salah dive to win penalty against Palace? |newspaper=London Evening Standard |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 25 August, Salah scored the only goal in Liverpool's 1–0 win over [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-brighton-mohamed-salah-goal-manchester-city-table-report-a8508206.html |title=Mohamed Salah downs Brighton as Liverpool capitalise on Manchester City hiccup to move top |newspaper=The Independent |date=25 August 2018 |author=Andy Kelly |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref>
On 30 August 2018, Salah was named on the three-man [[UEFA Men's Player of the Year Award#2017–18|shortlist]] for the [[UEFA Men's Player of the Year Award|UEFA Men's Player of the Year]], coming in third place,<ref name="Luka Modrić">{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2567658.html |title=Luka Modrić wins UEFA Men's Player of the Year award |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref> and was also included on the three-man [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League#Forward of the season|shortlist]] for the [[UEFA Club Football Awards#Best Forward|UEFA Forward of the Season]], coming in second place.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2565827.html |title=Modrić, Ronaldo and Salah up for Player of the Year |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2565826.html |title=Champions League positional awards: nominees announced |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2567664.html |title=Cristiano Ronaldo: Champions League Forward of the Season |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref> On 3 September he was named on the three-man [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2018|shortlist]] for [[The Best FIFA Football Awards|the Best FIFA Men's Player]], finishing third.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11489557/mohamed-salah-cristiano-ronaldo-and-luka-modric-nominated-for-best-fifa-mens-player |title=Mohamed Salah, Cristiano Ronaldo and Luka Modric nominated for Best FIFA Men's Player |publisher=Sky Sports |date=3 September 2018 |author=Liam Grace |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref><ref name=BestFIFA>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/the-best-fifa-football-awards/best-fifa-mens-player/ |title=The Best FIFA Men's Player |publisher=FIFA |date=24 September 2018}}</ref> Amid controversy and online protest, Salah received the [[FIFA Puskás Award|2018 FIFA Puskás Award]] for goal of the year, the winning strike his goal at Anfield in his first [[Merseyside derby]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.givemesport.com/1394109-james-milner-reacts-brilliantly-on-twitter-to-mo-salahs-controversial-puskas-award |title=James Milner reacts brilliantly on Twitter to Mo Salah's controversial Puskas Award |website=GiveMeSport.com |date=25 September 2018 |author=Dov Rawson |accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/09/25/mohamed-salah-trolled-by-liverpool-team-mate-over-puskas-award-7976273/ |title=Mohamed Salah trolled by Liverpool team-mate over Puskas Award |newspaper=Metro |date=25 September 2018 |accessdate=29 September 2018 |quote=Mohamed Salah controversially won the Puskas award at the Best FIFA Football Awards 2018 on Monday night ... [he] was delighted to pick up the award, despite the controversy.}}</ref> On 24 October, Salah scored twice against [[Red Star Belgrade]] in the UEFA Champions League [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group C|group stage]], with his second goal his 50th for the club.<ref name="Half century"/> With 50 goals in 65 games he is the fastest player in Liverpool history to reach the half century.<ref name="Half century">{{cite news |title=Mohamed Salah scores 50th Liverpool goal – and SMASHES long-standing record |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mohamed-salah-scores-50th-liverpool-15325023 |accessdate=25 October 2018 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo}}</ref>
On 8 December, Salah scored a hat-trick in a 4–0 away win over Bournemouth, to move Liverpool to the top of the [[2018–19 Premier League#League table|league table]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46409327 |title=Bournemouth 0–4 Liverpool |date=8 December 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=14 December 2018}}</ref> On 11 December, he scored the winning goal in a 1–0 win over [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] in their final [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group C|Champions League group]] fixture, the result qualifying Liverpool to the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Round of 16|round of sixteen]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46511873 |title=Liverpool 1–0 Napoli: Salah scores as Reds reach Champions League knockout stage |date=11 December 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=14 December 2018}}</ref> On 19 January 2019, he scored his 50th Premier League goal with a brace in a 4–3 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], reaching the tally in 72 appearances. In doing so, he became the joint-fourth fastest player to achieve the milestone, alongside [[Fernando Torres]], and behind only [[Andy Cole]], [[Alan Shearer]] and [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11612182/the-stats-behind-mohamed-salahs-50-premier-league-goals|title=The stats behind Mohamed Salah's 50 Premier League goals|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 January 2019|accessdate=21 January 2019}}</ref>
In February 2019 [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] said they were investigating a video which allegedly showed fans [[Racism in association football|racially abusing Salah, including for being Muslim]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47144113|title=Mohamed Salah: West Ham investigate racist abuse of Liverpool striker|date=6 February 2019|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== Salah made 11 appearances for the [[Egypt national under-20 football team|Egypt U-20 team]] and 11 for the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egypt U-23 team]], representing Egypt in both [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/mensolympic/london2012/teams/team=1889741/index.html |title=Men's Olympic Football Tournament – Previous Tournaments |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> scoring a penalty against [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina]] in the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Round of 16|round of sixteen]] of the former tournament, with Egypt losing the match 1–2.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=255639/match=300145882/index.html |title=FIFA U-20 World Cup Colombia 2011 – Matches – Argentina-Egypt |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
Salah was selected for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's team squads#Egypt|youth squad]] to play at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/mensolympic/london2012/teams/team=1889741/index.html |title=Olympic Football Tournament London 2012 – Men {{!}} Egypt|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> scoring in all three of the team's group games. In their opening match on 26 July, he scored Egypt's second goal in a [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group C#Brazil vs Egypt|2–3]] defeat to [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2012/jul/26/brazil-egypt-football-london-2012 |title=Olympics 2012: football {{!}} Brazil hang on to the three points in the face of Egypt's brave comeback {{!}} Brazil 3–2 Egypt|newspaper=The Guardian|date=26 July 2012|author=Daniel Taylor|accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> he scored the equalizer in their [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group C#Egypt vs New Zealand|1–1]] draw against [[New Zealand national under-23 football team|New Zealand]] played on 29 July,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsWorldCup/2018/48948.aspx |title=Relive Egypt's 1–1 draw with New Zealand (London 2012) |newspaper=Al-Ahram |date=29 July 2012 |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> before scoring Egypt's opening goal in a [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group C#Egypt vs Belarus|3–1]] win over [[Belarus national under-23 football team|Belarus]] in their final [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group C|group stage]] game played on 1 August,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/egypt-vs-belarus/271398 |title=Olympic Games – Group C {{!}} Egypt 3–1 Belarus|publisher=Sky Sports|date=1 August 2012|accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> securing advancement into the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Knockout stage|knockout stage]] of the tournament, where Egypt were eliminated following a [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Knockout stage#Japan vs Egypt|0–3]] [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Knockout stage#Quarter-finals|quarter-final]] defeat to [[Japan national under-23 football team|Japan]] on 4 August.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/japan/london-2012-olympics/result/result-japan-3-0-egypt_38268.html |title=London 2012 Olympics {{!}} Result: Japan 3–0 Egypt|publisher=Sports Mole.co.uk|date=4 August 2012|author=Barney Corkhill|accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 3 September 2011, Salah made his debut for the [[Egypt national football team]] in the 2–1 away defeat by [[Sierra Leone national football team|Sierra Leone]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/89/africa/2011/09/03/2649689/sierra-leone-2-1-egypt-pharaohs-eliminated-from-afcon |title=Sierra Leone 2–1 Egypt: Pharaohs eliminated from Afcon qualification |website=Goal.com |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Egypt's [[Egypt national football team|first team]] in the [[2012 Africa Cup of Nations qualification#Egypt v Niger|3–0]] win against [[Niger national football team|Niger]] a month later, on 8 October, in [[2012 Africa Cup of Nations qualification|qualifying]] for the [[2012 Africa Cup of Nations]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/815/2013-africa-cup-of-nations/2011/10/08/2702589/egypt-3-0-niger-the-pharaohs-thrash-the-mena-who-qualify |title=Egypt 3–0 Niger: The Pharaohs thrash the Mena, who qualify nonetheless |website=Goal.com |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref>
On 10 June 2012, he scored a goal in the 93rd minute in stoppage time against [[Guinea national football team|Guinea]] to give Egypt an important 3–2 away victory in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CAF)|2014 World Cup qualifier]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/guinea-vs-egypt/260262 |title=WC Africa – Group 7 {{!}} Guinea 2–3 Egypt|publisher=Sky Sports|date=10 June 2012|accessdate=28 June 2018}}</ref> On 9 June 2013, Salah scored a hat-trick in a 4–2 away win against [[Zimbabwe national football team|Zimbabwe]] as Egypt won their fourth consecutive match in the World Cup qualifiers.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2013/06/09/sport/football/football-world-cup-egypt/ |title=Salah stars as Egypt stay on course for World Cup Finals |date=9 June 2013 |accessdate=6 August 2015 |publisher=CNN}}</ref> A week later in the following match, he scored the only goal away to [[Mozambique national football team|Mozambique]], putting Egypt into the final qualifying group.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/22926912 |title=Egypt through to final round of World Cup qualifying |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 June 2013 |accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref> On 10 September, Salah scored his sixth tournament goal in a 4–2 win over Guinea, securing Egypt a 100% record to finish their qualifying group and becoming the joint-top scorer among all African teams in the qualification stages.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/81302.aspx |title=Egypt maintain perfect World Cup qualifying run with 4–2 win |newspaper=Al-Ahram |date=10 September 2013 |author=Hatem Maher |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
[[File:Mo Salah 2018.png|left|thumb|230x230px|Salah with Egypt at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia]]
On 10 October 2014, Salah scored in a 2–0 win over [[Botswana national football team|Botswana]], also scoring in the return fixture on five days later on 15 October, in qualifying for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.worldfootball.com/m/478758/2014-10-10/afcon-qualification/botswana/egypt |title=Botswana vs Egypt 0 – 2 {{!}} AFCON Qualification {{!}} 2015 Morocco {{!}} Group Stage {{!}} World Football|website=www.worldfootball.com|accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsAFCON/2017/113193.aspx |title=Egypt complete double over Botswana with another 2–0 win |newspaper=Al-Ahram |date=15 October 2014 |author=Hatem Maher |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> On 19 November, Salah scored the opening goal in a 1–2 away defeat to [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]], as Egypt missed out on qualifying for the [[Africa Cup of Nations]] finals for a third consecutive time, with their latest successful qualification being in [[2010 Africa Cup of Nations|2010]], when they won the competition for a third straight time.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kingfut.com/2014/11/19/afcon-2015-tunisia-vs-egypt-live-commentary-2/ |title=AFCON 2015 – Tunisia vs Egypt Live Commentary |publisher=KingFut |date=19 November 2014 |author=Omar Ahmed Morsy |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/0/115871/Sports/0/RELIVE-Tunisia-v-Egypt--AFCON-qualifiers.aspx |title=RELIVE: Tunisia v Egypt (2015 AFCON qualifiers) |newspaper=Al-Ahram |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
Salah was a member of the Pharaohs' squad for the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]] held in [[Gabon]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.masralarabia.com/sports/%D8%B1%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%B6%D8%A9-%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%B1%D9%8A%D8%A9/1335657-%D9%85%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%AC%D8%A2%D8%AA-%D8%A8%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AC%D9%85%D9%84%D8%A9-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%85%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%AE%D8%A8 |title=Official Declaration of the preliminary list of the Egyptian team for the Nations of Africa (Translation) |language=ar |publisher=masralarabia.com |date=29 December 2016 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38511275 |title=Afcon 2017: Egypt's El Hadary could make Nations Cup history |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2017 |accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref> On 25 January, he scored in Egypt's 1–0 win over [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] to secure first place in [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations Group D|Group D]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.eurosport.com/football/african-cup-of-nations/2017/mohamed-salah-s-stunning-free-kick-for-egypt-snatches-win-and-top-spot-from-ghana_sto6033858/story.shtml |title=Mohamed Salah's stunning free-kick for Egypt snatches win and top spot from Ghana |publisher=Eurosport |date=25 January 2017}}</ref> He went all the way to the final with Egypt, scoring twice and assisting two times in 6 games, earning him a place in the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations#Awards|CAF Team of the Tournament]].<ref name=AFCONTOT>{{cite web |url=https://www.soccer24.co.zw/2017/02/06/17870 |title=AFCON 2017: CAF names team of the tournament |publisher=soccer24.co.zw |date=6 February 2017 |accessdate=19 July 2017}}</ref>
Salah was the top scorer for Egypt with five goals during the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CAF)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]], including both goals in the decisive 2–1 victory over [[Congo national football team|Congo]], one of which was a penalty in the last minute to make the Pharaohs reach their first World Cup finals since [[1990 FIFA World Cup|1990]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/08/world-cup-round-up-egypt-poland-qualify |title=Mo Salah's late penalty gives Egypt first World Cup qualification since 1990 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=8 October 2017}}</ref> Despite doubts over his fitness following his shoulder injury, Salah was included in Egypt's 29-man provisional squad for the 2018 FIFA World Cup and was included in their final 23-man squad on 4 June.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/302128-mohamed-salah-egypt-world-cup-squad |title=Salah confirmed in provisional Egypt World Cup squad |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kingfut.com/2018/06/04/egypt-final-23-squad-world-cup/ |title=Egypt announce final 23-man squad for 2018 World Cup |publisher=KingFut |date=4 June 2018 |author=Seif Soliman |accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref> He missed Egypt's opening match against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] on 15 June, which the Pharaohs lost 1–0, conceding in the 89th minute.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300353632/#match-info |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ {{!}} Egypt 0–1 Uruguay|publisher=FIFA|date=15 June 2018|accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref> On 19 June, Salah scored a penalty in Egypt's 3–1 defeat to hosts [[Russia national football team|Russia]] at the [[Krestovsky Stadium]], Saint Petersburg.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331495/#match-info |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ {{!}} Russia 3–1 Egypt|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref> In Egypt's final group game on 25 June, Salah scored his second goal of the World Cup with a chip over the goalkeeper in Egypt's 2–1 defeat to [[Saudi Arabia national football team|Saudi Arabia]] at [[Volgograd Arena]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439204 |title=Saudis beat Egypt despite Salah strike |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 June 2018 |author=Saj Chowdhury |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/25/saudi-arabia-egypt-world-cup-2018-group-a-match-report |title=Salem al-Dawsari snatches win for Saudi Arabia against Egypt |newspaper=The Guardian |date=25 June 2018 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref>
On 8 September, in a 6–0 win over [[Niger national football team|Niger]] in [[2019 Africa Cup of Nations qualification Group J|qualifying]] for the [[2019 Africa Cup of Nations]], Salah scored two goals, provided two assists and also missed two penalties. His first penalty, in the first minute of the game, was saved, while the second he converted the loose ball after it was initially saved.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45461928 |title=Mo Salah: Liverpool forward scores twice as Egypt beat Niger |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 September 2018 |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== ===Analysis=== [[File:Mohamed Salah Ghaly.jpg|thumbnail|160px|Salah is best known for his speed, dribbling ability and finishing]]
A quick, mobile, hard-working and tactical player, with good technique and an eye for goal, Salah is predominantly known for his speed, movement, clinical finishing, agility, [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] skills, first touch, and ball control, as well as his ability to use both his pace and flair on the ball in order to beat opponents, and create scoring opportunities for himself or his teammates.<ref name="Ken Early">{{cite news |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/sport/soccer/english-soccer/ken-early-mohamed-salah-is-not-a-truly-great-winger-1.3306153 |title=Ken Early: Mohamed Salah is not a truly great winger |newspaper=The Irish Times |date=27 November 2017 |author=Ken Early |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref><ref name=different2>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/mohamed-salah-liverpool-roma-champions-league-a8320741.html |title=Mohamed Salah's two different but equally brilliant Liverpool goals assert his place as world's third-best player |newspaper=The Independent |date=24 April 2018 |author=Mark Critchley |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2016/3/xavi-salah-s-speed-is-unbelievable |title=Xavi: Salah’s speed is unbelievable |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=29 March 2016 |accessdate=10 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.asroma.com/en/news/2016/6/as-roma-awards-2015-16-the-complete-list-of-winners |title=AS Roma Awards 2015–16: The Complete List of Winners |publisher=A.S. Roma |date=30 June 2016 |accessdate=10 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-leicester-mohamed-salah-goals-fires-to-victory-jamie-vardy-a8134936.html |title=Mohamed Salah double fires Liverpool to victory against Leicester but win soured by late injury |newspaper=The Independent |date=30 December 2017 |author=Timothy Abraham |accessdate=1 October 2018}}</ref> A versatile forward, he primarily plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]] on the right flank, a position which allows him to cut into the centre onto his stronger left foot, and either shoot on goal or play quick exchanges with other players and make runs in behind the defence towards goal; he can also play in the centre behind the main striker as either an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] or [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]].<ref name=treccani2>{{cite web |url=http://www.treccani.it/enciclopedia/mohamed-salah-ghaly/ |title=Salah Ghaly, Mohamed |publisher=Treccani: Enciclopedie Online |language=it |accessdate=10 January 2017}}</ref>
On his increased threat in front of goal since joining [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Salah credits Liverpool manager [[Jürgen Klopp]]’s request for him to occupy more advanced [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|central positions]], often operating as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|main striker]], with the [[Forward (association football)|forward]] telling [[ESPN]], "I play closer to the goal than any club before."<ref name="Ken Early"/><ref name=different2/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://global.espn.com/football/liverpool/story/3422896/liverpools-mohamed-salah-the-premier-league-is-perfect-for-me |title=Liverpool's Mohamed Salah: Premier League is perfect for me |publisher=ESPN |date=28 June 2018 |author=Glenn Price}}</ref> Salah initially started his career at the [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]] position, however, following a 4–0 win over the youth team of Egyptian club [[ENPPI SC|ENPPI]], Salah was in tears for not scoring after missing several clear chances; this made his coach realize his passion for scoring goals, forcing him to move him to a forward position.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/how-liverpool-star-mohamed-salah-14044753 |title=How Mo Salah went from teary left-back to goalscoring wing wizard |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Reach |date=15 December 2017 |author=Paul Gorst |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2747043-the-making-of-liverpools-egyptian-superstar-mo-salah |title=The Making of Liverpool's Egyptian Superstar Mo Salah |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=13 December 2017 |author=Dean Jones |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
===Reception=== While playing El Mokawloon, American soccer coach [[Bob Bradley]] saw Salah play and noted his prodigious speed, explosiveness, and intelligence on the pitch, already evident at his young age.<ref name=AlSayyad>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/sporting-scene/liverpool-fcs-mohamed-salah-an-arab-muslim-sports-star-subtly-confronting-racism-and-islamophobia |title=Liverpool F.C.'s Mohamed Salah, an Arab Muslim Sports Star Subtly Confronting Racism and Islamophobia |website=The New Yorker |date=25 May 2018 |author=Yasmine Al-Sayyad |accessdate=25 May 2018 |quote=Being religious yet apolitical is partly what has made Salah appealing to the predominantly white fan base of England's Premier League. "I think part of Salah's charm is that he's not an outwardly political figure addressing Islamophobia in England," Khaled Beydoun, a law scholar and the author of "American Islamophobia," told me. "He is able to effectively erode negative views of Muslims and challenge Islamophobia" just by being himself.}}</ref> Upon signing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[José Mourinho]] said of Salah: "He's young, he's fast, he's creative, he's enthusiastic. When we analysed him he looks the kind of humble personality on the pitch, ready to work for the team."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/barclays-premier-league/story/1691756/jose-mourinho-mohamed-salah-deal-influenced-by-mata-move |title=Salah deal 'influenced by Mata move' |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=24 January 2014}}</ref> Mourinho added that Salah has "similar qualities" with "talented players" that he had worked with, such as [[Gareth Bale]] and [[Arjen Robben]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/10594886/Jose-Mourinho-confirms-Chelsea-are-closing-in-on-12m-deal-for-Basle-attacker-Mohamed-Salah.html |title=Jose Mourinho confirms Chelsea are closing in on £12m deal for Basle attacker Mohamed Salah |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=24 January 2014 |author=Henry Winter |accessdate=24 January 2014}}</ref> His technical skills, pace, left foot, goalscoring, position and direct playing style led him to be nicknamed the "Egyptian [[Lionel Messi|Messi]]", in the Italian media.<ref name="Giulia Zonca">{{cite news |url=http://www.lastampa.it/2015/03/06/sport/calcio/salah-oltre-i-gol-le-cose-da-sapere-sul-prodigio-del-momento-iYp0YqWf7WoKN6mLR7G36J/pagina.html |title=Salah, beyond goals. The 10 things to know about the prodigy of the moment (Translation) |language=it |newspaper=La Stampa |date=6 March 2015 |author=Giulia Zonca |accessdate=10 January 2017}}</ref><ref name="Matteo Politanò">{{cite web |url=https://www.panorama.it/sport/calcio/tutti-pazzi-per-salah-messi-degitto/ |title=All crazy about Salah, the Messi of Egypt (Translation) |language=it |author=Matteo Politanò |date=5 March 2015 |publisher=Panorama.it |accessdate=10 January 2017}}</ref> Brazilian World Cup winner [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] – whom Salah idolized while growing up – stated, "Salah is an incredible player with a tremendous quality. He looks like Messi."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ronaldo-says-loves-liverpools-mohamed-14704183 |title=Ronaldo loves Liverpool's Mohamed Salah and his 'Lionel Messi style' |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Reach |accessdate=28 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mohamed-salah-reveals-two-football-14613345 |title=Mohamed Salah reveals his two football idols as the Liverpool star dismisses Messi and Ronaldo comparisons |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Reach |accessdate=6 September 2018}}</ref> Salah has also received praise for having [[Goal celebration#Notable non-celebrations|never celebrated]] scoring a goal against any of his former clubs.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/liverpool-star-mo-salah-refuses-to-celebrate-two-stunning-goals-vs-former-club-as-roma-a3822656.html |title=A touch of class: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah refuses to celebrate two stunning goals vs his former club AS Roma |newspaper=London Evening Standard |accessdate=8 October 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Mohamed Salah married Maggi in 2013. Their daughter, Makka, born in 2014<ref>{{cite web |url=https://tribuna.com/liverpoolfc/en/news/2229916/ |title=Mohamed Salah is married to Maggi Salah and the couple have a little daughter named Makka |publisher=Tribuna.com |date=10 July 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref> is named in honor of the Islamic holy city of [[Mecca]].<ref name=AlSayyad/> Salah is [[Muslim]] and often celebrates goals by performing the [[sujud]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archiveislam.com/chelseas-new-muslim-player-mohamed-salah-celebrates-by-prostrating.html |title=Chelsea's New Muslim Player Mohamed Salah Celebrates By Prostrating |author=Mehedi Islam |accessdate=4 November 2017}}</ref>
==Outside football== ===Media=== [[File:Salah in press conference - CAF Awards 2017.jpg|thumb|Salah during a press conference at the 2017 [[CAF Awards]].]]
Salah features in [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'' video game series]]: on ''[[FIFA 18]]'' he had a rating of 87 and a potential of 90 following his displays for Liverpool.<ref>[https://www.fifaindex.com/player/209331/mohamed-salah/ “Mohamed Salah index”] FIFA Index.com. Retrieved 25 June 2018</ref> In a 2018 poll by FIFPLAY, a website run and made for the game's fans, Salah ranked first (ahead of Lionel Messi) on who should be the global cover star for ''[[FIFA 19]]'', obtaining 77 percent of the total number of votes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.egyptindependent.com/will-mo-salah-be-on-the-fifa-2019-cover/ |title=Will Mo Salah be on the FIFA 19 cover? |date=25 June 2018 |publisher=Egypt Independent}}</ref>
===Sponsors=== Salah has a sponsorship deal with sportswear and equipment supplier [[Adidas]]: he wears Adidas X18 football boots.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/heres-boots-mohamed-salah-wear-14777658 |title=Here's where to get the Adidas X18 boots Mohamed Salah will wear for Egypt at the World Cup |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Reach |date=25 June 2018}}</ref> He appeared in an Adidas 2018 World Cup commercial along with other players in the Adidas stable, including [[David Beckham]], [[Lionel Messi]] and [[Paul Pogba]], and singer [[Pharrell Williams]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/adidas-release-star-studded-world-cup-advert-featuring-messi-beckham-mourinho-pharrell-and |title=Adidas release star-studded World Cup advert featuring Messi, Beckham, Mourinho, Pharrell and more |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future Publishing |date=25 June 2018}}</ref> In March 2018, Salah appeared in advertisement for [[Vodafone Egypt]], being filmed visiting several [[Merseyside]] landmarks, with the video originally being released in [[Arabic]] but was also translated to English.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/mo-salah-vodafone-advert-video-14415918 |title=Mo Salah Egyptian Vodafone advert is out – see the Liverpool star visiting Merseyside landmarks |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Reach |date=15 March 2018 |author=Emilia Bona |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref>
===Charity=== Salah is active in regeneration projects in Nagrig, his hometown where 65% of people live in poverty, donating money to help build a school and hospital.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/Mohamed-Salah-Liverpool-Egypt-village |title='Our son': Mohamed Salah splashes cash to give home village a cleaner future |publisher=Middle East Eye |date=26 April 2018 |author=Osha Mahmoud |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2018/05/nagrig-has-mixed-feelings-about-mo-saleh-native-son.html |title=Egyptian soccer star's village has mixed feelings about native son |author=Hossam Rabie |date=6 June 2018 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=Al-Monitor}}</ref> During his time in Egypt, Salah's family was once robbed, however, the thief was caught and arrested by police, with Salah's father preparing to press charges against him, but Salah convinced him to drop the case. Afterwards, Salah helped the thief financially, giving him some money and trying to find him a job.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportbible.com/football/news-take-a-bow-a-story-about-mohamed-salah-and-a-thief-who-stole-from-his-family-20171222 |title=A Story About Mohamed Salah And A Thief Who Stole From His Family Goes Viral |date=22 December 2017 |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> In February 2018, following a match against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]], Salah donated a replica shirt to young supporter Mohamed Abdel Karim, who was previously pictured wearing a jumper reading Salah's name and shirt number.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mohamed-salahs-stunning-liverpool-gesture-14231833 |title=Salah's stunning gesture to supporter is reminiscent of Messi |author=Kristian Walsh |date=1 February 2018 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |accessdate=8 September 2018 |publisher=Reach}}</ref> Moreover, Mohamed Salah has helped more than 450 families by giving them monthly allowances and he also helped the government by giving approximately $300,000 when the country was in a bad situation.<ref>{{cite news |last=Marwan |first=Ahmed |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46379716 |title=Mohamed Salah, the Liverpool superstar giving away thousands to help Egyptians |date=30 November 2018}}</ref>
===Controversy=== At the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], in which Egypt were based in [[Chechnya]], Salah agreed to posing with [[Ramzan Kadyrov]], after the Chechen leader made a surprise visit to the team's hotel and requested a photo shoot with him at the stadium during their team training.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5831753/Mohamed-Salah-unknowingly-centre-controversy-Chechen-leader-Ramzan-Kadyrov.html |title=Egypt's Mohamed Salah finds himself at the centre of controversy after Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov requests public photo with the superstar |date=11 June 2018 |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=December 2018}}</ref> Kadyrov later gave him honorary citizenship of the Chechen Republic in a public dinner made for the whole Egypt national team and officials.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/06/23/mohamed-salah-given-honorary-citizenship-chechnya-strongman/ |title=Mohamed Salah given honorary citizenship of Chechnya by strongman ruler accused of human rights abuses |author=Alec Luhn |date=23 June 2018 |accessdate=9 September 2018 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |issn=0307-1235}}</ref> Several western news outlets and NGOs criticised Salah and the [[Egyptian Football Association|EFA]] for their interactions with Kadyrov, citing the president's alleged human rights abuses and that the player is used for 'political propaganda' by the dictator during Egypt's national team training camp in Chechnya.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12098/11404005/mohamed-salah-used-for-political-propaganda-by-ramzan-kadyrov-say-gay-rights-and-equality-campaigners |title=Mohamed Salah used for 'political propaganda' by Ramzan Kadyrov, say gay rights and equality campaigners |date=13 June 2018 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/35849/11414957/mohamed-salah-honoured-by-chechnya-leader-ramzan-kadyrov |title=Mohamed Salah honoured by Chechnya leader Ramzan Kadyrov |date=24 June 2018 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
In August 2018, Liverpool referred Salah to Merseyside police after footage was posted online which showed him allegedly using a phone while driving in traffic.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-45175226 |title=Video apparently shows Mo Salah using a phone while driving |date=13 August 2018 |accessdate=13 August 2018 |publisher=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11472119/liverpool-refer-mohamed-salah-to-police-after-allegedly-using-phone-while-driving |title=Liverpool refer Mohamed Salah to police after allegedly using phone while driving |date=14 August 2018 |accessdate=13 August 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/uk/mo-salah-referred-to-police-after-being-filmed-using-mobile-phone-while-driving-a3910621.html |title=Police probe as Mo Salah 'is filmed using mobile phone while driving' |newspaper=London Evening Standard |date=13 August 2018 |author=Sean Morrison |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref> Salah's indiscretion was brought to light after autograph hunter Rob Wylie posted a video online apparently showing the Egyptian ignoring requests for autographs. Wylie, whose conduct had previously resulted in Liverpool instituting a policy which banned players giving autographs from their vehicles, received widespread criticism from the club's supporters and had to temporarily shut down his website.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/mo-salah-mobile-phone-autograph-15029494 |title=Mo Salah mobile phone autograph hunter speaks out after online accusations |author=Jonathan Humphries |date=14 August 2018 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |accessdate=27 August 2018 |publisher=Reach}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.iol.co.za/sport/soccer/premier-league/man-who-took-mohamed-salah-phone-video-denies-sending-it-to-police-16567536 |title=Man who took Mohamed Salah ‘phone video’ denies sending it to police |author=Ashfak Mohamed |date=14 August 2018 |website=Independent Online |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref>
Salah's relationship with the [[Egyptian Football Association]] (EFA) was reported to have soured during the World Cup, after his image was used without his permission to promote the national team's sponsor, [[Telecom Egypt|WE]], the mobile service of [[Telecom Egypt]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45322205 |title=Mohamed Salah accuses Egyptian FA of ignoring complaints over image rights |author=Tarek Talaat |date=27 August 2018 |accessdate=27 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> At the time of the incident, Salah was sponsored by WE's telecommunications rivals, [[Vodafone]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-forward-mohamed-salah-embroiled-15077448 |title=Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah embroiled in fresh row with Egyptian FA over image rights |author=Ian Doyle |date=27 August 2018 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |accessdate=27 August 2018 |publisher=Reach}}</ref>
==In popular culture== [[File:Salah Graffiti in Cairo.jpg|thumb|Graffiti of Salah in Cairo]]
Liverpool fans created a chant to the tune of [[Dodgy]]'s "[[Good Enough (Dodgy song)|Good Enough]]", saying that if Salah continued to score goals, they would convert to Islam – "If he's good enough for you, he's good enough for me, if he scores another few, then I'll be Muslim too."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-43081318/mohamed-salah-inspires-i-ll-be-muslim-too-chant |title=Mohamed Salah inspires "I'll be Muslim too" chant |publisher=BBC News |date=16 February 2018}}</ref> Salah gave his approval to the chant, and it has been cited as an example of inclusivity.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43208945 |title=Mohamed Salah: Is Liverpool striker's success improving engagement with Muslim fans? |last1=Din |first1=Tusdiq |date=1 March 2018 |accessdate=14 March 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Salah is devout to a degree that many other well-known Muslims sports figures are not, and his charm and apolitical persona have made him a popular figure in the UK.<ref name=AlSayyad/> During his [[goal celebration]], Salah lays in the prostrate position to thank god in [[sujud]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/champions-league-final-liverpool-star-mohamed-salah-s-unapologetic-muslim-ncna877736 |title=Champions League final: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah's unapologetic Muslim faith sends extraordinary message |publisher=NBC News |date=26 May 2018 |author=Jalal Baig |accessdate=9 October 2018}}</ref> It appears in ''[[FIFA 19]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://talksport.com/football/418292/fifa-19-new-celebrations-cristiano-ronaldo-paul-pogba-neymar |title=UPDATED FIFA 19 new celebrations and tutorial, ft Cristiano Ronaldo, Paul Pogba and Neymar |publisher=talkSPORT |accessdate=11 October 2018}}</ref>
Salah is nicknamed "The [[Pharaoh]]" by the press and his fans.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/sport/football/pharaoh-salah-aims-to-fire-up-reds-too |title=Pharaoh Salah aims to fire up Reds too |newspaper=The Straits Times |publisher=Singapore Press Holdings |date=17 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.elbalad.news/2339632 |title=Mohamed Salah, the pharaoh who conquered Europe |work=el-balad.com |publisher=Sada El Balad |date=23 June 2017 |author=Amr Mamdouh}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kingfut.com/2014/01/26/chelsea-pharaoh-mohamed-salah/ |title=In Pictures: The Rise of Chelsea’s Pharaoh – Mohamed Salah |publisher=KingFut |date=26 January 2014 |author=Omar Niyazi}}</ref> Salah was given the nickname "Egyptian King" by Liverpool supporters,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/egyptian-king-salah-robbed-by-controversial-penalties-in/13fb5kpiptdlh1tv3ouk8mtizm |title=Egyptian King Salah robbed by controversial penalties in Liverpool-Spurs thriller |website=Goal.com |date=4 February 2018 |author=Melissa Reddy}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-must-everything-keep-egyptian-14255690 |title=Liverpool must do everything to keep 'Egyptian King' Mohamed Salah on his throne |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=6 February 2018 |author=James Pearce}}</ref> arising from a chant set to the tune of "[[Sit Down (song)|Sit Down]]" by English band [[James (band)|James]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fans-brilliant-new-mohamed-14161510 |title=Liverpool fans have brilliant new Mohamed Salah song |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=6 February 2018 |author=Kristian Walsh}}</ref>
Following his goal that led Egypt to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|World Cup finals]] for the first time since [[1990 FIFA World Cup|1990]], a school in Egypt was named after him.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/egyptian-school-named-after-liverpool-star-salah-follow-world-cup-heroics-4202820 |title=Egyptian school named after Liverpool star Salah following World Cup heroics |publisher=Tribal Football.com |date=29 June 2018 |author=Eshlin Vedan}}</ref> Following Egypt's exit from the World Cup, Salah stayed in his home country for his pre-season holiday. In late June, his address was accidentally leaked on Facebook. After this, crowds of fans showed up at Salah's house, with Salah greeting the fans and signing autographs for some, although according to reports in Spain, police did arrive to cordon off his house.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/salah-comes-out-to-meet-fans-outside-of-home-after-address/1bmka2qglx9vk1ebkp65qrm7of |title=Mohamed Salah news: Liverpool star comes out to meet Egypt fans after huge crowd appears outside of home |website=Goal.com |date=29 June 2018 |accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref>
During Liverpool's [[2018–19 Liverpool F.C. season#Pre-season|pre-season tour in the U.S.]] an American artist named Brandan Odums created a mural in the [[Times Square]] area displaying Salah in the Egypt kit, with the player later posting an image on social media posing next to it.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.egyptindependent.com/mohamed-salahs-mural-overlooks-times-square/ |title=NY Times Square displays Mohamed Salah's huge mural |newspaper=Egypt Independent |date=10 June 2018 |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://twitter.com/MoSalah/status/1023581098792632320 |title=Mohamed Salah on Twitter |publisher=Twitter |accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> In Egypt, several murals have also been created displaying Salah's likeness, including one in the capital of Cairo.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.smh.com.au/sport/soccer/how-salah-became-the-main-symbol-of-hope-for-egypt-s-rising-generation-20180423-p4zb4f.html |title=How Salah became the main symbol of hope for Egypt's rising generation |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |date=23 April 2018 |author1=Magdy Samaan |author2=Chris Bascombe |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/in-depth/features/egypt-has-now-new-pyramid-mohamed-salah-1103981319 |title=Egypt's 'fourth pyramid' Mohamed Salah: 'He is one of us' |publisher=Middle East Eye |date=10 January 2018 |author=Mohamed Mahmoud |accessdate=9 September 2018}}</ref>
