{{About|the footballer|the politician|Alberto Moreno (politician)}} {{Spanish name|Moreno|Pérez}} {{EngvarB|date=October 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Alberto Moreno | image = Spartak Moscow- Liverpool (cropped).jpg | image_size = 175 | caption = Moreno with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2017 | fullname = Alberto Moreno Pérez<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|7|5|df=y}}<ref name=SW>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/alberto-moreno-perez/192742/ |title=Alberto Moreno |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=19 May 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Seville]], Spain | height = 1.71 m<ref name=SW/> | position = [[Left back]] | currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 2004–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] | years1 = 2011–2013 | clubs1 = [[Sevilla Atlético]] | caps1 = 49 | goals1 = 7 | years2 = 2012–2014 | clubs2 = [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] | caps2 = 45 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2014– | clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps3 = 90 | goals3 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013– | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 06:55, 6 December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:06, 20 March 2018 (UTC) }} '''Alberto Moreno Pérez''' ({{IPA-es|alˈβeɾto moˈɾeno ˈpeɾeθ}}; born 5 July 1992) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
An academy graduate of local side [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]], he made his senior debut for the club's reserve side in 2011 before going on to feature in 62 official games for the first team. During his time with Sevilla, he was part of the squad which won the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] title in 2014. The following season, he joined [[Premier League]] club Liverpool for a reported fee of £12 million where he has since made over 100 appearances and collected runners-up medals in the [[EFL Cup]], Europa League and [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].
Moreno was part of the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21 team]] that won the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]] and made his [[Spain national football team|senior]] debut the same year.
==Club career== [[File:Alberto Moreno (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|351x351px|Moreno with Sevilla in 2013.]]
=== Sevilla === Moreno was born in the [[Andalusia|Andalusian]] capital of [[Seville]] and at the age of 13 joined his local side, [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno: Sevilla is my home but I want to win|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/spanish-football/2016/05/17/573afbdd22601de0048b45b0.html|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=Marca|date=17 May 2016}}</ref><ref name=ff2>{{cite news|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/alberto-moreno-prem-bound-la-liga-left-back-who-bettered-gareth-bale|title=Alberto Moreno: The Prem-bound La Liga left-back who bettered Gareth Bale|publisher=Four Four Two|last=Wilkes|first=Paul|date=13 April 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> There he progressed through the club's youth academy and made his senior debut for the reserve side, [[Sevilla Atlético]], on 12 June 2011 in a 3–1 home win over [[CD Guadalajara (Spain)|Guadalajara]] in the [[Segunda División B]] play-offs. The club ultimately lost 5–4 on aggregate, however.<ref>{{cite news|title=El Sevilla Atlético roza la remontada|trans-title=Sevilla Atlético grind a comeback|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/06/12/futbol/mas_futbol/1307914535.html|accessdate=12 April 2016|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|date=12 June 2011|language=Spanish}}</ref> His [[2011–12 Segunda División B|first full season]] followed thereafter during which he scored four goals in 30 games, including his first senior goal directly from a [[corner kick]] in added time against [[Cádiz CF|Cádiz]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Victoria del Sevilla Atlético sobre el Cádiz con gol olímpico de Alberto|trans-title=Victory for Sevilla Atlético over Cádiz with an Olympic goal by Alberto|url=http://sevilla.eldesmarque.com/sevilla-futbol-club/41927-victoria-del-sevilla-atletico-sobre-el-cadiz-con-gol-olimpico-de-alberto|accessdate=12 April 2016|publisher=El Desmarque|date=13 November 2011|language=Spanish}}</ref> Whilst playing for the reserve side, Moreno operated under the tutelage of Ramón Tejada who rotated him between attacking and defensive positions down the left-flank of the field.<ref name=ff2/> The positional rotation was later credited for his tactical awareness which contributed to him making his first team, and [[La Liga]] debut.<ref name=ff2/> This took place on 8 April 2012 when he came on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Manu del Moral]] in the last minutes of a 1–0 away loss against [[Athletic Bilbao]].<ref name=ff2/><ref>[http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/323747/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 "Llorente leads Leones to victory"]. ESPN FC. 8 April 2012.\{{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130409053057/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/323747/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 |date=9 April 2013 }}</ref>
In February 2013, Moreno was permanently promoted to the first team and he scored his first professional goal on 20 October, netting the second in a 2–2 draw at [[Real Valladolid]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ligabbva.com/3208_sevilla/1977189_alberto-moreno-reconoce-que-vive-en-una-pompa-de-jabon-en-el-primer-equipo.html|title=Alberto Moreno reconoce que vive "en una pompa de jabón" en el primer equipo |trans-title=Alberto Moreno acknowledges living in "a bubble" in first team|publisher=La Liga|language=Spanish|date=20 March 2013|accessdate=23 April 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/373135/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Valladolid snatch unlikely draw |publisher=ESPN FC |date=20 October 2013 |accessdate=25 November 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131223215037/http://espnfc.com/en/report/373135/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=23 December 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref> He ultimately made 17 appearances during a campaign blemished only by a straight red card he received following a confrontation with [[Gabi (footballer)|Gabi]] inn a league match against [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Atlético Madrid 1–1 Sevilla|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25717734|accessdate=12 April 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 January 2014}}</ref><ref name=ss>{{cite news|url= https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/9330407/transfer-news-liverpool-make-offer-for-sevilla-left-back-alberto-moreno|title=Transfer news: Liverpool linked with Sevilla left-back Alberto Moreno|publisher=Sky Sports|date=30 May 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> He enjoyed a breakthrough season in the [[2013–14 La Liga|2013–14 campaign]] where he made 44 appearances in total for the club, including 14 in Sevilla's [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|victorious run]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref name=ss/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28822500|title=Alberto Moreno completes £12m Liverpool move from Sevilla|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Smith|first=Ben|date=16 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> His performances throughout the season also contributed towards Sevilla ending the fifth in the league and earned him a spot in [[Spain national football team|Spain]]'s provisional squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref name=ss/>
On 12 August 2014, and on the eve of Sevilla's [[2014 UEFA Super Cup]] match against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], Moreno was withdrawn from the club's match-day squad after the club agreed a £12 million deal with [[Premier League]] side [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for his signature.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno: Liverpool agree £12m fee with Sevilla for defender|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28765444|publisher=BBC|date=12 August 2014|accessdate=13 August 2014}}</ref> Following the match, Moreno was in tears and had to be consoled as he was given a send off by the club's fans.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/liverpool-bound-alberto-moreno-bids-emotional-4042968|title=Liverpool-bound Alberto Moreno bids emotional farewell to Sevilla team-mates after Super Cup defeat|publisher=Daily Mirror|last=Prendenerville|first=Liam|date=13 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref> He later explained that he was emotional to be leaving Sevilla as the club was the "club of his life" but that he was equally motivated to succeed at Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/alberto-moreno-to-liverpool-defender-admits-it-has-been-emotional-leaving-seville-but-is-super-9667012.html|title= Alberto Moreno to Liverpool: Defender admits it has been emotional leaving Seville but is 'super-motivated' to succeed at Anfield|publisher=The Independent|last=Orr|first=James|date=13 August 2014|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 16 August 2014, Moreno officially completed his move to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and he made his debut for the club 10 days later in a 3–1 league loss to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Alberto Moreno completes £12m Liverpool move from Sevilla|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28822500|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=16 August 2014|date=16 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Winter|first=Henry|title=Manchester City 3 Liverpool 1: Stevan Jovetic and Sergio Agüero on target as Premier League champions secure win|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11055354/Manchester-City-3-Liverpool-1-Stevan-Jovetic-and-Sergio-Aguero-on-target-as-Premier-League-champions-secure-win.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|accessdate=25 August 2014|date=25 August 2014}}</ref> He then scored his first goal on 31 August, netting the third goal in 3–0 away win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] after dispossessing [[Andros Townsend]] and sprinting 40 yards to score.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28917060 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 0-3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://ftw.usatoday.com/2014/08/liverpool-tottenham-alberto-moreno-goal |title=Alberto Moreno’s first goal for Liverpool was spectacular |newspaper=USA Today |location=Tysons Corner |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref> He scored again in December, against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], but ultimately endured an inconsistent debut season at [[Anfield]], with his attacking output not matched by his defensive performances.<ref>{{cite news |last=Bascombe |first=Chris |title=Liverpool 4 Swansea City 1: Adam Lallana shows his class as Liverpool cruise to victory |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11316920/Liverpool-4-Swansea-City-1-Adam-Lallana-shows-his-class-as-Liverpool-cruise-to-victory.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=30 December 2014 |date=29 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2015/06/alberto-moreno-201415-season-review-wayward-first-season-spanish-left-back/|title=Alberto Moreno 2014/15 Season Review: A difficult first season for the Spanish left-back|publisher=This is Anfield|last=Lusby|first=Jack|date=4 June 2015|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
Moreno spent the first four games of the [[2015–16 Liverpool F.C. season|next season]] as a substitute as new teammate [[Joe Gomez (footballer)|Joe Gomez]] started in his position. However, on 20 September 2015, he made his first league start of the season, providing the assist for [[Danny Ings]]' first Liverpool goal in a 1–1 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Jennings|first=Patrick|title=Liverpool 1 - 1 Norwich City|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34236959|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 September 2015|date=20 September 2015}}</ref> and was praised for his man of the match performance.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Usher|first1=David|title=Simon Mignolet's errors undoes Danny Ings' impact for Liverpool|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/liverpool/364/blog/post/2622929/simon-mignolets-errors-undoes-danny-ings-liverpool-impact|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=21 September 2015|date=20 September 2015}}</ref> His performance in the [[2016 UEFA Europa League Final]], where Liverpool lost 1–3 to his former club Sevilla, was heavily criticised by pundits and journalists for positioning and defensive errors.<ref>{{cite news|last=Prentice|first=David|title=Moreno slammed by McManaman and Owen for second-half display|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alberto-moreno-europa-league-final-11354159l|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|location=Liverpool|accessdate=19 May 2016|date=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Mariner|first1=James|title=Liverpool 1 Sevilla 3: Jamie Carragher deletes Twitter message slagging off Alberto Moreno|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/carragher-tweets-message-slagging-off-moreno-before-deleting-it-a7037036.html|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=The Independent|date=19 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Doyle|first=Ian|title=Liverpool 1-3 Sevilla player ratings: 4-4-2...not a formation but the three worst performances|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-1-3-sevilla-player-11354169|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=19 May 2016|date=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Was Alberto Moreno's Europa League horror show the biggest individual nightmare in a final?|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/19/was-alberto-morenos-horror-show-for-liverpool-against-sevilla-th/alberto-moreno/|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=19 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Europa League final: What next for Jurgen Klopp and Liverpool?|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36326487|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 May 2016}}</ref> [[File:Spartak Moscow- Liverpool.jpg|thumb|Moreno (bottom-left) lining-up for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]'s [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] match against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in 2017.]] On 14 August 2016, Moreno started in the [[2016–17 Liverpool F.C. season|first game]] of the season, a 4–3 win at Arsenal, where he conceded a penalty and was criticised heavily for his performance, prompting a defence from his manager [[Jürgen Klopp]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-news-jurgen-klopp-defends-alberto-moreno-after-left-back-is-criticised-for-arsenal-a7197401.html|title=Jurgen Klopp defends Alberto Moreno after left-back is widely criticised for Arsenal performance|date=18 August 2016|publisher=}}</ref> Despite his manager's intervention, he was dropped and used only as a late substitute for the next game, an 0–2 loss at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/burnley-v-liverpool-team-news-11776769|title=Moreno dropped by Jurgen Klopp|last=Pearce|first=James|date=2016-08-20|newspaper=Liverpool Echo |access-date=2017-04-09}}</ref> He made 18 appearances over the season, just eight as a starter, as [[James Milner]] was preferred in the left-back slot.<ref name=Napoli>{{cite news|last1=Price|first1=Glenn|title=Liverpool reject €12.5m Napoli bid for Alberto Moreno - source|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/soccer-transfers/story/3146998/liverpool-reject-napoli-bid-for-alberto-moreno-source|accessdate=22 June 2017|publisher=ESPN FC|date=22 June 2017}}</ref>
In April 2017, [[Serie A]] teams [[A.C. Milan|AC Milan]] and [[Inter Milan]] spoke to Liverpool about a transfer for Moreno, and in June the Reds rejected a €12.5 million bid for him from another Italian club, [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]].<ref name=Napoli/>
Moreno played more frequently at the start of the 2017–18 season,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lowe|first1=Sid|title=Alberto Moreno: ‘I used to think attack, attack, attack – but I have changed’|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/16/alberto-moreno-interview-attack-changed-liverpool|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Guardian|date=16 November 2017}}</ref> but was criticised in November in a Champions League group game against Sevilla, in which Liverpool led 3–0 at half time but drew 3–3, and was defended by Klopp.<ref>{{cite news|last1=de Menezes|first1=Jack|title=Roy Keane tears into Alberto Moreno and says performance against Sevilla should be the final straw for Liverpool|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/liverpool-news-roy-keane-alberto-moreno-sevilla-performance-not-good-enough-vs-chelsea-a8071211.html|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Independent|date=23 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Jonathan|title=Liverpool’s defensive problems do not begin and end with Alberto Moreno|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/nov/23/liverpool-alberto-moreno-defensive-problems-holding-midfielder|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=The Guardian|date=23 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Pearce|first1=James|title=Jurgen Klopp's message to underfire Liverpool left-back Alberto Moreno|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/jurgen-klopps-message-underfire-liverpool-13951028|accessdate=28 November 2017|newspaper=Liverpool Echo|date=24 November 2017}}</ref> He ultimately lost his position to new signing [[Andrew Robertson]] for the rest of the season.
==International career== ===Youth=== Moreno represented the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spanish under-21s]] at the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]], being first-choice as he helped them [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship Final|retain their European title]]. Following the competition's completion he was announced in UEFA's official [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the Tournament|team of the tournament]].<ref name=2013U21>{{cite news |title=Thiago leads all-star squad dominated by Spain |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=1966169.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=21 June 2013 }}</ref>
===Senior=== Moreno was called up to the [[Spain national football team|senior team]] on 4 October 2013 for the last [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualifier]] against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2013/10/04/seleccion/1380881591_324137.html|title=Vicente del Bosque recluta a cuatro del Atlético de Madrid|trans-title=Vicente del Bosque calls four from Atlético de Madrid|newspaper=Diario AS|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=4 October 2013|accessdate=14 October 2013}}</ref> and he made his debut on 15 October, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–0 win in [[Albacete]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008421/postmatch/report/index.html#spain+clinch+finals+spot|title=Spain top Group I to clinch finals place|publisher=UEFA|date=15 October 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref>
Moreno was included in [[Vicente del Bosque|Vicente del Bosque's]] 30-man provisional list for the tournament in Brazil, but was one of seven players cut from the final squad.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27647635|title=World Cup 2014: Spain drop Alvaro Negredo and Jesus Navas|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 May 2014|accessdate=31 May 2014}}</ref>
Over three years since his last cap, Moreno was recalled by [[Julen Lopetegui]] for friendlies against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] and [[Russia national football team|Russia]] in November 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Marrow|first1=Alex|title=Alberto Moreno earns Spain recall after Liverpool resurgence|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11111806/alberto-moreno-earns-spain-recall-after-liverpool-resurgence|accessdate=28 November 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=3 November 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Moreno has many tattoos. In April 2016, he had his leg decorated with an image of a gun-toting [[Common chimpanzee|chimpanzee]] dressed in a suit and wearing headphones; [[ESPN FC]]'s verdict was "Please don't ask, because we haven't got the slightest clue."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wright|first1=Chris|title=Liverpool's Alberto Moreno unveils perplexing new monkey tattoo|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/2849021/liverpools-alberto-moreno-unveils-perplexing-monkey-tattoo|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=12 April 2016}}</ref> The back of his leg is decorated with the coordinates of his hometown's [[Plaza de España (Seville)|Plaza de España]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alberto Moreno's Sevilla tattoo|url=http://www.express.co.uk/pictures/sport/6201/Alberto-Moreno-Liverpool-Sevilla-tattoo-sportgalleries/Alberto-Moreno-135465|accessdate=19 May 2016|publisher=Daily Express|date=18 May 2016}}</ref> Moreno has two children with his partner Lilia Granadilla.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alberto-morenos-performance-against-southampton-13921699|title=Why Alberto Moreno's performance against Southampton deserves extra credit|publisher=Liverpool Echo|last=Kelly|first=Andy|date=18 November 2017|accessdate=18 November 2017}}</ref>

Lallana began his youth career with [[AFC Bournemouth]] before transferring to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2000, where he developed in their academy and became a professional in 2006. After a brief loan back to Bournemouth he broke into Southampton's first team as they earned two promotions from [[EFL League One|League One]] to the Premier League, becoming captain in 2012. After two seasons in the top flight and an international breakthrough, he joined Liverpool for a reported £25 million in July 2014.
Since his senior international debut in 2013, Lallana has made over 30 appearances for England and represented them at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Early life== Lallana was born in [[St Albans]] in Hertfordshire<ref name=Hugman1011/> but moved to the [[Iford, Dorset|Iford]] area of [[Bournemouth]] when he was five years old. He attended [[Corpus Christi Church, Boscombe|Corpus Christi School]] followed by [[St Peter's Catholic Comprehensive School]].<ref name = "Bank">{{cite news |title=Bank on Adam |newspaper=Bournemouth Daily Echo |url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/sport/3966295.BANK_ON_ADAM/ |date=11 December 2008 |accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref> As a child, Lallana supported [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], like his father.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bascombe |first1=Chris |title=Liverpool v Everton: Boyhood Evertonian Adam Lallana closing in on his best form ahead of Merseyside derby |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/11124085/Liverpool-v-Everton-Boyhood-Evertonian-Adam-Lallana-closing-in-on-his-best-form-ahead-of-Merseyside-derby.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=26 September 2014 |date=26 September 2014}}</ref> He is of [[Spaniards|Spanish]] descent; his paternal grandfather is from Madrid.<ref>{{cite web |title=Lallana talks Zidane, BR and Spanish roots |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/174513-lallana-talks-zidane-br-and-spanish-roots |date=17 November 2014 |accessdate=1 January 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f9W3K5E6l40 |title=BTSP – Mean Tweets – Adam Lallana – Southampton |last=BTSPOfficial |date=6 May 2014 |via=YouTube |access-date=20 May 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140528230530/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f9W3K5E6l40 |archive-date=28 May 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==Club career== ===Southampton=== [[File:Adam Lallana Southampton FC Manchester United 2012,13.png|thumb|left|upright|Lallana in 2012]]
Lallana was a member of the [[AFC Bournemouth]] Centre of Excellence, where he was spotted by a talent scout from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. He joined the [[Premier League]] club's [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Saints Academy]] as a 12-year-old in September 2000. Southampton paid £3,000 compensation to Bournemouth with further payments of £5,000 and £10,000 when he signed scholarship and professional contracts respectively.<ref name=Bank/>
Lallana was involved in Southampton's [[FA Youth Cup]] squads of [[FA Youth Cup Finals of the 2000s#2004–05:_Ipswich_Town_vs_Southampton_(1–0_and_2–2,_3–2_Aggregate)|2004–05]] and [[2005-06 in English football|2005–06]], when they reached the final and semi-final respectively.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
Lallana joined the first team squad in July 2006, making his debut on 23 August 2006, in a 5–2 victory over [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]], in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/5266330.stm |title=Southampton 5–2 Yeovil |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 August 2006 |accessdate=4 January 2014}}</ref> On 31 October 2006 he signed a new contract to keep him at Southampton until December 2009.<ref>{{cite web |title=Lallana signs new deal |publisher=Southampton F.C. |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/?page_id=7672 |date=31 October 2006 |accessdate=9 October 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929091417/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/?page_id=7672 |archivedate=29 September 2007 |deadurl=no}}</ref> On 9 October 2007 he joined Bournemouth on loan for one month.<ref>{{cite web |title=Lallana on loan |publisher=Southampton F.C. |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/?page_id=9101 |date=9 October 2007 |accessdate=9 October 2007}}</ref> On 28 April 2008, Lallana scored his first professional goal for Southampton against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in a crucial Championship match, with a well-placed finish into the bottom left corner.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/7356066.stm |title=West Brom 1–1 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2008 |accessdate=4 September 2009}}</ref>
He became a regular in the first team at the start of the 2008–09 season. On 29 August 2008, he signed a new three-year deal with the Saints.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
He finished the 2009–10 season with a total of twenty goals in all competitions, netting his 20th on the final day of the season against [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]]. This made him the first Southampton midfielder to score twenty goals in a season since [[Matthew Le Tissier]]'s 30 in the 1994–95 season.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
On 7 January 2011, Lallana signed a new contract with Southampton which would expire in the summer of 2015.<ref>{{cite web |title=Midfielder Signs Long Term Deal |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2261409,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=8 January 2011 |date=7 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110110233558/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~2261409%2C00.html |archivedate=10 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Leitch |first=Adam |title=Lallana signs new Saints deal |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/8778862.Lallana_signs_new_Saints_deal/ |newspaper=Southern Daily Echo |location=Southampton |accessdate=8 January 2011 |date=7 January 2011}}</ref> He was named in the League One [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the 2010–11 season after scoring 11 goals that season.<ref name=PFATOTY1011>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/13110874 |title=Spurs' Gareth Bale wins PFA player of the year award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 April 2011 |accessdate=8 May 2018}}</ref>
[[File:AdamLallanaSouthamptonStoke (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Lallana playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2013]]
He then scored on the opening day of the 2011–12 season, a 3–1 victory over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] at [[St Mary's Stadium]] which broke a 12-year hoodoo of Southampton not winning on the opening day and secured a record-breaking seventh consecutive league win. He then scored twice in a 5–2 victory at [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]. His 150th start for the club came in a 1–1 draw at south coast rivals [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]. His tenth goal of the season came in a 4–0 victory over [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]]. He then grabbed a brace in a 2–0 victory over [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]]. He was nominated for the Player of the Year award but lost out to teammate [[Rickie Lambert]]. Along with Lambert and [[Kelvin Davis (footballer)|Kelvin Davis]], he was one of three Southampton players named in the Championship PFA Team of the Year for the 2011–12 season.<ref name=PFATOTY1112>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17797832 |title=Arsenal striker Robin van Persie named PFA Player of the Year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2012 |accessdate=8 May 2018}}</ref> He scored on the final day of the campaign to finish with 13 goals, 11 of which came in the league.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
He made his first Premier League appearance on the opening day of the 2012–13 season, setting up a goal and wearing the captain's armband in a 3–2 defeat against 2011–12 champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19231354 "Man City 3–2 Southampton"] BBC Sport. 19 August 2012. Retrieved 25 November 2012.</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal in a 4–1 defeat away to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19939627 "West Ham 4–1 Southampton"] BBC Sport. 20 October 2012. Retrieved 25 November 2012.</ref> His second goal of the season came on 25 November, as he opened the scoring in a 2–0 home win against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20383440 "Southampton 2–0 Newcastle"] BBC Sport. 25 November 2012. Retrieved 25 November 2012.</ref> The 50th goal of his career came in a 2–0 victory at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].{{citation needed|date=December 2018}} On 11 April 2013, Lallana signed a new five-year contract with Southampton.<ref>{{cite web |title=Southampton: Adam Lallana signs a new five-year contract |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22112980 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 April 2013 |date=11 April 2013}}</ref>
In Southampton's 4–1 Premier League victory over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 9 November 2013, Lallana started with the ball 30 yards from goal and dribbled his way past five players into the left-hand side of the 18-yard box, before slotting it past Hull goalkeeper [[Steve Harper]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/nov/09/southampton-hull-city-premier-league |title=Adam Lallana's brilliant goal helps Southampton crush feeble Hull City |date=9 November 2013 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=30 April 2014}}</ref> On 18 April 2014, he was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27076251 |title=PFA award: Liverpool's Suarez, Gerrard & Sturridge on shortlist |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 27 April 2014, he was named alongside teammate [[Luke Shaw]] in the PFA Team of the Year.<ref name=PFATOTY1314>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27180793 |title=Luis Suarez: Liverpool striker wins PFA Player of the Year award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=8 May 2018}}</ref> On 6 May, he was crowned as both the Southampton Players' Player and Fans' Player of the year.<ref>{{cite web |last=Williams |first=Simon |title=2013/14 Player Awards The winners |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/06052014-player-awards-201314-the-winners-1539729.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=10 May 2014 |date=6 May 2014}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== ====2014–2016==== [[File:Adam Lallana v Arsenal 2014 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Lallana playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2014]]
Prior to the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], Lallana was subject to interest from Premier League runners-up [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. After long periods of negotiation Liverpool placed a reported £25 million bid which was accepted by Southampton.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool bid for Lallana |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/01/adam-lallana-move-southampton-liverpool |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref> Following England's return from the World Cup, Lallana signed for Liverpool, and was handed the number 20 shirt, the number he wore during his time at Southampton. Bournemouth, Lallana's youth team, had originally included a 25% sell-on-clause in his contract when he joined Southampton, but only received £4 million after agreeing to a reduced fee with Southampton.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bournemouth owner explains Lallana sell on clause |url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/sport/11312797.AFC_Bournemouth__Blake_reveals__small_sacrifices__over_Lallana_deal |newspaper=Bournemouth Daily Echo |accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Adam Lallana: Liverpool sign Southampton captain for £25m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27647888 |accessdate=1 July 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 July 2014}}</ref>
On 25 July, Liverpool confirmed that Lallana had injured his knee while training with the club in [[Boston]], Massachusetts during pre-season and would be out for six weeks. He therefore missed the start of the league season, which began against former club Southampton.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bascombe |first1=Chris |title=Liverpool suffer blow to preparations as Adam Lallana ruled out for six weeks with knee injury |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=25 July 2014}}</ref> He made his debut in Liverpool's fourth match on 13 September, starting and being substituted for [[Raheem Sterling]] after 61 minutes in a 1–0 home defeat to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Liverpool 0–1 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090587 |accessdate=13 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 September 2014}}</ref> On 4 October he scored his first goal for the club, opening a 2–1 home win against West Bromwich Albion seconds before half time.<ref>{{cite web |title=Liverpool 2–1 West Brom |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29389680 |accessdate=4 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 October 2014}}</ref> Lallana scored his second goal for Liverpool on 2 December during Liverpool's 3–1 win at [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Johnston |first1=Neil |title=Leicester 1–3 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30188283 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 December 2014 |date=2 December 2014}}</ref> On 29 December, he continued his fine form and scored two cruise to victory |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11316920/Liverpool-4-Swansea-City-1-Adam-Lallana-shows-his-class-as-Liverpool-cruise-to-victory.html On 19 April 2015, Lallana was selected in [[Football League Awards#2015 Awards|the Football Manager Team of the Decade]] at the [[Football League Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Winners announced for May 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref>
====2016–present==== [[File:Adam Lallana.jpg|thumb|upright|Lallana in action against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] during the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]]]]
On 14 August 2016, during the opening match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Lallana scored Liverpool's second goal, which took the Reds to a 2–1 lead, with the match eventually ending in a 4–3 win for Liverpool.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37001073 |title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool |date=14 August 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> On 10 September, Lallana scored in Liverpool's 4–1 win over [[2015–16 Premier League|last season's champions]] [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263954 |title=Liverpool 4–1 Leicester City |date=10 September 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> Two weeks later, on 24 September, he scored in Liverpool's 5–1 win over [[2015–16 Football League Championship|newly-promoted]] [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393500 |title=Liverpool 5–1 Hull City |date=24 September 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> On 11 December, he scored Liverpool's opening goal in the mach against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]],<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38199047 |title=Liverpool 2–2 West Ham United |date=11 December 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> which eventually ended in a 2–2 draw. Three days later, he scored twice in a 3–0 defeat of [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]],<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38232292 |title=Middlesbrough 0–3 Liverpool |date=14 December 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> and on 27 December, he scored in Liverpool's 4–1 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38375153 |title=Liverpool 4–1 Stoke City |date=27 December 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> On 22 February 2017, Lallana signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/254754-adam-lallana-signs-new-long-term-liverpool-fc-deal |title=Adam Lallana signs new long-term Liverpool FC deal |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> On 21 May 2017, on the final day of the season, Lallana scored Liverpool's third goal in their 3–0 win over Middlesbrough, which secured a top-four finish for the Reds and qualification to [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|next year's UEFA Champions League]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39912029 |title=Liverpool 3–0 Middlesbrough |date=21 May 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref>
In August 2017, Lallana suffered a long-term injury during the [[Audi Cup]] final against [[Atlético Madrid]], which would keep him out until mid-November.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/270815-adam-lallana-facing-a-couple-of-months-out-with-injury |title=Adam Lallana facing 'a couple of months' out with injury |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> His first appearance of the season was in Liverpool's 1–1 draw with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], coming on as an 89th minute substitute for [[Philippe Coutinho]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42035410 |title=Liverpool 1–1 Chelsea |date=15 November 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> On 31 March, during a match against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], Lallana came on as a substitute in the 65th minute, but only several minutes after playing, he suffered another injury, which kept him out for "a number of weeks".<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43524303 |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Liverpool |date=31 March 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/296301-jurgen-klopp-adam-lallana-injury-liverpool-fc |title=Klopp provides update on Adam Lallana injury |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> He returned to the squad on 13 May, on the final day of the Premier League season, coming on as a substitute for [[Sadio Mané]] in the 74th minute, playing against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. Liverpool won the match 4–0, which was enough to secure a top-four finish and a place in [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League|next year's UEFA Champions League group stages]], as finishing in fourth place now meant that clubs in the [[Premier League]] will automatically qualify for the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]], rather than qualifying initially for the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League#Play-off round|play-off round]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44020158 |title=Liverpool 4–0 Brighton & Hove Albion |date=13 May 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Dudko |first1=James |title=UEFA Announces Qualification Changes for Champions League, Europa League |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2761824-uefa-announces-qualification-changes-for-champions-league-europa-league |website=Bleacher Report |accessdate=15 June 2018 |date=27 February 2018}}</ref>
On 26 May, during the [[2018 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[Real Madrid]], Lallana came on as a substitute in the 31st minute for [[Mohamed Salah]], who had left the field in tears after suffering an injury, following a duel with [[Sergio Ramos]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/965534/Mohamed-Salah-injury-Liverpool-star-Sergio-Ramos-Real-Madrid-Champions-League-final |title=Mohamed Salah injury: Liverpool star subbed off after Sergio Ramos challenge |last=Short |first=Joe |date=26 May 2018 |newspaper=Daily Express |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/965547/Mohamed-Salah-injury-Liverpool-diagnosis-amid-World-Cup-Champions-League-final |title=Mohamed Salah injury: Liverpool confirm diagnosis from Champions League final |last=Short |first=Joe |date=27 May 2018 |newspaper=Daily Express |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> Liverpool would go on lose the final by a scoreline of 3–1.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000885/match=2021711/index.html |title=Long Term |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> Lallana made only 13 appearances in the [[2017–18 Liverpool F.C. season|2017–18 season]], without scoring.<ref name="sb1718" />
==International career== [[File:Lallana England.png|thumb|125px|Lallana playing for [[England national football team|England]] in 2013]]
Lallana played for [[England national under-18 football team|England Under-18s]], scoring on his debut against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]], 18 months after undergoing an operation to correct an irregular heartbeat. He also played once each for [[England national under-19 football team|England Under-19s]] and [[England national under-21 football team|England Under-21s]]. On 10 September 2012, Lallana was called up to the senior [[England national football team|England]] squad for the first time for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|2014 World Cup qualifying]] match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] although he was not selected for the match itself.<ref>{{cite news |title=Shock England call for trio |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12098/8069628/Shock-England-call-for-trio |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 September 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2012}}</ref>
On 7 November 2013, along with Southampton teammates Rickie Lambert and fellow uncapped Saint [[Jay Rodriguez]], he was called up to the England team.<ref>{{cite news |title=England squad: Southampton striker Jay Rodriguez called up |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24849964 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 November 2013 |date=7 November 2013}}</ref> Lallana won his first cap for England on 15 November by starting a friendly match against [[Chile national football team|Chile]] at [[Wembley Stadium]]. Although England lost 2–0,<ref>{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=England 0–2 Chile |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24862578 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 November 2013 |date=15 November 2013}}</ref> Lallana's performance received generally favourable reviews.<ref>{{cite news |last=Burt |first=Jason |title=England v Chile: Adam Lallana flies flag high for Southampton |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/10453486/England-v-Chile-Adam-Lallana-flies-flag-high-for-Southampton.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=17 November 2013 |date=15 November 2013}}</ref> He also started in England's defeat against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] four days later.<ref>{{cite news |title=England 0–1 Germany |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24907635 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 November 2013 |accessdate=30 March 2014}}</ref> He gained his third cap in a 1–0 friendly win against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] on 5 March 2014, coming on as a substitute for [[Jack Wilshere]] and crossing for [[Daniel Sturridge]] to head in the only goal of the match.<ref>{{cite news |title=England 1–0 Denmark |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26349068 |accessdate=14 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 March 2014}}</ref>
On 12 May 2014, Lallana was named in the 23-man England squad for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/may/12/england-world-cup-squad-hodgson-barkley-sterling |title=England World Cup squad 2014: Ross Barkley and Raheem Sterling called up |date=12 May 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref> He made his competitive debut on 14 June in the first group match against [[Italy national football team|Italy]], coming on for the last 10 minutes in place of Sturridge who had scored England's goal in the 1–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Italy 2–1 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285071 |accessdate=15 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 June 2014}}</ref>
Lallana scored his first goal for England on 4 September 2016 in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match away to [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]] at [[Štadión Antona Malatinského]]. It came during stoppage time and proved to be England's winning goal of the match.<ref name = "goal 040916">{{cite news |title=Last-gasp Lallana gets Allardyce's England era off to a winning start |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=431886 |publisher=ESPN |date=4 September 2016 |accessdate=4 September 2016}}</ref> He scored his second England goal on 11 November 2016 in a 2018 FIFA World Cup qualification match against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]]. The score ended 3–0 to England, with [[Gary Cahill]] and Liverpool teammate Daniel Sturridge scoring the other goals.<ref name="goal 111116">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 3–0 Scotland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37868651 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 November 2016 |accessdate=12 November 2016}}</ref>
On 30 January 2017 it was announced that Lallana had won the [[The FA England Awards|England Player of the Year Award]] for 2016 after his performance for the national team.<ref name=englandpoty>{{cite web |first=Jim |last=Lucas |title=Lallana wins Vauxhall England Player of the Year award for 2016 |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jan/29/300117-adam-lallana-vauxhall-england-player-of-the-year-2016 |publisher=The Football Association |date=30 January 2017 |accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref>
On 16 May 2018, he was one of five players named on standby for the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Lallana married his fiancée Emily Jubb on 24 December 2013. The couple, who had been dating for seven years, were due to marry on 14 June 2014, which coincided with England's opening World Cup match with Italy. They wed at Poole Register Office in Dorset.<ref>{{cite news |last=Richards |first=Chris |title=Southampton star Adam Lallana weds fiancee early to ensure he is available for England's World Cup bid |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/southampton-star-adam-lallana-weds-2959458 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=1 April 2014}}</ref> Together, they have two sons, Arthur Michael, born on 26 September 2012 and Albie George born on 3 June 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton Football Club captain Adam Lallana celebrates after girlfriend gives birth to baby boy |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/9955170.Baby_joy_for_Saints_captain_Adam_Lallana/?ref=rc |newspaper=Southern Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=28 September 2012 |accessdate=1 April 2014}}</ref>
In 2014, Lallana was signed as a [[French Connection (clothing)|French Connection]] model, to promote their Autumn/Winter collection.<ref>{{cite web |title=Fashionable Football: Adam Lallana sporting latest FCUK collection |url=http://www.adamlallana.com/fashionable-football-adam-lallana-fcuk/ |publisher=AdamLallana.com |accessdate=18 November 2015 |date=3 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151119035317/http://www.adamlallana.com/fashionable-football-adam-lallana-fcuk/ |archivedate=19 November 2015}}</ref> He revealed his fashion photo shoot at an interview with ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'' magazine.<ref>{{cite web |title=Adam Lallana: From Winger To Fashion Model |url=http://www.esquire.co.uk/style/news/a6220/adam-lallana-from-winger-to-fashion-model/ |publisher=esquire.co.uk |accessdate=6 September 2017 |date=2 May 2014}}</ref>

Mignolet started his career with [[Belgian Second Division]] side [[K. Sint-Truidense V.V.|Sint-Truiden]] in 2004, and spent six years with the club, making 100 senior league appearances and scoring a goal. He moved to Premier League side [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in June 2010<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/8746398.stm|title=Sunderland sign keeper Mignolet|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]}}</ref> for £2 million, spending three years with them and making 101 appearances across all competitions before moving to Liverpool in June 2013 for £9 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/8792847/transfer-news-liverpool-sign-goalkeeper-simon-mignolet-from-sunderland|title=Transfer news: Liverpool sign goalkeeper Simon Mignolet from Sunderland|last=Parrish|first=Rob|date=26 June 2013|publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
Mignolet has represented the Belgium national team at every level from under-16 upwards. He made his senior debut in 2011, has since earned over 20 caps. He was also named to Belgium's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Sint-Truiden=== Mignolet was born in [[Sint-Truiden]]. He first joined his local football team, [[Belgian Second Division]] side [[K. Sint-Truidense V.V.|Sint-Truiden]], in 2004, eventually rising through their youth system to become their first-choice goalkeeper in 2006 at age 18 after the departure of [[Dušan Belić]]. In 2009, he made 29 appearances and scored a penalty in the league, as he helped Sint-Truiden to win the [[Belgian Second Division]], and was named [[Belgian professional football awards|Belgian Goalkeeper of the Year]] the following year after he helped Sint-Truiden avoid relegation.
===Sunderland=== [[File:Simon Mignolet.jpg|thumb|left|120px|Simon Mignolet with Sunderland in 2011]] After being invited for a training ground tour, Mignolet signed a five-year contract with English [[Premier League]] club [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 17 June 2010 in a deal worth £2 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/17/sunderland-sign-simon-mignolet|title=Sunderland sign Belgium Under-21 goalkeeper Simon Mignolet|date=17 June 2010|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/20100617/mignolet-on-dream-move_2256213_2073163 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100619141456/http://www.safc.com/news/20100617/mignolet-on-dream-move_2256213_2073163 |title=Mignolet on dream move |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C |date=17 June 2010 |accessdate=26 June 2013 |archivedate=19 June 2010}}</ref> It was later confirmed by Sint-Truiden that Sunderland had beaten [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], [[FC Twente|Twente]] and [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] to secure Mignolet's signature.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/462/netherlands/2010/03/29/1854728/there-has-been-no-contact-between-psv-and-simon-mignolet|title=FINISHED: No Contact Yet Between PSV And Simon Mignolet|date=29 March 2010|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref>
Mignolet made his Sunderland debut in a 2–2 draw against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on 15 August 2010, and was named man of the match for his performance. In the next home match, a 1–0 victory against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], Mignolet kept his first clean sheet for Sunderland, following an excellent reaction save to deny [[Emmanuel Adebayor]] a goal. Mignolet put in another fine performance against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], as Sunderland drew 1–1 after [[Darren Bent]] equalised in the 95th minute. However, [[Craig Gordon]] would replace Mignolet in goal several weeks later, and remained first-choice thereafter. Mignolet did not feature again until 8 January 2011, when Sunderland suffered a loss at home to [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] in the third round of the [[FA Cup]]. Mignolet would become first-choice goalkeeper again after a knee injury to Gordon in February, and earned a string of rave reviews for his performances.{{cn|date=February 2019}} Following the draw, Sunderland manager [[Steve Bruce]] hailed the young goalkeeper's fine start to life in English football.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2011/03/05/2380907/sunderland-boss-steve-bruce-hails-performance-of-goalkeeper|title=Sunderland boss Steve Bruce hails performance of goalkeeper Simon Mignolet after draw with Arsenal - Goal.com|date=5 March 2011|publisher=}}</ref> Mignolet cemented his position as first-choice goalkeeper the following season, being preferred to new signing [[Keiren Westwood]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/8695430/Liverpool-1-Sunderland-1-match-report.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | first=Rory | last=Smith | title=Liverpool 1 Sunderland 1: match report | date=13 August 2011}}</ref> On 29 October 2011, Mignolet was injured during a 2–2 draw with [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], suffering a broken nose following a collision with [[Emile Heskey]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11695/7281455/Mignolet-suffers-broken-nose |title=Mignolet suffers broken nose |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 October 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref>
Mignolet played every single match of [[2011–12 Sunderland A.F.C. season|the following season]], keeping a large number of clean sheets and producing several man of the match performances.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rayner |first=Stuart |url=http://www.journallive.co.uk/safc/safc-news/2012/09/24/simon-mignolet-just-fails-to-save-the-day-61634-31893069/ |title=Simon Mignolet just fails to save the day – Sunderland News – SAFC |publisher=JournalLive |date=2 October 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Holden |first=Kit |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/match-report-sunderlands-simon-mignolet-at-his-best-to-keep-stoke-city-at-bay-8229208.html |title=Match Report: Sunderland's Simon Mignolet at his best to keep Stoke City at bay – Premier League – Football |publisher=The Independent |date=28 October 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> His form prompted Manchester City and [[England national football team|England]] goalkeeper [[Joe Hart]] to praise Mignolet in December 2012 as being the best goalkeeper in the league so far that season.<ref>{{cite web|author=Colin Young |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2264744/Simon-Mignolet-interview-On-pressure-injury-degree.html |title=Simon Mignolet interview: On pressure, his injury and his degree | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=18 January 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> On 21 June 2013, it was reported [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] had agreed a deal to sign the player for around £9 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23011973 |title=BBC Sport – Simon Mignolet: Liverpool sign Sunderland keeper for £9m |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== [[File:Simon Mignolet - Gerrard testimonial 2013.jpg|175px|thumb|Mignolet with Liverpool in 2013 during [[Steven Gerrard]]'s testimonial match]] On 25 June 2013, Mignolet signed with Liverpool for a reported fee of £9 million on a five-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23011973 |title=Simon Mignolet: Liverpool sign Sunderland keeper for £9m |publisher=BBC Sport |date= 25 June 2013 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref> Liverpool manager [[Brendan Rodgers]] hailed Mignolet as being "one of the top goalkeepers in the Premier League".{{cn|date=February 2019}} On 13 July 2013, he made his unofficial debut for Liverpool in a 4–0 win in a pre-season friendly over [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/139323-reds-hit-preston-for-four-report |title=Reds hit Preston for four – report |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=13 July 2013 |accessdate=18 August 2013 |first=Alex |last=Urquhart-Cannon}}</ref> On 17 August 2013, Mignolet made his official debut in the 1–0 home win against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] at [[Anfield]]. In the 89th minute of the match, he saved a [[Jonathan Walters]] penalty, as well as [[Kenwyne Jones]]' follow-up shot, to preserve Liverpool's lead and effectively win the match.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23653990 "Liverpool 1–0 Stoke"] BBC Sport. 17 August 2013. Retrieved 17 August 2013.</ref> He then recorded two more clean sheets against Aston Villa and [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], with both matches ending 1–0 in favour of Liverpool. Two weeks later, he conceded his first goals for Liverpool in the Premier League in a 2–2 draw with [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], though he was still named man of the match for the fixture. Mignolet was also named man of the match in the 3–3 draw with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], making nine saves throughout the match.{{cn|date=February 2019}}
[[File:Simon Mignolet, 2014.jpg|thumbnail|left|Mignolet playing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2014]] On 14 December 2014, Mignolet's run of 53 consecutive Premier League starts came to an end as he was replaced by [[Brad Jones (footballer)|Brad Jones]] in the starting 11 against Manchester United, with Brendan Rodgers saying Mignolet would be dropped for an "indefinite period".<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester United 3 Liverpool 0, match report: David de Gea the Old Trafford hero as rivals are swept aside|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11293000/Manchester-United-3-Liverpool-0-match-report-David-de-Gea-the-Old-Trafford-hero-as-rivals-are-swept-aside.html|accessdate=14 December 2014|publisher=The Telegraph|date=14 December 2014}}</ref> However, 12 days later, Jones went off injured after 16 minutes away at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], and despite some errors, Mignolet kept a clean sheet in a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Johnston|first1=Neil|title=Burnley 0–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30544290|accessdate=28 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2014}}</ref> After this match, Mignolet kept four consecutive clean sheets against Sunderland, Aston Villa, [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and Everton respectively.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30257075|title=Sunderland 0–1 Liverpool|date=10 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Football|accessdate=14 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30758464|title=Aston Villa 0–2 Liverpool|date=17 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Football|accessdate=14 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30963476|title=Liverpool 2–0 West Ham|date=31 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Football|accessdate=14 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31071270|title=Everton 0–0 Liverpool|date=7 February 2015 |publisher=BBC Football|accessdate=14 February 2015}}</ref> On 10 February, Mignolet made some outstanding saves against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in a 3–2 win.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Liverpool 3–2 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31106342|accessdate=31 August 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=10 February 2015}}</ref> On 16 March, Mignolet continued his resurgence in a 1–0 victory against Swansea, keeping a clean sheet as part of a strong performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/31792005|title=Swansea City 0–1 Liverpool|date=16 March 2015|publisher=|via=www.bbc.com}}</ref> On 22 March, he saved a penalty taken by [[Wayne Rooney]] in a 2–1 defeat against Manchester United.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Liverpool 1–2 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31893202|accessdate=22 March 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 March 2015}}</ref>
On 18 January 2016, Mignolet signed new five-year deal with the club.<ref>{{cite web|title=Simon Mignolet: Liverpool goalkeeper signs new five-year deal|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35347250|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 January 2016}}</ref> Eight days later, he saved a penalty from [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]]'s [[Peter Crouch]] and [[Marc Muniesa]] in a penalty shoot-out to send Liverpool to the [[2016 Football League Cup Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/26/liverpool-stoke-city-capital-one-cup-match-report|title=Joe Allen fires Liverpool to Wembley in shootout win over Stoke City|date=26 January 2016|work=Guardian|accessdate=27 January 2016}}</ref>
Although he started the first five matches of the season, Liverpool manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] dropped Mignolet in favor of new signing [[Loris Karius]] on 24 September 2016 for the match against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393500 |title=Liverpool 5–1 Hull City |date=24 September 2016 |publisher=BBC Sports}}</ref> On 24 October 2016, Klopp confirmed Mignolet was no longer Liverpool's first-choice goalkeeper and that he will be given cup matches instead.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/liverpool-news-jurgen-klopp-simon-mignolet-efl-cup-vs-spurs-a7378771.html |title=Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp confirms Simon Mignolet is no longer No 1 as Liverpool prepare for EFL Cup clash |date=24 October 2016 |publisher=The Independent}}</ref> However, Mignolet returned to the starting lineup for the team in Premier League in December 2016. On 23 September 2017, Mignolet saved his club-record 8th penalty, preserving a 3–2 victory over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/liverpool/364/blog/post/3212833/penalty-specialist-simon-mignolets-eight-spot-kick-saves-for-liverpool|title=Penalty specialist Simon Mignolet's eight spot kick saves for Liverpool|work=ESPNFC.com|access-date=25 September 2017}}</ref> On 4 November, Mignolet captained Liverpool for the first time in a 4-1 win against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/280564-mignolet-to-captain-liverpool-was-unbelievable|title=Mignolet: To captain Liverpool was unbelievable|website=Liverpool FC|access-date=2019-02-04}}</ref> On 26 December, Mignolet and teammate [[Philippe Coutinho]] both made their 200th appearances for Liverpool in a 5–0 Premier League win over [[Swansea City F.C.|Swansea]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/liverpool-team-news-matip-and-oxlade-chamberlain-start/ylygyw1r7ur81mzktx4ttc4nu|title=Liverpool Team News: Matip and Oxlade-Chamberlain start against Swansea|website=Goal|last=Reddy|first=Melissa|date=26 December 2017|accessdate=27 December 2017}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Vincent Kompany Simon Mignolet Kevin De Bruyne vs USA.jpg|thumb|right|Mignolet ''(middle)'' with [[Belgium national football team|Belgian]] teammates [[Vincent Kompany]] ''(left)'' and [[Kevin De Bruyne]] in 2013]] Mignolet first represented the [[Belgium national under-21 football team|Belgian under-21 side]] in 2008, and went on to make ten appearances for the side.<ref name="nat stats">{{cite web |url=http://static.belgianfootball.be/project/publiek/jrinteren/speler_PH_5247.htm#itop |title=Simon Mignolet |publisher=Royal Belgian Football Association |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> On 1 September 2010, he won his first call up to the [[Belgium national football team|Belgian senior squad]] after a good run of form for Sunderland.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/sunderland-form-wins-mignolet-belgium-call-1087731 |publisher=Tribal Football |title=Sunderland form wins Mignolet Belgium call-up |date=2 September 2010 |accessdate=26 June 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130927141658/http://www.tribalfootball.com/sunderland-form-wins-mignolet-belgium-call-1087731 |archive-date=27 September 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He made his full international debut in a 2–0 victory over [[Austria national football team|Austria]] on 25 March 2011 in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualification|UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying]] match.<ref name="nat stats"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/03/25/europe/european-championship-qualification/austria/belgium/914604/news/ |title=Euro 2012 qualifying Group A: Austria 0 Belgium 2 |publisher=Soccerway |date=26 March 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> He remained in the starting line-up for each of the four remaining qualifying matches,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002129/postmatch/lineups/index.html |title=Belgium 4–1 Azerbaijan – Lineups |publisher=UEFA |date=29 March 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002126/postmatch/lineups/index.html |title=Belgium 1–1 Turkey – Lineups |publisher=UEFA |date=3 June 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002138/postmatch/lineups/index.html |title=Azerbaijan 1–1 Belgium – Lineups |publisher=UEFA |date=2 September 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/postmatch/lineups/index.html|title=Germany 3–1 Belgium – Lineups |publisher=UEFA |date=11 October 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> in addition to playing in three friendly matches during the qualifying campaign.<ref name="nat stats"/> However, he was unable to help Belgium qualify for the [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012 finals]], as a 3–1 defeat against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] saw them finish third in their qualifying group.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Germany 3–1 Belgium – Lineups |publisher=UEFA |date=11 October 2011 |accessdate=26 June 2013 |first=Stefan |last=Potter}}</ref>
Mignolet played in two further friendly internationals during the [[2011–12 in Belgian football|2011–12]] season, starting against [[Greece national football team|Greece]] and [[England national football team|England]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/match?id=337296&cc=5739 |title=Match: Greece v Belgium |publisher=ESPN |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18294160 |title=England 1–0 Belgium |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 June 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013 |first=Phil |last=McNulty}}</ref> However, following the match against England, he did not play an international match for four months, with [[Thibaut Courtois]] being preferred instead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.benefoot.net/belgium-netherlands-team-news-courtois-starts-in-goal-for-the-rode-duivels/ |title=Belgium – Netherlands Team News: Courtois starts in goal for the Rode Duivels |publisher=BeNeFoot |date=15 August 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013 |first=Gary |last=Niblock}}</ref> He returned to the starting lineup on 14 November 2012 in a 1–2 friendly loss over [[Romania national football team|Romania]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://static.belgianfootball.be/project/publiek/rencinter/en/wed_7692.htm |title=Romania 2–1 Belgium |publisher=Royal Belgian Football Association |date=14 November 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref> His next international match came over six months later in a 4–2 friendly victory over the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] on 29 May 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://static.belgianfootball.be/project/publiek/rencinter/en/wed_7805.htm |title=USA 2–4 Belgium |publisher=Royal Belgian Football Association |date=29 May 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2013}}</ref>
Mignolet served as back-up goalkeeper during the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification campaign]], with Courtois playing every minute as Belgium qualified for its first major tournament since the [[2002 FIFA World Cup|2002 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/9029958/chelsea-keeper-thibaut-courtois-labelled-best-in-world-by-belgium-team-mate-toby-alderweireld|title=Chelsea keeper Thibaut Courtois labelled 'best in world' by Belgium team-mate Toby Alderweireld|date=18 November 2013|accessdate=17 April 2014|work=BSkyB}}</ref>
On 10 October 2015, Mignolet started for an injured Courtois in Belgium's last two [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 2016 qualifying]] matches: a 4–1 win over [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] and a 3–1 victory over [[Israel national football team|Israel]], helping seal Belgium's qualification for the first time since co-hosting [[UEFA Euro 2000|Euro 2000]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium claim Euro 2016 spot by trashing Andorra 4–1|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/10/10/uk-soccer-euro-andorra-idUKKCN0S40WT20151010|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Reuters|date=10 October 2015}}</ref>
In May 2018 he was named in Belgium’s preliminary [[Belgium national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]],<ref>{{cite web|title= World Cup 2018: Belgium announce initial 28-man squad for Russia| url= https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/belgium-world-cup-squad-confirmed-russia-2018-nainggolan-hazard-de-bruyne-lukaku-a8361241.html%3Famp |accessdate= 9 September 2018}}</ref> and later appeared on their 24-man squad as a goalkeeper together with [[Thibaut Courtois]] and [[Koen Casteels]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/0/belgium-world-cup-2018-squad-list-team-guide/ |title=Belgium World Cup 2018 squad list and team guide |last=Fifield |first=Andrew |date=15 July 2018 |website=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |access-date=29 August 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Mignolet can speak English, French, Dutch and German.<ref>[http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/147236-free-video-brand-new-kop-kids Free video: Brand new Kop Kids] -''[[Liverpoolfc.com Video]]''</ref> He has a degree in [[political science]] from the [[Katholieke Universiteit Leuven|Catholic University of Leuven]].<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/06/simon-mignolet-sunderland Sunderland's accidental goalkeeper is more interested in completing his political sciences degree than boy toys] -''[[The Guardian]]''</ref> On 20 June 2015, Mignolet married his girlfriend Jasmien Claes in his hometown.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gva.be/cnt/dmf20150620_01740590/rode-duivel-simon-mignolet-stapt-in-het-huwelijksbootje |title=Rode Duivel Simon Mignolet stapt in het huwelijksbootje |language=nl |newspaper=[[Gazet Van Antwerpen]] |author=fivr |date=20 June 2015 |accessdate=23 June 2015}}</ref>
