nationalyears5 = 2010– | nationalteam5 = [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] | nationalcaps5 = 78 | nationalgoals5 = 22 | ntupdate = 22 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Xherdan Shaqiri''' ({{IPA-sq|dʒɛrˈdan ʃaˈciɾi}}; born 10 October 1991) is a Swiss professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[Switzerland national football team|Swiss national team]].
He began his career at [[FC Basel]], winning honours including three [[Swiss Super League]] titles, before moving to [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], where he gained eight domestic and international honours despite playing less frequently. In January 2015, he moved to [[Inter Milan]] for a fee of €15 million, and seven months later to [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] for a club record £12 million. After Stoke's relegation from the Premier League in [[2017–18 Premier League|2018]], Shaqiri was transferred to Liverpool prior to the following season for a reported £13.5 million fee.
A full international since 2010, Shaqiri has earned over 70 caps and scored over 20 goals for Switzerland. He represented the nation at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010]], [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]s, as well as [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/balkan-imports-hitting-big-time-as-switzerland-establish-themselves-as-world-cup-regulars-1.262390|title=Balkan imports hitting big time as Switzerland establish themselves as World Cup regulars|newspaper=The National|date=15 June 2014|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref>
==Early life== Shaqiri was born in [[Gjilan]], SFR Yugoslavia, to [[Kosovo Albanians|Kosovar Albanian]] parents.<ref name=fifa>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player=321653/profile-detail.html|title=Xherdan SHAQIRI|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=16 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballtop.com/players/xherdan-shaqiri|title=Xherdan Shaqiri biography|publisher=FootballTop.com|accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref> He emigrated to Switzerland in 1992 with his parents and three siblings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://balkans.courriers.info/article18891.html|title=Football : Xherdan Shaqiri, le meilleur ambassadeur suisse du Kosovo|newspaper=Le Courrier des Balkans|date=22 December 2012|language=French|accessdate=15 August 2013|first=Simon|last=Rico|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130720041647/http://balkans.courriers.info/article18891.html|archive-date=20 July 2013|dead-url=yes}}</ref> They settled in [[Augst]], a small town in the canton of [[Canton of Basel-Landschaft|Basel-Country]], near the French and German borders.<ref name=jill>{{cite news |last1=Zimmerli |first1=Jill |title=World Cup 2014: Switzerland profile – Xherdan Shaqiri |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jun/03/world-cup-2014-switzerland-profile-xherdan-shaqiri |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=4 June 2014}}</ref>
His father did not speak Swiss German, so he had to start out washing dishes in a restaurant, before working construction on roads. His mother worked as a cleaner in office buildings in the city, which he and his brothers helped with. His father would send as much money back to Kosovo to other family members as he could, meaning Xherdan and the family did not have extra spending money, except for birthdays.<ref name="Background"/> He idolized Brazilian striker [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]], who he said played "like magic".<ref name="Background">{{cite news |title=Xherdan Shaqiri's incredible life story in his own words: from Kosovo to World Cup star|url=https://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/xherdan-shaqiri-stoke-liverpool-transfer-1712944 |accessdate=10 September 2018 |work=Stoke Sentinel}}</ref>
==Club career== ===FC Basel=== Shaqiri started his career at hometown club SV Augst, and at the age of eight he was scouted by [[FC Basel]].<ref name=jill/> Whilst playing for Basel's youth team, he competed in the Under-15 Nike Cup 2007 and was named the best player of the tournament. Despite having several other clubs attempting to sign him, he decided to stay with Basel, where he played for their reserve team from 2007 to 2009 in the [[1. Liga Classic|Swiss 1. Liga]]. Two years later, Shaqiri signed his first professional contract with Basel on 2 January 2009,<ref name="fcb 2009-01-02">{{cite web|url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/-/21575/27/7/7|title=Dreijahres-Profivertrag für Xherdan Shaqiri|publisher=FC Basel 1893|date=2 January 2009|accessdate=19 January 2014|language=German|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201180900/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/-/21575/27/7/7|archive-date=1 February 2014|dead-url=yes}}</ref> with the new contract keeping him at [[St. Jakob-Park]] until June 2014.
Shaqiri made his Basel club debut as a substitute on 12 July 2009 in Basel's [[2009–10 Swiss Super League|2009–10 season]] opening match against [[FC St. Gallen]] at the [[AFG Arena]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID//10044/22517/16/7|title=St. Gallen 2 – Basel 0|publisher=FC Basel 1893|date=25 May 2011|accessdate=1 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016141819/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID//10044/22517/16/7 |archivedate=16 October 2013 }}</ref> Four months later he scored his first goal for Basel in a 4–1 win over [[Neuchâtel Xamax]] at home on 9 November 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID//10044/23275/16/7|title=Basel 4 – Xamax 1|publisher=FC Basel 1893|date=25 May 2011|accessdate=1 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016141425/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID//10044/23275/16/7 |archivedate=16 October 2013 }}</ref> At the end of the [[2009–10 Swiss Super League|2009–10]] season Shaqiri won the national [[Double (association football)|Double]] with Basel, and a year later won the League title again.
In December 2011, Shaqiri provided two assists in a match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], with Basel winning 2–1.<ref name="Manu">{{cite web|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/08122011/58/champions-league-stunned-united-crash-defeat-basel.html|title=Champions League – Stunned United crash out after defeat at Basel|publisher=Yahoo! Europe|accessdate=8 December 2011}}</ref> At the end of the 2011–12 season, for the second time in his Basel stint, he won the Double, consisting of the [[2011–12 Swiss Super League|League]] title,<ref name="sfv 1">{{cite web|year=2012|url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/27863/26/7/7 |title=Jetzt hat Basel den Titel auf sicher|publisher=FC Basel 1893|accessdate=29 April 2012|language=German |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016142727/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/27863/26/7/7 |archivedate=16 October 2013 }}</ref> and the [[2011–12 Swiss Cup|Swiss Cup]].<ref name="sfv 2">{{cite web|year=2012|url=http://www.football.ch/sfv/chcup/de/telegramm.aspx?tg=1973921 |title=Matchtelegram FC Basel 1893 5:3 FC Luzern |publisher=Swiss Football Association|accessdate=16 May 2012|language=German |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20121204154542/http://www.football.ch/sfv/chcup/de/telegramm.aspx?tg=1973921 |archivedate=4 December 2012 }}</ref>
===Bayern Munich=== On 9 February 2012, Basel announced that Shaqiri had accepted a transfer to German club [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] of the [[Bundesliga]] for the [[2012–13 Bundesliga|2012–13 season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/news/story/_/id/1019562/bayern-munich-snap-up-basel-star-shaqiri|title=Bayern snap up Shaqiri|publisher=ESPN|date=9 February 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012}}</ref> The transfer fee was a reported €11.6 million, with Shaqiri signing a four-year contract with the German club which would last until 30 June 2016, and which paid him around €2 million per season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.si.com/more-sports/2012/02/15/bayern-shaqiri|title=Bayern's capture of Shaqiri a coup|website=Sports Illustrated|date=15 February 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012}}</ref> He faced competition for a place in the midfield from established internationals [[Franck Ribéry]], [[Arjen Robben]], [[Toni Kroos]] and [[Thomas Müller]].<ref name=jill/> [[File:ShaqiriBay.jpg|thumb|311x311px|Shaqiri playing for [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in 2012.|alt=]] On 10 July 2012, Shaqiri made his debut in a 1–0 friendly win against [[Bavaria]]n neighbours [[SpVgg Unterhaching]]. His first competitive appearance for the club came on 20 August in a [[2012–13 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]] match at [[SSV Jahn Regensburg]], as a half-time substitute. He scored Bayern's second goal as well as providing assists for [[Mario Mandžukić]] and [[Claudio Pizarro]], with Bayern winning 4–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/match?cc=5901&id=354991|title=SSV Jahn Regensburg 0 – 4 Bayern|publisher=ESPN|date=20 August 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012}}</ref> He helped Bayern secure the top spot in their [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group by scoring a goal and providing assists in a 4–1 defeat of [[FC BATE Borisov|BATE Borisov]] on 5 December, winning the [[Man of the Match]] award and avenging their defeat in [[Minsk]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000347/match=2009571/postmatch/index.html|title=Bayern power past BATE to finish top of Group F|publisher=UEFA |date=5 December 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012|first=Andy|last=James}}</ref>
Shaqiri did not score his first [[2012–13 Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] goal until the final league match of the 2012 calendar year, rescuing a point for them in a 1–1 draw with [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]], leaving Bayern in first place at the winter break.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2012/0000233823.php|title=Shaqiri rescues point for Bayern|publisher=Bundesliga|date=14 December 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121217052140/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2012/0000233823.php |archivedate=17 December 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/346253/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901|title=Bayern Munich 1–1 Borussia Monchengladbach|publisher=ESPN FC|date=14 December 2012|accessdate=15 December 2012}}</ref> On 16 April 2013, Shaqiri also scored in the DFB-Pokal semi-final against [[VfL Wolfsburg]] with a long-range shot. Although he did not play in the [[2013 UEFA Champions League Final|final]], Shaqiri won the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League]] title with Bayern, as well as the Bundesliga and the DFB-Pokal title, making him one of the Bayern Munich players to have won the first treble in club history; he added the [[UEFA Super Cup]] and [[FIFA Club World Cup]] to his achievements that year.<ref name=jill/> By June 2014, Shaqiri was reported to be the most decorated Swiss footballer of all time at just 22, with 13 medals to his name.<ref name=jill/>
===Inter Milan=== Shaqiri transferred to Italian club [[Inter Milan]] on 9 January 2015 for €15 million,<ref name=Inter2015bilancio>F.C. Internazionale Milano S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 30 June 2015 (in Italian), [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.]</ref> signing a four-and-a-half-year contract,<ref>{{cite news|title=Xherdan Shaqiri: Inter Milan sign Bayern Munich winger|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30732337|accessdate=13 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 January 2015}}</ref> though English club [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] had previously declared an interest in signing him.<ref>{{cite news|title=Xherdan Shaqiri: Bayern Munich winger interests Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30715283|accessdate=8 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 January 2015}}</ref> With his previous number of 23 being taken by [[Andrea Ranocchia]], Shaqiri chose the number 91 for his Inter shirt, representing his birth year.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shaqiri: "One of the biggest clubs in the world"|url=https://www.inter.it/en/news/47321|publisher=F.C. Internazionale Milano|date=14 January 2015|accessdate=14 September 2015}}</ref> He was an unused substitute in Inter's 3–1 victory over [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]] at [[San Siro]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Inter 3–1 Genoa: Palacio, Icardi and Vidic score in Nerazzurri victory|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/internazionale-vs-genoa/1836447/report|accessdate=22 January 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=11 January 2015}}</ref> He made his debut for Inter on 17 January, playing in the last 16 minutes as a substitute for fellow new signing [[Lukas Podolski]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Serie A, Empoli 0–0 Inter|url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/47349|accessdate=22 January 2015|publisher=F.C. Internazionale Milano|date=17 January 2015}}</ref> Shaqiri made his [[Coppa Italia]] debut in a match against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] in the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia#Round of 16|round of 16]] on 22 January, scoring the first goal of the match and helping the team to a 2–0 win to progress into the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia#Quarter-finals|quarter-finals]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Inter Milan 2–0 Sampdoria: Lukas Podolski and Xherdan Shaqiri combine in Coppa Italia victory for Roberto Mancini's side|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2920941/Inter-Milan-2-0-Sampdoria-Lukas-Podolski-Xherdan-Shaqiri-combine-Coppa-Italia-victory-Roberto-Mancini-s-side.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|first=Sunni|last=Upal|date=22 January 2015|accessdate=22 January 2015}}</ref>
Shaqiri scored his first [[Serie A]] goal on 15 February 2015 in a 4–1 away win against [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/47588|title=Shaqiri: "Pleased with my goal and the victory"|date=15 February 2015|publisher=F.C. Internazionale Milano}}</ref> Four days later, he registered his first European tournament goal for Inter, scoring the opener from a [[Zdravko Kuzmanović]] assist in a 3–3 [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] draw away to [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.inter.it/en/news/47623|title=Six goals shared at Celtic Park|date=19 February 2015|publisher=F.C. Internazionale Milano}}</ref>
===Stoke City=== In July 2015, Stoke agreed a £12 million fee to sign Shaqiri, but the deal fell through when he did not agree to the move before a deadline imposed by the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stoke City pull out of £12 million Xherdan Shaqiri deal|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/stoke-city/11732595/Stoke-City-pull-out-of-12-million-Xherdan-Shaqiri-deal.html|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|first=John|last=Percy|date=10 July 2015|accessdate=7 August 2015}}</ref> The deal was revived a month later, however, with Shaqiri agreeing to personal terms and undergoing medicals.<ref name="ESPN">{{cite news|title=Xherdan Shaqiri passes medical ahead of £12m Stoke move – sources|url=http://www.espnfc.com/stoke-city/story/2557269/xherdan-shaqiri-passes-medical-ahead-of-stoke-move|accessdate=10 August 2015|publisher=ESPN FC|date=10 August 2015}}</ref> [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] had also expressed interest in him but only wanted a loan deal, while Inter preferred a permanent move.<ref name="ESPN"/> On 11 August, Shaqiri completed his move to Stoke for a club-record fee of £12 million (€14.5 million),<ref name=Inter2015bilancio/> on a five-year deal.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.stokecityfc.com//news/article/shaqiri-signs-in-club-record-deal-2611120.aspx?site=desktop|title=Shaqiri signs in club record deal|publisher=Stoke City F.C.|date=11 August 2015|accessdate=12 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Xherdan Shaqiri: Stoke City sign Inter Milan winger for £12m|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33847333|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 August 2015}}</ref>
==== 2015–16 ==== {{Quote box | width = 25% | align = right | quoted = 1 | quote = That is the best goal I have seen this season. He knew exactly what he was doing, it is absolutely sublime. | source = – [[Garth Crooks]], pundit on the [[BBC]]'s ''[[Final Score]]'', describing Shaqiri's second goal for Stoke against Everton on 28 December 2015.<ref name="Everton" /> }} He made his debut eleven days later in a 1–1 draw with [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] at [[Carrow Road]], assisting [[Mame Biram Diouf]]'s headed goal with a free kick.<ref>{{cite web|title=Norwich City 1–1 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33944696|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Tim|last=Oscroft|date=22 August 2015|accessdate=24 August 2015}}</ref> On 28 December, Shaqiri recorded his first goals for Stoke, a first-half brace in a 4–3 win at Everton. The second of these two goals was a half-volley over [[Tim Howard]], from [[Bojan Krkić|Bojan]]'s pass.<ref name=Everton>{{cite web|last=Reddy|first=Luke|title=Everton 3–4 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35148469|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 December 2015|accessdate=28 December 2015}}</ref> His only other goal in [[2015–16 Stoke City F.C. season|2015–16]] was a 20-yard strike against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 2 March 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke City 1–0 Newcastle United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35647699|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Jonathan|last=Jurejko|date=2 March 2016|accessdate=20 May 2016}}</ref> In total Shaqiri played 32 times for Stoke in 2015–16 as the side finished in ninth position.<ref name="2015/16"/>
==== 2016–17 ==== Shaqiri scored a 20-yard free kick against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on the opening day of the [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]] season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Middlesbrough 1–1 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994443|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Patrick|last=Jennings|date=13 August 2016|accessdate=26 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Eye-catching Xherdan Shaqiri eager to cement his reputation as Stoke City's entertainer in chief|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/08/14/eye-catching-xherdan-shaqiri-eager-to-cement-his-reputation-as-s/|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|first=Arindam|last=Rej|date=14 August 2016|accessdate=26 September 2016}}</ref> However a calf injury ruled him out for the next six weeks, returning to the side on 24 September 2016 against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] where he provided the assist for [[Joe Allen]] in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke v West Brom preview: Mark Hughes looks for first Premier League win of the season|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/stoke-vs-w-brom/preview/356391|publisher=Sky Sports|first=Andrew|last=Dickson|date=25 September 2016|accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 1–1 West Brom: Salomon Rondon scores stoppage-time equaliser to stun Mark Hughes|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/stoke-vs-w-brom/report/356391|publisher=Sky Sports|first=Adam|last=Bate|date=24 September 2016|accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> Shaqiri scored two long-range goals against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 22 October 2016, becoming the first Stoke player to do so in a Premier League game.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hull City 0–2 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37663781|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Matt|last=Davis|date=22 October 2016|accessdate=27 October 2016}}</ref> He scored another long range strike also against Hull on 15 April 2017 which was named as Stoke's goal of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=I can't pick my favourite goal says Stoke City star Xherdan Shaqiri|url=https://www.stokecityfc.com/teams/stoke-city/xherdan-shaqiri|publisher=Stoke City F.C.|accessdate=22 July 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170720144238/https://www.stokecityfc.com/teams/stoke-city/xherdan-shaqiri|archivedate=20 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39536677|title=Stoke City 3–1 Hull City|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Jamie|last=Strickland|date=15 April 2017|accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> Shaqiri made 22 appearances in [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]], as Stoke finished in 13th position.<ref name="2016/17" /><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2016/17 Premier League season review|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/10887143/stoke-201617-premier-league-season-review|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=26 May 2017}}</ref>
==== 2017–18 ==== [[File:Xherdan Shaqiri corner 2.jpg|thumb|282x282px|Shaqiri preparing to take a corner kick for Stoke during a game against Arsenal, 10 December 2016.]] Shaqiri scored his first goal of the [[2017–18 Stoke City F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in the match against Newcastle United, on 16 September, scoring the equalizing goal in an eventual 1–2 defeat.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/newcastle-vs-stoke/373143|title=Newcastle 2–1 Stoke: Jamaal Lascelles the hero once again as Rafael Benitez returns to dugout|work=Sky Sports|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 4 November, he scored in a 2–2 draw against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41785780|title=Stoke City 2–2 Leicester City|date=4 November 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 25 November, he scored in a 1–2 defeat to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42035415|title=Crystal Palace 2–1 Stoke City|date=25 November 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 2 December, he scored in a 2–1 win over Swansea City.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/stoke-vs-swansea/373244|title=Stoke 2–1 Swansea: Potters' first-half comeback sends Swansea bottom of table|work=Sky Sports|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 3 February 2018, he scored the opening goal in a 1–2 defeat to [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42842342|title=Bournemouth 2–1 Stoke City|date=3 February 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> A week later, on 10 February, he scored in a 1–1 draw against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42927829|title=Stoke City 1–1 Brighton & Hove Albion|date=10 February 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> On 24 February, Shaqiri scored for a third consecutive game in a 1–1 draw against Leicester City.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/feb/24/leicester-city-v-stoke-city-premier-league-live|title=Leicester City 1–1 Stoke City: Premier League – as it happened|last=Bakowski|first=Gregg|date=24 February 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=22 September 2018|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> In March 2018, with Stoke battling against relegation, Shaqiri courted controversy with an interview for Swiss magazine ''[[Schweizer Illustrierte]]'' in which he said there was a "lack of quality" in his Stoke teammates and that even the presence of [[Ronaldinho]] would not improve the team.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/xherdan-shaqiri-stoke-city-transfer-1404833|title=Xherdan Shaqiri nearing Stoke City exit after no-holds barred magazine interview|last=Smith|first=Peter|date=30 March 2018|newspaper=The Sentinel|accessdate=1 April 2018}}</ref> On 5 May, Shaqiri scored in a 1–2 defeat to Crystal Palace, as Stoke suffered relegation to the [[2018–19 EFL Championship|EFL Championship]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43931931|title=Stoke City 1–2 Crystal Palace|date=5 May 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> He played 38 times for the club in the season and finished as top goalscorer for the club with 8 goals, also providing 7 assists.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.whoscored.com/Players/76304/History/Xherdan-Shaqiri|title=Xherdan Shaqiri – History|website=''whoscored.com''|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 13 July 2018, Liverpool signed Shaqiri on a five-year deal after triggering his £13.5 million release clause.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/liverpool-confirm-xherdan-shaqiri-signing-as-swiss-international-pens-fiveyear-deal-a3880576.html|title=Liverpool confirm Shaqiri signing|work=London Evening Standard|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>
He made his unofficial debut for the club on 29 July, in a pre-season friendly game against rivals [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] 4–1 and scored from a [[bicycle kick]] in a 4–1 win.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/jul/28/manchester-united-v-liverpool-international-champions-cup-live|title=Manchester United 1–4 Liverpool: Shaqiri brilliant as United are thrashed – as it happened|last=Dure|first=Beau|date=28 July 2018|work=The Guardian|access-date=22 September 2018|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> On his competitive debut on 12 August, in the opening match of the season against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], he came on as a late substitute in a 4–0 win.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-west-ham-salah-keita-mane-goals-watch-match-report-latest-klopp-a8488511.html|title=Sadio Mane at the double as Liverpool make flying start with demolition of West Ham|work=The Independent|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref> He made his first full start on 22 September, in a 3–0 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], and received praise for his performance which earned him the [[BBC Sport]] [[Player of the match|Man of the Match]] award.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/liverpool/result/result-liverpool-stroll-past-southampton_336366.html|title=Result: Liverpool stroll past Southampton to maintain 100% start|work=Sports Mole|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2018/09/liverpool-3-0-southampton-player-ratings-2/|title=Liverpool 3–0 Southampton: Player Ratings|date=22 September 2018|work=This Is Anfield|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45530713|title=Liverpool 3–0 Southampton: Reds ease past Saints for seventh straight win|date=22 September 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>
Shaqiri scored his first goal for Liverpool on 27 October, scoring the third goal in a 4–1 win over Cardiff City.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45924058|title=Liverpool 4–1 Cardiff City: Sadio Mane scores twice as Reds go top|date=27 October 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=27 October 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> In November, he was left out of the club's Champions League trip to [[Red Star Belgrade]] in Serbia to avoid controversy over his pro-Albanian views.<ref>{{cite news |title=Xherdan Shaqiri: Liverpool midfielder to miss Red Star Belgrade game in Serbia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46094407 |accessdate=6 November 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 November 2018}}</ref> The following month, during the [[Liverpool F.C.–Manchester United F.C. rivalry|North West derby]], Shaqiri scored twice after coming on as a substitute to guide Liverpool to a 3–1 win which saw the club record a league victory over Manchester United for the first time since March 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en-za/news/supersub-shaqiri-the-bargain-of-the-season-as-swiss-star/6jf7ivmrmqkc1bxdqtupd0r0i|title=Supersub Shaqiri the bargain of the season as Swiss star puts Man Utd to sword|publisher=Goal|last=Jones|first=Neil|date=17 December 2018|accessdate=18 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== === Youth === [[File:Xherdan Shaqiri - Switzerland vs. Argentina, 29th February 2012.jpg|thumb|275x275px|Shaqiri playing for Switzerland against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in a friendly match, 29 February 2012.]]Shaqiri made his debut for the [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Swiss under-21]]s side on 11 November 2009 in a 3–1 win against the [[Turkey national under-21 football team|Turkish under-21]] side in a [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 2|2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualifier]]. He scored his first goal for them on 11 June 2011 in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2011 Under-21 Championship]] opening game against the [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Danish under-21]] team.
=== Senior ===
==== UEFA Euro 2012 ==== Shaqiri was promoted to the [[Switzerland national football team|Swiss senior team]] in 2010, making his debut on 3 March 2010 in a 3–1 friendly loss against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. He was included in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]] squad, after receiving a surprise call-up from manager [[Ottmar Hitzfeld]]. Shaqiri scored his first goal for them on 7 September 2010, a long range left-footed shot, in a 1–3 loss against [[England national football team|England]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group G|Euro 2012 qualifier]]. He netted a hat-trick in another Euro 2012 qualifier on 6 September 2011, as Switzerland came from behind to beat [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]] 3–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002282/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Shaqiri treble keeps Swiss hopes alive|publisher=UEFA|date=6 September 2011|accessdate=15 December 2012}}</ref> Switzerland also tried to select him to participate in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympic Football tournament]], but he opted to stay at his new club for pre-season training.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/09/oly-socc-swiss-squad-idUSB29215720120709|title=Olympics-Shaqiri, Xhaka excluded from Swiss soccer squad|date=9 July 2012|accessdate=26 July 2012|agency=Reuters}}</ref>
==== 2014 FIFA World Cup ==== On 11 September 2012, Shaqiri did not sing the [[Swiss national anthem]] in a World Cup qualifier against his ancestral [[Albania national football team|Albania]] in [[Lucerne]], and did not celebrate when he scored the opening goal of a 2–0 win. He wore boots with the flags of Kosovo, Albania and Switzerland for the match.<ref>{{cite news|last=Montague|first=James|title=Rooting for Home, if Not Yet a Home Team|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/20/sports/soccer/kosovo-wants-a-national-soccer-team-and-to-call-its-players-home.html|newspaper=The New York Times|date=19 September 2012|accessdate=8 June 2016}}</ref>
In June 2014, Shaqiri was named in Switzerland's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. In the team's opening match, Shaqiri was named man of the match by [[FIFA]] as the ''Nati'' defeated [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255931/match=300186494/index.html#nosticky|title=Switzerland 2–1 Ecuador|accessdate=16 June 2014|publisher=FIFA}}</ref> He earned the same title a mere ten days later in the Swiss team's third and final group match, scoring a hat-trick against [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]], which included a bending strike from 30 yards, to ensure Switzerland a spot in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup#Round of 16|round of 16]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2668450/Honduras-vs-Switzerland-World-Cup-2014-LIVE-Follow-action-Group-E.html|title=Honduras 0–3 Switzerland World Cup 2014 MATCH REPORT: Xherdan Shaqiri scores a hat-trick to secure Swiss progress|newspaper=Daily Mail|first=Elliott|last=Bretland|date=25 June 2014|accessdate=25 June 2014}}</ref> where they 1–0 lost to Argentina.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27990606|title=Argentina 1–0 Switzerland (aet)|date=1 July 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=22 September 2018}}</ref>
==== UEFA Euro 2016 ==== [[File:Ser-Swi (33).jpg|thumb|224x224px|Shaqiri playing for Switzerland against [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], 22 June 2018.|alt=]]Shaqiri scored three times in the Swiss team's [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|successful qualification campaign]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]], with all of his strikes coming against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]]. He recorded a brace on 15 November 2014 in a 4–0 win over them in [[St. Gallen]],<ref>{{cite news|last1=Holyman|first1=Ian|title=Patient Switzerland see off Lithuania|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000446/match=2013904/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=26 December 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=15 November 2014}}</ref> and in the reverse fixture the following 14 June, he netted an 84th-minute winner in a 2–1 victory.<ref name="LTU 1-2 SUI">{{cite news|title=Switzerland win in Lithuania with late Xherdan Shaqiri goal|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jun/14/switzerland-lithuania-xherdan-shaqiri|newspaper=The Guardian|agency=Press Association|date=14 June 2015|accessdate=26 December 2015}}</ref> In the final tournament in France, he started all four of Switzerland's matches as they reached the last 16, equalising with a [[bicycle kick]] from the edge of the penalty area as they drew 1–1 with [[Poland national football team|Poland]] in [[Saint-Étienne]]; he scored again in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] but the Poles won nonetheless.{{cn|date=February 2019}}
Following Switzerland's first game at Euro 2016, Shaqiri declared he would switch allegiance to [[Kosovo national football team|Kosovo]] if their manager would make him captain, in reaction to Swiss manager [[Vladimir Petković]]'s decision to omit him from that position. Although already an international for the Swiss, FIFA rules would permit Shaqiri to represent Kosovo, who joined the federation earlier that year.<ref name="FIFAA" /><ref>{{cite news|last=Hytner|first=David|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/14/euro-2016-xherdan-shaqiri-switzerland-romania|title=Xherdan Shaqiri drops a bombshell as Swiss prepare for Romania|newspaper=The Guardian|date=14 June 2016|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref> However, since Shaqiri continued to play for Switzerland after Kosovo had become a member of FIFA, it also ruled out the possibility of Shaqiri's eligibility to Kosovo.<ref name=FIFAA>{{cite press release|url=https://www.fifa.com/about-fifa/news/y=2016/m=9/news=change-of-association-to-the-football-federation-of-kosovo-2831273.html|title=Change of association to the Football Federation of Kosovo|date=7 September 2016|accessdate=24 June 2018|publisher=FIFA|quote=In particular, the Bureau of the Players' Status Committee wished to emphasise that the players concerned had not represented their previous association after 13 May 2016, the date of admission of the FFK to FIFA. In other words, they never chose to play for their previous association when they had the opportunity to choose to play for the representative teams of the FFK. The Bureau of the Players’ Status Committee indicated that this was a key element in its decision on the matter. }}</ref>
==== 2018 FIFA World Cup ==== Shaqiri was included in Switzerland's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], held in Russia. In the group stage, he scored the winning goal as the Swiss came from behind to defeat [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] 2–1. He and fellow goalscorer [[Granit Xhaka]], who is also of Kosovar descent, [[Goal celebration|celebrated their goals]] by making an [[Crossed hands (gesture)|eagle gesture]], a symbol of ethnic Albanians.<ref>{{cite news|last=Lowe|first=Sid|title=Switzerland's Xherdan Shaqiri stuns Serbia with late breakaway|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/22/serbia-switzerland-xherdan-shaqiri-world-cup-group-e-match-report|newspaper=The Guardian|date=22 June 2018|accessdate=22 June 2018|quote=As he turned and screamed, he took his shirt off, flexed his muscles and performed a double-eagle celebration, a recreation of the Albanian flag. Alongside him, Granit Xhaka did the same – for the second time.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Swiss duo's 'provocative' black eagle goal celebration 'mixes sport and politics'|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/06/23/football/xherdan-shaqiri-granit-xhaka-eagle-goal-celebration-serbia-switzerland-world-cup-spt-intl/index.html|publisher=CNN|first=John|last=Sinnott|date=25 June 2018|accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/23/xhaka-and-shaqiri-goal-celebrations-bring-balkan-politics-to-world-cup|title=Switzerland's Xhaka and Shaqiri charged by Fifa over Serbia goal celebrations|newspaper=The Guardian|first=Sid|last=Lowe|date=23 June 2018|accessdate=24 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-2018-switzerland-serbia-granit-xhaka-xherdan-shaqiri-goal-celebrations-why-controversial-a8413426.html|title=World Cup 2018: Xherdan Shaqiri and Granit Xhaka's controversial goal celebrations criticised by Swiss media|newspaper=The Independent|first=Jack|last=Watson|date=23 June 2018|accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> Swiss captain [[Stephan Lichtsteiner]], who is not of Albanian origin, did the same gesture to celebrate Shaqiri's goal, and defended both players after the match.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/this-is-more-than-football-lichtsteiner-defends-xhaka/wqp5oele4fws1gyub1fh28230|title=World Cup 2018: 'This is more than football' – Stephan Lichtsteiner defends Granit Xhaka & Xherdan Shaqiri's controversial celebration|access-date=1 October 2018|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> FIFA fined Xhaka and Shaqiri 10,000 [[Swiss franc]]s "for unsporting behaviour contrary to the principles of fair-play", while Lichtsteiner paid 5,000 Swiss francs.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44606965|title=World Cup 2018: Switzerland trio avoid bans for 'eagle gesture' goal celebrations|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 June 2018|accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-2018-granit-xhaka-xherdan-shaqiri-goal-celebrations-albania-kosovo-serbia-fine-a8416466.html|title=World Cup 2018: Granit Xhaka and Xherdan Shaqiri avoid bans after political goal celebrations|newspaper=The Independent|first=Samuel|last=Lovett|date=25 June 2018|accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> Additionally, with the goal he equalled [[Stéphane Chapuisat]]'s tally of 21 in internationals and entered Switzerland's top ten scorers of all time.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kern |first1=Max |last2=Böni |first2=Andreas |title=Shaqiri ist jetzt besser als Chapuisat |url=https://www.blick.ch/sport/fussball/wm/zu-alex-frei-fehlt-noch-einiges-shaqiri-ist-jetzt-besser-als-chapuisat-id8538540.html |accessdate=13 September 2018 |work=Blick |date=21 June 2018 |language=German}}</ref>
==Style of play== Shaqiri plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|right winger]] and [[FIFA]]'s official website describes him as "unpredictable on the ball, adept with both feet, clinical in front of goal and possessing excellent vision."<ref name=FIFAB>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player=321653/profile-detail.html|title=Xherdan SHAQIRI|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=16 June 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140709020530/https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player=321653/profile-detail.html|archivedate=9 July 2014}}</ref> He was described in ''The Daily Telegraph'' as "stocky and powerful" with a "wand of a left foot."<ref name="Telegraph">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/stoke-city/12021171/Xherdan-Shaqiri-Why-the-Alpine-Lionel-Messi-is-loving-life-in-Stoke.html|title=Xherdan Shaqiri: Why the 'Alpine Lionel Messi' is loving life in Stoke|last=Burt|first=Jason|date=27 November 2015|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=4 August 2018}}</ref> He is nicknamed "the [[Alpine states|Alpine]] [[Lionel Messi|Messi]]"<ref name=fifa/> and "the magic dwarf".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/dirty-tackle/2014-world-cup-superlatives-161614995.html|title=2014 World Cup superlatives: From the best nickname to the most likely to put a hole through a goalkeeper|work=Yahoo Sports|date=5 June 2014|accessdate=16 June 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== Shaqiri is a Muslim.<ref>{{cite web|first=Stephan|last=Uersfeld|title=World Cup players to forego Ramadan|url=http://www.espnfc.com/fifa-world-cup/story/1923001/mesut-ozil-among-muslim-footballers-to-forego-ramadan-at-2014-world-cup|publisher=ESPN FC|date=30 June 2014|accessdate=30 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Craig|last=Hope|title=Muslim stars such as Yaya Toure, Edin Dzeko and Karim Benzema could be affected with Ramadan set to begin during World Cup for first time since 1986|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2655010/Muslim-stars-Yaya-Toure-Edin-Dzeko-Karim-Benzema-affected-Ramadan-set-begin-World-Cup.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|date=11 June 2014|accessdate=30 June 2014}}</ref> Shaqiri was chosen to be on the cover of the [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game ''[[FIFA 15]]'' in Switzerland next to [[Lionel Messi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fifplay.com/fifa15-cover-switzerland/|title=FIFA 15 Swiss Cover|publisher=FIFPlay|date=19 August 2014|accessdate=18 February 2015}}</ref> Shaqiri is sponsored by sportswear and equipment supplier [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]]. He wears [[Nike Mercurial Vapor]] boots, and at the 2018 World Cup he had the flags of Switzerland and Kosovo embroidered on each heel.<ref>{{cite news|title=The story of war and hope behind Xherdan Shaqiri's bespoke World Cup boots|url=https://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/switzerland-xherdan-shaqiri-serbia-goal-1606194|newspaper=The Sentinel|first=Peter|last=Smith|date=22 June 2018|accessdate=4 August 2018}}</ref>

Reserves and Academy|Liverpool]] | youthyears2 = 2014– | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 4 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 22 | nationalgoals2 = 20 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | medaltemplates = {{Medal|Country|{{ENG}}}} {{Medal|W|[[FIFA U-17 World Cup]]|[[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2017]]}} }} '''Rhian Joel Brewster''' (born 1 April 2000) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and the [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] national team. In 2017, he was part of the England squad which won the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]] and was awarded the Golden Boot award for ending as the competition's leading goalscorer.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born and raised in the [[London]] area, Brewster attended school at Chadwell Heath Primary School before joining the Chadwell Heath and Shield Football academies.<ref name=never>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41753629|title=Rhian Brewster: 'I've never seen a player like him before'|date=25 October 2017|publisher=[[BBC]]|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref> At the age of seven, he was scouted by representatives from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] and [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton]]. He ultimately joined Chelsea where he developed his game under coach Michael Beale in [[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|the club's academy]] until the age of 14, whereafter he left to join [[Premier League]] rivals [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref name=never/><ref name=AH>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/26/rhian-brewster-england-liverpool-under-17-world-cup-final|title=Rhian Brewster: England U17’s natural finisher on the fast-track at Liverpool|website=Guardian|last=Hunter|first=Andy|date=26 October 2017|accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== In 2015, [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] signed Brewster from Chelsea following a recommendation by Beale who had taken up a position with the club. Brewster's decision to make the move was motivated in part by his father's influence who believed that he had a better chance of breaking through to the first team through Liverpool's academy than Chelsea's.<ref name=never/><ref name=TIA>{{cite web|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2017/01/rhian-brewster-liverpool-academy-forward-set-breakthrough-2017/|title=Rhian Brewster: Liverpool academy forward set for a breakthrough 2017|website=This is Anfield|last=Lusby|first=Jack|date=24 January 2017|accessdate=23 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rhian-brewster-who-liverpool-youngster-11979122|title=Rhian Brewster — who is the Liverpool youngster who scored five in two games for England?|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|last=Kelly|first=Andy|date=4 October 2016|accessdate=21 April 2017}}</ref> He initially joined the club's U18 side before being promoted to the U23 squad, where he scored on his debut against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-youngster-rhian-brewster-snubbing-12698860|title=Liverpool youngster Rhian Brewster on snubbing Chelsea, sleepless nights and being inspired by Suarez|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Pearce|first=James|date=6 March 2017|accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref> During his time with the club's academy, Brewster was placed on a special training regime which included one-on-one sessions with former Liverpool and [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] winger, [[Steve McManaman]].<ref name=AH/>
Brewster was then called up by [[Manager (association football)|manager]] [[Jürgen Klopp]] to the first-team for club [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendlies]] in October and November 2016 during which he scored a [[hat-trick]] against [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]].<ref name=TIA/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/gomez-ends-liverpool-injury-nightmare-12169550|title=Gomez ends Liverpool injury nightmare|first=Andy|last=Kelly|date=13 November 2016|work=Liverpool Echo}}</ref> Later that season, he was named on the bench for Liverpool's [[Premier League]] game against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 23 April 2017, but remained an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39612237|title=Liverpool 1–2 Crystal Palace|date=23 April 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 October 2017}}</ref> The following season, during Liverpool's [[UEFA Youth League]] match against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]], Brewster was the victim of alleged racist comments from Spartak's captain, [[Leonid Mironov]]. An investigation into the incident was opened by [[UEFA]] after the match and Brewster later said in an interview with ''[[The Guardian]]'' that it had been the seventh such instance he had experienced, including once before against the same opposition.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/28/liverpool-rhian-brewster-racial-abuse-england-uefa|title=Liverpool’s Rhian Brewster: ‘When I’m racially abused, I just want to be left alone’|last=Taylor|first=Daniel|work=The Guardian|date=28 December 2017|accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref><nowiki></nowiki><ref>{{cite web|title=Rhian Brewster: England and Liverpool striker alleges racial abuse|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42511863|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 December 2017|date=29 December 2017}}</ref> UEFA later ruled that there was insufficient evidence to take further action against Mironov.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-praise-rhian-brewster-courage-14379583|title=Liverpool praise Rhian Brewster for courage during UEFA investigation|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Pearce|first=James|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=7 March 2018}}</ref>
On 12 January 2018, during an U23 match against [[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City]], Brewster received oxygen and had to be stretchered off the field after landing awkwardly following an aerial challenge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rhian-brewster-stretchered-during-liverpool-14150160|title=Rhian Brewster stretchered off during Liverpool U23s match against Man City|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Jones|first=Adam|date=12 January 2018|accessdate=12 January 2018}}</ref> He was later diagnosed with a [[Sprained ankle|high ankle sprain]] and related ligament damage and was ruled out for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-striker-rhian-brewster-confirmed-14156981|title=Liverpool striker Rhian Brewster confirmed with ligament damage|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Kelly|first=Andy|date=15 January 2018|accessdate=16 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/highly-rated-liverpool-striker-rhian-14203567|title=Highly-rated Liverpool striker Rhian Brewster likely to miss rest of the season|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Kelly|first=Andy|date=25 January 2018|accessdate=25 January 2018}}</ref> In March, he had to undergo a second operation in order to repair damage to his knee which he sustained during the same incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-youngster-rhian-brewster-undergoes-14380383|title=Liverpool youngster Rhian Brewster undergoes second operation on ankle injury|website=Liverpool Echo|last=Pearce|first=James|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=7 March 2018}}</ref> Towards the end of the season, Brewster was the subject of intense transfer speculation which culminated in Liverpool cancelling a scheduled friendly against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] after the German club were alleged to have [[Tapping up|tapped]] him up.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/11378817/liverpool-cancel-borussia-m246nchengladbach-game-over-rhian-brewster|title=Liverpool cancel Borussia Mönchengladbach game over Rhian Brewster|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 May 2018|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
In June 2018, he signed a five-year professional contract with Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44522780|title=Rhian Brewster: Liverpool forward agrees new contract|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=18 June 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Brewster is an England youth international and has represented the nation at various youth levels but remains eligible to play for [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] and [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]] as his mother is Turkish Cypriot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://turkish-football.com/revealed-17-year-old-rhian-brewster-makes-liverpool-squad-eligible-represent-turkey/|title=Exclusive: Liverpool wonder-kid Rhian Brewster can represent Turkey|date=23 April 2017|publisher=|last=Sarigul|first=Emre|accessdate=29 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hülya Hassan: Rhian hat-trick yapınca ağladım|url=http://www.halkinsesikibris.com/spor-gundemi/hulya-hassan-rhian-hat-trick-yapinca-agladim-h86169.html|accessdate=30 April 2018|publisher=Halkın Sesi|date=7 November 2017}}</ref>
===England national youth teams=== Having previously represented England at U16 level, Brewster scored six goals in five appearances for [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] in 2016, including a hat-trick against [[Croatia national under-17 football team|Croatia]] and a brace against [[Germany national under-17 football team|Germany]].<ref name=TIA/> He then led the nation's attack at [[2017 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] and featured in the final against [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]]. England ultimately lost on [[penalty shootout|penalties]] with Brewster one of the players who missed his spot-kick.<ref name=AH/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2017/matches/round=2000714/match=2022691/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Spot-on Spain claim record third U17 EURO title|website=UEFA|date=19 May 2017|accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref> He ended the tournament with a return of three goals in six appearances.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2017/teams/player=250104084/index.html|title=Uner-17 - Rhian Brewster|website=UEFA|accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref>
Later that year, Brewster gained widespread press attention <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/28/sports/soccer/premier-league-england.html|title=For England’s Next Generation, Shine of Youth Trophies Only Carries So Far|date=28 December 2017|publisher=|accessdate=28 December 2017|via=www.nytimes.com}}</ref> after scoring successive hat-tricks against the [[United States men's national under-17 soccer team|USA]] and [[Brazil national under-17 football team|Brazil]] in the quarter-final and semi-finals of the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].<ref name=AH/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/25/england-under-17-world-cup-final-rhian-brewster-brazil-match-report|title=England in U17 World Cup final after Rhian Brewster hat-trick sinks Brazil|first=Daniel|last=Harris|date=25 October 2017|newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/team/england-u17/5054/blog/post/3238534/rhian-brewster-announces-himself-with-complete-performance-against-us|title=Brewster announces himself with complete performance against U.S.|last=Selvaraj|first=Jonathan|publisher=[[ESPN]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/england-under-17s-fifa-world-cup-final-vs-brazil-rhian-brewster-liverpool-striker-how-old-who-does-a8019311.html|title=England have reached another World Cup final|date=25 October 2017|publisher=[[The Independent]]}}</ref> He then scored England's opening goal in the final as the team overcame Spain 5–2 to claim the trophy.<ref name=WC>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/28/england-under-17-spain-under-17-world-cup|title=England Under-17s overwhelm Spain to land spectacular World Cup win|first=Will|last=Unwin|date=28 October 2017|publisher=|accessdate=29 October 2017}}</ref> Brewster's return of eight goals for the tournament saw him win the Golden Boot award for the top scorer and he was also awarded the Bronze Ball for his individual performances.<ref name=awards>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/news/y=2017/m=10/news=brewster-foden-lead-individual-honours-2918145.html|title=Brazao, Brewster and Foden lead individual honours|website=FIFA|date=28 October Rhian Brewster: ‘When I’m racially abused, I just want to be left alone’|last=Taylor|first=Daniel|publisher=The Guardian|date=28 December 2017|accessdate=28 December 2017}}</ref>

Under-20s and Academy|Celtic]] | youthyears2 = 2009–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] | years1 = 2012–2013 | clubs1 = [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] | caps1 = 34 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2013–2014 | clubs2 = [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] | caps2 = 36 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2014–2017 | clubs3 = [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] | caps3 = 99 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2017– | clubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps4 = 46 | goals4 = 1 <!--Use domestic league appearances only--> | nationalyears1 = 2013–2015 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalteam1 = [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland U21]] | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalcaps2 = 28 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalteam2 = [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] | club-update = 17:15, 9 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:51, 28 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Andrew Robertson''' (born 11 March 1994) is a Scottish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and captains the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland national team]].
Robertson began his senior career with [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] in 2012 before joining [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] a year later. His form in his first season as a professional led to him being named [[SPFA Young Player of the Year]] and also making his international debut. He joined [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in July 2014 for a fee of £2.85 million, before joining Liverpool in July 2017 for an undisclosed fee, believed to be an initial £8 million.
Robertson made his full international debut for [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] in May 2014, and he was appointed [[list of Scotland national football team captains|Scotland captain]] in September 2018.
==Early life and career== Robertson was born in [[Glasgow]]. He attended [[St Ninian's High School, Giffnock|St Ninian's High School]] in [[Giffnock]], East Renfrewshire, from 2006 to 2012, where he captained the football team. He also played for Giffnock Soccer Centre and joined [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] as a youth, but was released at under-15 level because he was considered to be too small.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/dundee-united-starlet-andy-roberston-2900858|title=Dundee United starlet Andy Roberston: Celtic made a small blunder the day they let me go|work=Daily Record|date=7 December 2013|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref> He then signed for [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]].
==Club career==
===Queen's Park=== Focusing on his studies, Robertson was on the brink of starting university at undergraduate degree level before he was called up to the Queen's Park first team at the beginning of the [[2012–13 in Scottish football|2012–13 season]]. He made his debut for the club in the [[Scottish Challenge Cup]], in a penalty shoot out win against [[Berwick Rangers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19027896 |title=Ramsdens Cup: Berwick Rangers 2–2 Queen's Park (aet, 2–3 pens) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 July 2012 |accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref> He went on to make a total of forty appearances during the season,<ref name="Andrew Robertson">{{cite web|url=http://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/index.asp?tm=124&ID=415|title=Andrew Robertson|accessdate=5 August 2013|date=5 August 2013}}{{dead link|date=June 2015}}{{cbignore}}</ref> helping the club to a third-place finish in the [[2012-13 Scottish Third Division|Scottish Third Division]]. His first goal for the club came in a 2–1 defeat to [[East Stirlingshire F.C.|East Stirlingshire]] on 13 November 2012.<ref name="Andrew Robertson"/>
===Dundee United=== Robertson signed for [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]], along with Queen's Park teammate [[Aidan Connolly]], on 3 June 2013;<ref name="Dundee United sign Robertson and Connolly">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22762888|title=Dundee Utd sign Queen's Park's Robertson and Connolly|accessdate=5 August 2013|date=3 June 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> he took the squad place of the departing [[Barry Douglas]] who had made the same move three years earlier.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/news/2895/BARRY-DOUGLAS-JOINS-UNITED.html|author=|title= Barry Douglas joins United|work=|date=21 June 2010|publisher= [[Dundee United F.C.]] |accessdate=9 January 2019 }}</ref> Having being ignored in their requests for a transfer fee for Douglas, Queen's Park (an amateur club) protested at the prospect of more players departing to United for nothing and eventually agreed a deal involving a percentage of future transfers, which would later prove beneficial.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/13172018.300k-robertson-boost-a-cut-above-for-queens-park/|author=|title= £300k Robertson boost a cut above for Queen's Park|work=The Herald |date=27 July 2014|publisher= |accessdate=9 January 2019 }}</ref>
Robertson immediately became part of manager [[Jackie McNamara]]'s first team plans, making his debut for the club on the opening day of the season in a 0–0 draw with [[Partick Thistle F.C.|Partick Thistle]]. On 22 September 2013, Robertson scored his first goal for Dundee United, in a 2–2 draw against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dundee United 2–2 Motherwell|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24098544|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=23 September 2013}}</ref> He ran from his own half before sending a low left-foot drive in to the goal from 22 yards.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.scotsman.com/sport/football/latest/dundee-utd-2-2-motherwell-ainsworth-stuns-utd-1-3106278 |title=Dundee Utd 2–2 Motherwell: Ainsworth stuns Utd |newspaper= The Scotsman|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=5 August 2014}}</ref> Soon afterwards he agreed a new contract with United, until May 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Dundee secure Robertson extension|url=http://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/index.asp?tm=2&nid=4617&cd=2013|publisher= Dundee United F.C. |date=4 October 2013|accessdate=5 August 2014}}</ref> He was voted [[Scottish Professional Football League monthly awards|SPFL young player of the month]] for September 2013 and player of the month for November 2013.<ref name="pom1113">{{cite news|title=Dundee United defender wins player award|url=http://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/sport/dundee-united/dundee-united-defender-wins-player-award-1.162529|work=Evening Telegraph|date=7 December 2013|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> On 12 April 2014, Robertson played in the [[2013–14 Scottish Cup|Scottish Cup]] Semi-final against [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] at [[Ibrox Stadium|Ibrox]], which United won 3–1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Rangers 1–3 Dundee United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26898652|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Wilson|first=Richard|date=12 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014}}</ref> In April 2014, Robertson won the [[PFA Scotland Young Player of the Year]] award<ref name="ypoy14">{{cite news|title=Three Celtic players make player of year shortlist|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27052382|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Andrew Robertson: Dundee United defender wins PFA prize|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27183894|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 April 2014|accessdate=17 May 2014}}</ref> and was also named in the [[PFA Scotland Team of the Year]] for the [[2013–14 Scottish Premiership]].<ref name="toy14">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27080030|title=Celtic and Dundee United trios in SPFL Premiership team of year|date=18 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014|publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref>
===Hull City=== [[File: Andy Robertson (19596759769).jpg|thumb|upright|Robertson playing for [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in 2015]]
In July 2014, Dundee United accepted an offer of £2.85 million for Robertson from English [[Premier League]] club [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28442322 |title=Andrew Robertson: Dundee United agree fee with Hull City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 July 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014 |first=Jim |last=Spence}}</ref> The transfer was completed on 29 July, as Robertson signed a three-year contract with Hull.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/dundee-united/284200-andrew-robertson-completes-transfer-from-dundee-united-to-hull/ |title=Andrew Robertson completes transfer from Dundee United to Hull|work=STV Sport|date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref> He made his competitive debut on the opening day of the season in a 1–0 victory away to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|QPR]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2726678/QPR-0-1-Hull-City-Charlie-Austin-rues-penalty-miss-James-Chester-beats-Rio-Ferdinand-ball-head-home-winner.html|title=QPR 0–1 Hull City: Charlie Austin rues penalty miss as James Chester beats Rio Ferdinand to the ball to head home winner|website=Daily Mail|last=Mokbel|first=Sami|date=16 August 2014|accessdate=16 August 2014}}</ref> Robertson quickly settled at Hull and established himself in the side, winning the club's Player of the Month award for August 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Robertson|first1=Neil|title=Andrew Robertson named Hull City's player of the month|url=http://www.thecourier.co.uk/sport/football/dundee-united/andrew-robertson-named-hull-city-s-player-of-the-month-1.581056|publisher=The Courier (Dundee)|accessdate=24 November 2014|date=17 September 2014}}</ref> His first goal for City came on 3 November 2015 away to [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] where he opened the scoring in a 2–0 win to put Hull top of the table on goal difference.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34644748|title=Brentford 0–2 Hull|date=3 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> Robertson started the [[2016 Football League play-offs#Championship|2016 Championship Play-off Final]] against [[Sheffield Wednesday]], which Hull won 1–0 to secure promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Williams |title=Hull City 1–0 Sheffield Wednesday |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36348885 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2016 |accessdate=22 December 2017}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 21 July 2017, Robertson signed a long-term deal with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for an initial fee of £8 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=Andrew Robertson: Liverpool sign defender from Hull City for £10m|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40666486|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 July 2017|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/269167-liverpool-fc-complete-andy-robertson-signing|title=Liverpool FC complete Andy Robertson signing|date=21 July 2017|publisher=Liverpool FC|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref> On 19 August, he made his debut in a 1–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/andy-robertson-thanks-liverpool-fans-13501385|title=Robertson thanks Liverpool fans after impressing on Reds debut|last=Gorst|first=Paul|date=19 August 2017|work=liverpoolecho|accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref> Robertson started the 2017–18 season as understudy to [[Alberto Moreno]], but got a run of games when the Spaniard was injured in December. His performance in the 4–3 victory against league leaders [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 14 January earned praise from the Liverpool supporters.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/klopps-patience-key-andy-robertson-14164148|title=Klopp's patience was key for Andy Robertson and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain|last=Jones|first=Paul|date=16 January 2018|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=22 January 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on the final match day of the 2017–18 season against [[Brighton and Hove Albion | Brighton]] in a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44020158|title=Salah breaks record as Liverpool secure top four spot|last=Jennings|first=Patrick|date=13 May 2018|work=|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=13 May 2018}}</ref>
Robertson continued to play regularly for Liverpool during the 2018–19 season.<ref name = "contract"/> He signed a new contract with the club in January 2019, which is due to run until 2024.<ref name = "contract">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46911501 |title=Andy Robertson: Liverpool & Scotland defender signs new contract until 2024 |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2019 |accessdate=18 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Robertson was first selected by the [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland under-21 team]] in October 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24352061|title=Billy Stark names Scotland Under-21 squad for Euro 2015 ties|date=1 October 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He made his debut as a substitute in a 2–1 win against [[Slovakia national under-21 football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/teams/player=250066157/index.html|title=Under-21 – Andrew Robertson – UEFA}}</ref> Robertson was selected for the under-21 team in November 2015, as the full national team did not have a fixture.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34701509 |title=Scotland U21s include Andy Robertson for Ukraine match |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 November 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref>
Robertson was first named in the full [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] squad for a friendly against [[Poland national football team|Poland]] on 5 March 2014. He came on as a substitute in the second half, as Scotland won 1–0 in Warsaw.<ref name = "poland"/> Scotland manager [[Gordon Strachan]] said afterwards "Andy came on there and the first time he picked it up he drove about 30 yards. I thought 'that's fantastic'. Absolutely no grey area, I'm going to do what I do. I loved seeing that first touch."<ref name = "poland">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/05/poland-scotland-friendly-international-match-report |title=Scott Brown late show gives Scotland impressive win over Poland in Warsaw |work=The Guardian |date=5 March 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref> Robertson made his first start for the national team in a 2–2 draw with [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] on 28 May 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383284 |quote=Scotland's new-look back four, which included Dundee United's Andrew Robertson making his first international start, found themselves under pressure when they conceded possession to Uchebo but Allan McGregor saved the shot. |title=Nigeria 2–2 Scotland |first=Andy |last=Campbell |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref>
Robertson scored his first international goal in a friendly against [[England national football team|England]] at [[Celtic Park]] in November 2014, scoring Scotland's only goal as they were beaten 3–1.<ref name = "eng goal">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29999555|title=Scotland 1 – 3 England|date=18 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref>
On 3 September 2018, Robertson was appointed as [[List of Scotland national football team captains|Scotland captain]] by manager [[Alex McLeish]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/314927-andy-robertson-scotland-captain|title=Andy Robertson appointed new Scotland captain|publisher=Liverpool FC|last=Shaw|first=Chris|date=3 September 2018|accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> After a 2–1 defeat against [[Israel national football team|Israel]] in October 2018, Robertson said that both he and fellow left-back [[Kieran Tierney]] were being played out of position in the 3–5–2 system adopted by [[Alex McLeish]] to accommodate both players.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45832123 |title=Andy Robertson: Kieran Tierney and I are 'both out of position' |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 October 2018 |accessdate=13 October 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Robertson is engaged to his girlfriend, Rachel Roberts.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/showbiz-news/meet-new-everton-livepool-wags-13305301|title=Meet the new Everton and Liverpool WAGS|last=McCoid|first=Sophie|date=4 August 2017|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=4 September 2018|quote=...his girlfriend Rachel Roberts is due to give birth to the couple's first child.}}</ref> Roberts gave birth to their son, Rocco, on 26 August 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/andy-robertson-reveals-liverpool-icon-11090277|title=Andy Robertson reveals Liverpool icon Kenny Dalglish told him he's got his back|last=McDermott|first=Scott|date=1 September 2017|work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]|accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> In January 2019 Roberts gave birth to their second child, Aria.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-victory-perfect-end-special-15672380|title=Liverpool victory was perfect end to special week for Andy Robertson|last=Pearce|first=James|date=13 January 2019|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=22 January 2019}}</ref>
In March 2018, Robertson donated a signed Liverpool shirt of his teammate [[Roberto Firmino]] to a young boy who had given his pocket money to a local [[food bank]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/scotland/43324198 |title=Andrew Robertson gifts Liverpool top to young fan for making foodbank donation |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 March 2018 |accessdate=9 March 2018}}</ref>
